The place us small but perfection you are going to be out and about most of the day. Bedroom was perfect and cleaned and the staff was super helpful.
What I liked the most was that it is two blocks away from Grand Central station. I was traveling alone with my cousin and this made things easier for us.
There was a lot of things around and we felt safe coming

title: Great hotel at location you can’t beat.
text: Great hotel in great location. The room was clean and comfortable (not very large but this is Manhattan…), the bed was good and large enough for 2 tall persons, and the lounge at the top floor with free and rather good coffee is wonderful. We were particularly happy with the handheld shower (why oh why do so many hotels have showers fixed to the wall ?? How does one wash their hair without pretzeling around to fit under a shower fixed at chin height?), a window that actually opened, and housekeeping on demand rather than automatically every day. The filtered water you can tap at will is also great, need to stay hydrated! Very friendly staff. We were here as a couple but this would also be a solid business hotel. We will definitely be back here.

title: Settimana a Manhattan
text:
Posizione veramente favorevole di fronte alla stazione Grand Central, al centro di Manatthan (meno di 10 minuti a piedi da Fifth Avenue) ma in zona poco rumorosa (rispetto ad altre zone, non scordiamoci che siamo a Manatthan). 
Molto positiva la presenza di dispenser di acqua e all’ultimo piano macchinetta pet bevande calde e zona relax o per mangiare pasti da asporto.
Camera di dimensioni decenti ma armadio piccolo e manca una base d’appoggio per valige o altro.
Pulizia non giornaliera se non richiesta purtroppo.

title: Clean, great location, & great service
text: The hotel was extremely clean and comfortable. The location could not have been any better. It was extremely close to Grand Central Station, making it so easy to get on the Subway and get wherever we needed very quickly. The people who worked there were extremely helpful. We had a small indecent in the room and needed to get into a new room. The front desk attendant was very helpful and we were able to get into a new room quickly and without any fuss. If I come back I will 100% stay here.

title: A very good choice
text:
I have nothing bad to say. Location was great, rooms were clean, everything worked as it should and the laudry room was nice.

The staff was amazing! Got so much help from them that it made our trip perfect. They really had a good vibe that you get when ppl do their job with their whole heart. I would like to send special thanks to Mark, Mark-Anthony, Sofiana and Victor who were at the front desk. They were super friendly and helped us with every little (and a bit bigger!) problem we had. Simply amazing customer service! 

Also the room was clean and cozy, everything we were looking for. The views from the room as well as from the rooftop lounge were phenomenal. Water bottles that the hotel provided were essential and also the opportunity to do laundry was really nice.

The primary reason we got this hotel was the location, and it was really worth it. Perfect for ppl with a walking disability.

title: Awesome experience!
text: I was in NY for business meetings for 8 days and it was a nice experience at the Hotel. All the staff are friendly and helpful! Loved the 27 floor lounge area. Had a lot of different kinds of coffee free of charge and Also had my dinner in this area. Wifi was good as I had to take some calls in the early morning hours.

title: Great Value
text: Great value, location and staff. Very good sized room for the price. Cool view from the lounge. Would be nice if there was an option for breakfast, but there are many places around to get breakfast anyway. All in all a great experience, would highly recommend.

title: Ottimo
text:
Ottimo hotel in centro a Manhattan! Camera confortevole con frigorifero, macchinetta del caffè e microonde, acqua in bottiglia ai piani, 27 piano con grande locale x rilassarsi o/e mangiare con caffè a disposizione.
Pulizia camere solo su richiesta, buona soluzione x poter risparmiare e garantire la privacy dei clienti a cui non interessa il letto rifatto dai dipendenti dell’hotel!!

title: Very Comfortable
text: Great location, a minute or two from Grand Central. Staff friendly, courteous and professional. Quiet, clean room. Great shower. Plenty of towels. And they have wash cloths!! Wish they had in room safes. Would definitely stay here again.

title: Excellent overall -- Loved the top floor lounge
text: Check in went well in a surprisingly small lobby and front desk area. Speedy elevators with security key access required.  Room was well represented in photos on hotel website.  Space is well designed.  Mediocre view from room was through a filthy window (outside).  Bottles with water refill on floor handy and appreciated.  Just enough heat in hot water for a comfortable shower.  However the handle fell off the shower control and the hand held only shower is a bit of a challenge to get the water where  want when not in your hand. Loved the top floor lounge with espresso machine!

title: Highly recommended
text: My sister recommended it and I was kinda reluctant but I have to say I experienced the thrill by staying in Club Quarters Hotel Grand Central. It is combination of a great location (Grand Central!!), so close to work, fabulous personnel, great service, etc. Do yourself a favour and stay here next time you are in town (:

title: Great location, OK room, checkin problems
text: An unbeatable location if visiting the city. Check in kiosk works great, but the hotel made us us wait too long to get to our room long despite publicized start check in time is quite clear when making the reservation.   Dishonesty trying to get late checkout fee out of guests.

title: Very good location, value for money.
text: Received service which can be valued as value for money in the area hotel is located. Good location being close to Grand Central station and in walkable distance to places in Manhattan. If you don't need breakfast and other extras, this is the place.

title: Just OK
text:
This hotel is OK - that is all that I can say.....
My daughter and I booked a trip last minute for a weekend of BWAY shows-the hotel we usually book was out of our budget.  CQ was clean, a bit battered (marks on the walls, the bathroom door was a mess) - cosmetic stuff that we are not used to.  The staff seemed overwhelmed at check in but we were the only ones there (I am not sure if something happened 10 minutes before).  Our TV lost service on the last night - phone did not work to call the desk.  
It was good enough for a place to sleep!  If I was going to try CQ again, might try the one closer to Times Square - looked MUCH nicer!

title: We’ll be back!
text: Quaint hotel on 45th and Lexington. Extremely clean, new & modern furnishings, helpful and friendly staff. Really appreciated the purified water stations. The lounge on the 27th floor was a nice bonus as well. Exceeded our expectations!

title: Very good placed
text: Perfect hotel to visit Manhattan, near to Grand Central. Many options for eat near there. Staff is very kindly. The living room and the terrace in 27th floor are wonderfull. Lobby room is very small, but it wasn't a problem. Negative point about the frecuency to clean the room. Only 2 times in 7 days, in our case.

title: We had a great stay, just a few amenities that would have made it excellent
text:
We had a great stay. The staff was very helpful and positive, which really made a difference. The only drawbacks were that we did not have any place to sit in the lobby. Friends were staying at another CQ down the road and had a lovely lobby space to sit and wait, as well as apps and drinks on certain nights. Also, the two things missing were - a breakfast option - something small/continental would have been great. Also, a fridge in the room would have been a nice addition. 

Other than those small things, we had a great experience. We just wish there were CQs in Europe!

title: Perfect locations and some great added extras
text: This is a great place, rooms are basic but clean and perfect for what you need it for. What makes this place  stand out is the lovely roof top terrace and lounge that serve free teas and coffees, good tea and coffee too and water and ice. When you see the price of coffee you will see why this is good! They even have free bottles with filtered water on every floor. The other equal best thing is the staff, very friendly and helpful. Great location, couldn’t have asked for more to be fair.

title: An attractive, clean, comfortable, well-managed hotel by Grand Central Station
text:
CQ Grand Central is a well-managed, comfortable hotel located around the corner from Grand Central. Rooms are clean and large enough, room windows open (so none of that I-am-trapped-in-an-fishbowl feeling), the terrace and the lounge on the top are wonderful for relaxing, and the business area downstairs is great for meetings and work.  
This is mid-town Manhattan, so streets are never quiet, but I slept soundly (on a high floor). cotton sheets, comfortable bed and pillows.
All front desk staff are awesome, but Loondy stands out even among them as particularly competent, professional, friendly, and warm.

title: Club Quarters was clean and friendly
text: It was a great hotel, the staff was friendly! I did not have one issue with the hotel and they were able to get me what I needed. Would love to stay here again. The fact that they had free coffee and water I was happy

title: Great Location
text: Great location, far enough from the new year madness around Times Square, but an easy 1 mile walk anywhere. Plus, you could hop on the subway shuttle at Grand Central and get to 42nd Street station super easily and have access there to the whole subway system, Penn Station etc

title: Excellent! Made NY feel like home.
text: This hotel made NY feel like home. Friendly staff, great room area, clean, warm, cosy, comfortable bed and all areas common areas were equally clean and cosy. Location is perfect. The hotel has a common area on the 27th floor which offers at all times warm beverages (coffee and tea), offering as well a great view for the city and a great place to relax. Internet worked great. I recommend this hotel.

title: Good sport in NYC
text:
Good location - clean/nice room - friendly staff - that’s just what I needed for a short stay in NYC

A lot of hotel rooms in NYC are tiny - while this certainly was not huge it was a comfortable size

I’d recommend this place for all of the reasons above !

title: Perfectly Pleasant
text: Everyone was welcoming, kind, even some lovely sarcasm which I greatly enjoy. The room was clean, great amenities and anything we needed was promptly received. We also had a nice view and didn’t know what to expect in that arena. We walked and took the subway everywhere from Laguardia to The Bronx to Brooklyn. The espresso machine was working off and on up on the top floor but hey, it’s Manhattan and there’s amazing coffee all around. Head to Little Collins around the corner for an americano with cream and you’ll be feeling just fine. Great stay, would definitely stay again. Thanks

title: Cosy and comfortable
text:
Comfortable and quiet room even though it was facing the street. 
Great view of NYC from the roof.
Very nice and helpful staff at reception!
Only complaint, the room was a bit small compared to the pictures and for the price I paid, but I guess it is the way it goes in NYC...

title: Clean and perfect location!!
text:
The hotel is very clean, all areas, very quiet, perfect location next to many atractions and near the Central Station. 

The personal at the front desk are excellent. Guve you the rights informations. 

From the hoyel you can go walking to the rockerfeller center, see all the greats  stores in the 5th av. 

The lounge very clean and nice uper views.

title: Great location and bed in midtown nyc…
text: Fantastic location. Cozy room. Amazing bed. Great water pressure, but bathroom is a little cozy. The fixed to the floor table is more in the way than at all useful. Elevator noise is a reality but not too much a nuisance. Top floor space has beautiful view, and water system on each floor. Staff is outstanding. Price point can be steep for the total value, but perfect with a deal… can never get the in phone key app to work, and the only thing the staff didn’t know.

title: Good for the price
text: I chose the Club Quarters Hotel Grand Central to spend two nights in the city after a trip to Europe before continuing home to the west. The hotel was as expected, I've stayed at the brand elsewhere. The neighborhood is quieter that before the pandemic but everything  I needed was nearby. However, there was laundry snafu still UNRESOLVED. A customer service link/email using their website was never answered. I'd stay there again if their room rate was fair; would I send laundry out? NO!

title: Did the job but beds uncomfortable and rooms crying out for renovation
text:
Good location very near to Grand Central Station.

Overall the hotel did the job but the rooms were very dated and in desperate need of renovation.
It’s not somewhere I would stay a second time as the beds were not comfortable. 

The amenities also need improvement and we could’ve done with a fridge and a safe in the room.

Overall the staff were very polite and happy to help where they could.

title: Great value for money hotel
text: Our second CQ hotel in Manhattan a great location, close to all the action, and a great price to match. The lounge on the top floor is great, free coffee for everyone. The staff were really helpful and pleasant. The rooms themselves were average and tired, but this is reflected in the fair price. A fridge in the room would have been welcome (we hade one in the CQ World Trade Centre).

title: Very Good Option For Visiting Manhattan
text: Very good hotel close to Central Station which is both convenient and slightly away from the crowds. Appreciate that NYC is super expensive but the room ended up being slightly larger than expected and really appreciated the club room on the top floor with free coffee and areas to relax inside and out with views of the city.

title: Cultural weekend in NYC
text:
Hotel was fine. Coffee available in lounge. No restaurants in hotel. All was clean. Great location.
Only complaint was hotel double billing me, after I had a prepaid reservation. Took over a week, and several phone calls and emails to straighten it out

title: Clean, friendly, convenient, affordable
text: The staff here was truly so kind, and the rooftop balcony/lounge overlooking the city was stunning! Will definitely be back, and was so glad to have stayed here for a stressful business conference. Thank you!

title: Perfect for a work trip!
text: The room was clean & comfortable! Guests services was helpful - - it had everything I needed for a work trip. I will definitely be staying at Club Quarters Hotel Grand Central, New York again - I've already booked 3 more times.

title: Average hotel
text: Hotel was nice, rooms were nice. Water dispenser in hallway was amazing. We did have an issue where we couldn't reach hotel for 3 weeks before trip because their "system was down". This was frustrating

title: Perfect Stay
text:
Visited New York with my sister recently and cannot fault the hotel at all. Perfect location within walking distance of most of the typical tourist attractions and transport links. Comfortable room, which was a great size for the two of us with a TV and lounge/sofa area, and all the necessary amenities. Every member of the team we encountered during our stay was friendly and helpful, which made the stay that much more enjoyable.

If I’m ever visiting the city again I’m highly likely to use the hotel again, and wouldn’t hesitate to recommend it to anyone looking to visit!

title: Great hotel in the city center
text: Great location, though a bit noisy in the evening hours. No breakfast facilities, but a number of great coffee bars are close by. Easily reachable by public transport. The view on the 27th floor is magnificent.

title: AC doesn't work and staff won't help
text: My AC stopped working in the middle of the night and began blasting heat. Front desk wouldn't pick up and no one came to fix the issue even after using their text support. Wouldn't recommend staying here.

title: Great stay for business trip
text:
Compared to the overall quality of hotels in Manhattan and quality/ price ratio, this is very good. The room is spacious, clean, well-equipped. The whole guest check-in check-out experience is a bit impersonal but that’s just NY! Some of the staff at reception is a bit blasé - could work oh customer service quality. 
I had a great sleep - as horrible as the view from the room was (some kind of factory I think), at least, it was silent. General noise levels in the hotel were low which again is singular enough in Manhattan to mention!
You have to request the room clean-up if you want it - it’s free but not automatic.
A few cons: the room was very dark (had to have lights on even during the day); the USB plug next to the bed didn’t work;   Could do with a few more plugs given the size of the room. 

Overall, I am satisfied with my stay and would happily come back :)

title: Excelente estadia
text: Segunda vez que nos hospedamos lá e sempre muito bom. Hotel novo, cheiroso, ótimos funcionários, muito bem localizado. Fizemos tudo a pé, só pegamos metro para ir na estátua. Além disso, é do lado da Grand Central. Tem ótimos lugares para comer lá perto. A 15 minutos da Times Square e a 7 minutos da quinta avenida. Vale a pena!

title: Great location
text: This CQ suite has many amenities, incl. laundry and a small gym. Too bad that the breakfast buffet service has not been restarted post-Covid, like many other places have done. Kiosks were not working for check in/out.

title: Needed a day to understand
text: As checked in we were disappointed by the tiny lobby and room but everything else I have to say is perfect: location, services and the common terrace and living room spaces came of great help the last day of our stay

title: Excellent hotel
text:
The location is perfect near Grand Central station, from where you can reach all of NYC by metro, many attractions are close enough to walk, like Times Square, Central Park, Empire State building, Rockefeller Center (best observation deck!), MoMA.
Rooms are clean, service is excellent. No breakfast (bring your own take away to dining room)
A bit pricy, but hey it's NYC ;-)

title: Very central location but rooms are tight
text: Very easy location in mid town, close to the subway and a CVS. However, rooms are tiny, and beds aren’t super comfortable. Hotel has virtually no lobby! Corridors are narrow and lifts took forever to arrive.

title: Excelente hotel
text: Excelente ubicación, muy buena atención, es justo y preciso para Nueva York. Ideal para parejas que van a recorrer y llegar al hotel a descansar. La limpieza de todas las zonas es muy buena. Tienes negocios cercas para comer, a pasos de la 5ta avenida.

title: Old hotel needs renovation
text:
Second time at this hotel. First time was in 2019 and, honestly my stay was ok. It's a good location but the hotel must be renovated. My suite had a very old and broken sofa where my son had, unfortunately, to sleep for 7 nights. The shower was almost broken too and, despite I reported (twice) it to the staff, who completely disregarded it.
I would return in that hotel as long as the price goes down. It is too much expensive for what it offers.

title: It was a friendly, nice and quiet environment.
text: The place is very convenient to the convention center which is a plus. You can also do your laundry for free with laundry condiments ready for use for free. It has a big and comfortable lobby with free of choice of hot drinks. The wifi is free and fast.

title: Tops in Every Way
text: The room was perfect for my weekend visit - very clean, efficient design and well-appointed. Staff was very helpful. Location near Grand Central great for transportation, dining and sight-seeing. We will be staying there again!

title: Memorable
text: A lovely hotel, with very welcoming staff. Nothing was too much trouble. We requested extra pillows and had them in 5 mins. The room was lovely,spacious and very clean. The bathroom was spotless and had very good products. The viewing deck was fabulous and had a great variety of teas and coffees. Lovely to go home up any time and look over the city

title: Nothing works
text:
The first night the TV didn’t work at all and I needed to be able to watch the hurricane progression for work so I changed rooms. In the new room the TV worked intermittently. Sometimes it would play then just shut off. The third day, things were going smoothly until I wanted to take a shower before bed. Only a trickle of water came from the shower. Only hot water came from the faucet over the sink. I had to try not to get scalded while washing my face and I brushed my teeth with bottled water. I called the front desk and the guy was nice but could only offer me a new room (again). I’m checking out at 8am tomorrow so packing up now only to do it again in 9 hours isn’t appealing. 

Oh, and the phones don’t work. A letter was stuck under our door that says it’s a system outage. 

The place is falling apart.

title: Hotel Computer System Down for 2 Weeks, Made Us Write Credit Card Information on Paper
text:
I stayed at the hotel in mid-September, 2022, after having stayed there a couple of months earlier with no issue. When I arrived, the check-in staff told me their payment processing system had been down for 2 weeks with no ETA for being fixed, and as a result all guests had to write credit card numbers down on a piece of paper so the charges could be done at some point in the future.

I won't go on about the technology challenges other than to say how utterly pathetic they are -- total "armature hour" for an established hotel chain. It wasn't the fault of the staff working at the desk -- they actually were trying really hard to make things go smoothly and were very apologetic. But the management seemed to give them no support and showed no care. 

I emailed the company about this, partially wanting to know what was being done to safeguard my personal financial information but got no response. Quite frankly, I'm disgusted by this.

Do yourself a favor and stay somewhere else.

title: Hotel Basico
text:
El hotel esta muy bien ubicado, a una cuadra de Grand Central asi que eso fue un placer!
El lobby es ínfimo… se acumula gente en dos minutos. El sistema no funcionaba asi que fue complicado, no anduvo en toda la semana asi que nunca lográbamos que nos dieran un recibo hasta último minuto peleando por eso. Los empleados desbordados.
El cuarto chico, limpio, pero no lo limpian todos los dias.
Lo mejor la terraza, lugar divino con una vista increíble y con servicio de cafe 24 horas.

title: A great hotel in an excellent location for exploring New York!
text:
I like Club Quarters hotels.  They present a good standard of affordable accommodation, are clean, and are located well.  In New York City the Club Quarters World Trade Center is my hotel of choice, but on my last trip I had the opportunity to stay at the Club Quarters Grand Central.  It was a very pleasant stay indeed.  Whilst the check-in area is quite small, and got a bit crowded with people checking in,  the process was  reasonably efficient and  staff were welcoming and helpful.

The room was a small suite, suitable for three people and very spacious and comfortable.  There was a separate bedroom with a corner view up Lexington Avenue and along E45th Street.  It contained a lounge area with a sofa bed, and a kitchenette with microwave and coffee machine.  It was comfortable,  spacious, spotlessly clean, and met our needs perfectly.   We had access to an iron and board, and the wifi was of good download speed.

The hotel has a spacious lounge area on the 27th floor, with coffee machine and drinking fountains, comfortable seating and work stations.   It’s well-appointed and well lit, and a great place in which to relax after a day of sightseeing, or to work.  The wifi is also good, and there are plenty of power outlets.  

The hotel is in a great location for exploring New York City, and is only a short walk from Grand central Terminal, for train and subway access.

We enjoyed our stay here and recommend this hotel.

title: Go elsewhere
text: We chose this place based on proximity to Grand Central. Upon arrival, there was a line out of the door to check in.  Apparently the merger of Boutique Grand Central and Club Quarters yielded a mishap in their computer system.  They made a very small lobby hoping to limit check in to only an IPAD checkin. But computers were non functional so everything had to be manual.  The rest of the weekend was a mess  - the staff were completely powerless to improve efficiency.  Rooms very very small (even by NY standards).  No bar, no workout area, no lobby, no space to get coffee, nothing except a bunch of small rooms and 3 folks in a small lobby.

title: DIY executed in the extreme with tired accommodations despite central location
text:
I only had a passing familiarity with Club Quarters from their San Francisco hotel near the Embarcadero. It looked like a reasonably furnished mid-scale hotel from the lobby, so I decided that it might be worthwhile to reserve a Standard room for Jamie W. and me in their Grand Central location for the New York leg of our vacation. As it turned out, our non-stop flight from Oslo was cancelled due to a pilot strike, and we had to take three flights to get to the hotel.

Twelve hours later than planned, we were so dog tired by the time we arrived close to midnight that I felt disappointed to see there was no lobby, just a young guy at a computer. It looked like a small office building. He did confirm our reservation and then made us create our own key cards. When we finally got to our room, we were further disappointed to see our accommodation looked like a well-worn dorm room with the carpet clearly on its last legs.

What was worse was that it was a sweltering 96 degrees, and the air conditioner was broken. When I reported it, he said he couldn't change our room and that he'd get a repairman fix it the following morning. Eventually it improved marginally, but the spartan room was still a sauna. We tried to spend as little time as possible in there by using their guest lounge area on the 27th floor. However, it was frequently crowded like a bus terminal.

Especially popular was the outdoor terrace which did offer nice views. Bottom line, this was truly a business hotel for the low-demand company employee. The nightly rate was around $210, which we thought was reasonable until we experienced all the trade-offs. I can only recall two upsides: (1) the convenient location at 45th and Lexington; and (2) the attentive service we received from one of the staff, Loondy. Beyond those points, I can't think of a reason to return.

title: Perfect!
text: The room is big, clean, with amazing views. The bathroom is so luminous, the shower is clean and the wc is so confortable. My only is the bed and the pillow. The bed is small and makes you go to the middle and the pillow is so bad.. Anyway you have all you need to enjoy your stay!

title: Poor customer service
text: Their reservations system was out for over 24 hours and check-in was done manually. At 12.38 AM someone phoned, waking me up, to ask me my name because I hadn’t checked in properly!? Because of the bad bed and noise it took me well over an hour to get back to sleep. Good shower, generally clean, but no food, no in-room safe, no hairdryer, and definitely does not deserve its rating.

title: Very solid hotel
text: I stayed here over Labor Day weekend. Great location; walking distance to everything. Yet, farther from the crowdiness. Safe location. Clean room, comfortable bed. Friendly and professional staff. I was able to check-in early with no problems nor extra fees. I would definitely stay here again when I visit NYC in the future.

title: Really impressed with our stay at club quarters
text:
As soon as we checked in the girl in the desk made us feel so welcome. She was chatty telling us all about the area we were staying in. The room although not huge was fine and about as big as you can expect in Manhattan. Right next to central station it was ideal for exploring. 

The roof area was such a bonus. Never packed and tbe coffee was great. 

I have already looked up where there are other Club Quaters and really hope the service is as good as the one at Grand Central.

title: Mediocre Hotel well located...
text: Noise Hotel, mediocre service, poor check-in/out, staff distracted not caring for guests, small rooms. Lits of noise from street and near construction, had to change room to higher floor,. Good location.

title: Was a great day
text: From the moment I walked into the hotel 7am I was greeted with kindness I noticed the hotel was going through system error had to do everything manually which I know it’s a headache overall the staff had everything under control they kindly explain what was going on everything checked in smoothly. staff was on point  👍🏼

title: Very Nice Grand Central Hotel
text: I just got back from two day stay at this hotel for my quick NYC trip to see US Open and Met-Dodger game. The location was great for me because it was 5-minute walk to Grand Central Station to catch the #7 train to Queens. The lobby staff was very nice and helpful with answers to my questions. Checking in and out was quick and efficient and there is mobile check in-out available. This is small hotel so there are not places to eat in the hotel. My room was moderate size and was in good conditions. There is ample closet space and drawers to put away clothes. The bed was comfortable, and I got a good night's sleep during my visit. The bathroom had stand in shower which I personally prefer over tub. I liked the amenity of every floor having a "water station" where you can fill up bottle with cold water repeatedly. I wanted to get a cab when I left for JFK and the lobby staff calls a number and gets one for you, waited only 2-3 minutes. The only slight negative is the room does not have a safe to put some valuables. Finally, the price was reasonable for a NYC hotel, and I would recommend staying here if you are on business or pleasure trip.

title: Noisy
text: Bad price quality value. Extremely noisy (street) throughput the entire night. Beds were not comfortable. Small room without safe or mini bar. Good location and friendly staff, but still not worth it.

title: Club Quarters Grand Central
text: Lobby and housekeeping staff pleasant, available, and helpful. Great location walkable to Grand Central. Appreciated comfort, cleanliness, covered terrace, lounge area, coffee machine, and refillable water station.

title: spectacular stay
text: Many thanks to the entire team at the CQ NYC hotel, especially Ms. Kailyn. They were all very kind, making our stay a success. God willing next year we will return and we would like to meet everyone again

title: Club Quarters near Grand Central Station
text:
Sorry to say this hotel isn't worth staying at for the price per night. I was disappointed.
The room smelled musty.
The bed sunk in when sleeping.
The cable TV goes out quite often. (They don't have anyone after hours to fix the issue.  If they do come they didn't seem confident),
The room phone wasn't working.
You have to check-out in person.  The text message to check-out online using the app doesn't work.
The hotel personnel was sleeping sitting down when we were checkout.
Not every floor water dispenser is cold.
The laundry device is an all in one.  Not very user friendly.  If computed in correctly it could take 3 hours for wash and dry.
This is a no frills hotel but expensive.
The 27th floor open area is very nice.  This was the only amenity that was worth speaking of.
It is located close to the Grand Central Station.

title: Great Location with Rooftop Terrace
text: We have stayed here several times in the past three years as our son attends Fordham Rosehill campus. The location is excellent as it is near Grand Central Terminal and is a quick train ride to Fordham. Another draw, is its rooftop terrace on the 27th floor. Since the pandemic, there has been no wine and cheese hour, however, to be able to take out food and eat there while enjoying the view is a plus!! We have stayed in several different types of rooms but Room 1504 has been the nicest (see pix). The downside to this small hotel is when you have a quick question and it is during check-in/checkout time and there’s only one front desk person.

title: Great
text: For a quick couple of nights in NYC, this is a great choice. The staff were helpful and made check-in and out easy, and the rooms were air conditioned, clean and remarkably quiet. The great thing about this place (and why I chose it) is its location, right in the centre of Manhattan, close to Grand Central. I didn't sample any of the facilities such as the bar or the gym, but staff were keen to let me know they were there, and had I been staying for longer, I'd definitely have sampled them.

title: Bien situé, grande chambre
text: Hôtel bien situé, près de Times Square (13 minutes) mais suffisant à l’écart pour être tranquille. 20 minutes Central Park. La terrasse est parfaite pour boire un verre et manger une pizza ou une salade du Amish Market à deux coins de rues. Nous avions une chambre avec cuisinette très pratique et suffisamment grande pour 3 ou 4 personnes. Le mobilier est un peu usé mais on l’oublie rapidement ;) Personnel très courtois.

title: Perfect location and hotel
text:
The location is perfect right by grand central and the Chrysler building. But at the same time it is quiet and relaxing. The rooms and bathroom were big for a NYC room and so clean.
I would stay here again!!!

title: Отвратительный опыт
text:
450$ в сутки плюс налоги?!!! 😡 Самый плохой и дорогостоящий опыт за всю мою жизнь.  Номера малюсенькие , очень старая мебель , грязное и рваное покрытие на полу , шумный кондиционер , который не регулируется по интенсивности . Номер с мини-кухней , но при заселении не было посуды , потом принесли пластиковые стаканы , одну чашку чайную на троих!!! , 2 вилки и тупой нож. Уборка производится по заказу - раз в 4!!! дня.
При заселении на полу в ванной огромная лужа - протекал унитаз, очень сильный напор в душе, который тоже не регулируется. Нет геля для душа только кусочек мыла с ноготь величиной.
Из плюсов- отличная работа сотрудников на ресепшен, терасса с потрясающим видом , кулер с водой в бутылках и супер локация .
Не рекомендую .

$450 per night plus taxes?!!!  😡 Worst and most expensive experience of my entire life.  The rooms are tiny , very old furniture , dirty and torn floors , noisy air conditioning , which is not adjustable in intensity .  A room with a kitchenette, but there were no utensils upon check-in, then they brought plastic glasses, one cup of tea for three!!!  , 2 forks and a dull knife.  Cleaning is done on request - once every 4!!!  day.
When checking in, there was a huge puddle on the floor in the bathroom - the toilet was leaking, a very strong pressure in the shower, which is also not regulated.  No shower gel, just a bar of soap the size of a fingernail.
Of the pluses, the excellent work of the staff at the reception, a terrace with a stunning view, a cooler with bottled water and a super location.
I do not recommend.

title: overprice hotel
text: I did not get the room booked, overpriced, misleading pictures, the first room smells a cigarrete, the second  smells like a ditch, noisy, unautorized charges were made on mi credit card; broken furniture. In general a very unpleasant experience. I made a written claim but it was not answered.

title: CQ - Horrible
text: CQ Grand Central is like sleeping in a closet.  There is NO housekeeping services, the lobby is like a prison visitor check in.  The staff are rude, the bathroom is tiny and shower leaks all over the floor;  DO NOT STAY HERE!!!  Pay an extra $100.00 per night and stay at the Hyatt around the corner on Lexington Ave.

title: Parfait - hyper central
text:
Hotel vraiment hyper bien situé à grand central donc très central ! : plein de choses à 15/20 minutes dont Time square, the summit, rockfeller center, nations unies et Central Park à 20/25 minutes. De nombreuses lignes de métro au pied de l’hôtel 
Chambre familiale idéale à 4 avec kitchenette (Frigo, évier, micro ondes) mais aucun équipement de cuisine 
Un roof top au 27e étage qui permet de petit déjeuner, déjeuner et dîner en prenant à emporter dans le quartier - boissons chaudes à volonté, glaçons …. 
Personnel très très sympa, super accueil 
Tres propre - vraiment chouette
Ce serait à refaire nous ferions exactement ce même choix !!!

title: Great location in NYC!
text: First - 27th floor coffee/espresso/tea machine and indoor/outdoor lounge. Do hit that every morning - didn't discover it until halfway through our weeks stay. And water filling stations on each floor - bring your own refillable water bottle so you don't waste resources on their fully stocked bottles with caps that they provide. Environment first! Second - the CQ team is top notch - friendly and helpful. You only have to text and they are on whatever is needed very quickly. Third - very convenient to the subway or busses going to Times Square. Fourth - I hate large crowds so this is a perfect location if you don't like the throng of masses near Times Square or other locales that get swamped. And an excellent jumping off point to hit touristy sites from north to south to east to west of Manhattan -  and bonus, a 99 cent pizza slice shop (cheese only) one minute walk north of the hotel. Did I mention the friendly and helpful staff?

title: For NYC an okay hotel at a good price
text:
This is a New York 4 star review. Most hotels are overpriced and rubbish in NYC. 

This hotel is good friendly and helpful service. On the top floor was a nice Lounge, balcony with decent coffee. The room was an okay size with desk and good furniture. No air con. Open the window at night and put up with horns. Shower room was okay. 

I couldn’t really fault the stay. An uninspiring hotel anywhere else in the world. But for New York pretty good.

title: Terrific Location Clean Room
text: The room was very clean and the staff very friendly and helpful.  We came in at Grand Central and found this place a good choice.  The 27 floor lounge and patio is very nice.  A terrific view.  Coffee machine excellent.

title: Weekend in New York
text: This was a great value.  We found the staff to be superb and efficient  The elevators were fast and never a problem.  Easy to check-in and check-out.  Free bottled water. Our air conditioner went out after the first night.  They moved us to the room next door.

title: Was really impressed
text: This small hotel was in is a good location for the price. The lobby is very small, but the staff was absolutely amazing. If I needed anything the hotel staff took care of it. Will probably look at the other Club Quarters that is closer next time

title: Da evitare
text:
Prenotato 4 notti con colazione presso questo hotel per tre persone,  arrivati carta di credito non accettata perché non vi era sui loro dispositivi la possibilità di digitare pin , quindi alla ricerca di una banca per pagamento contanti......colazione compresa nella prenotazione  ma solo all'arrivo mi dicono che non la fanno.... camera per tre persone mi viene data una doppia.
In quattro giorni non viene mai rifatta la camera o cambiati gli asciugamani.......servizi praticamente inesistenti.
A parte la posizione....non ho trovato niente di positivo.....
Sicuramente  da evitare con lo stesso prezzo a ny trovate qualcosa di meglio

title: Noisy Room on Lower Floor and Staff not helping
text: Noisy Room on Lower Floor and Staff not helping to resolve the matter..... avoid sleeping on the second floor you will hear and feel the rumbling of the motros every 5 minutes or less. The staff did not help and one lady in the morning was rude refusing to honor the promise of the male staff the first day of check in

title: Disonesti e maleducati. Servizio pessimo.
text: Ho soggiornato in questo albergo dopo la pandemia. Venivo spesso in passato. Purtroppo devo constatare che la struttura e il servizio sono decisamente cambiati. In peggio. Sono arrivata e la stanza alle 16.30 non era pronta. Durante il mio soggiorno di 4 notti nessuno ha mai rifatto la stanza e non hanno nemmeno pulito il bagno. Motivazione: covid ! Non mi è mai capitato in un hotel nonostante il covid  e nemmeno mi era stato detto al momento della prenotazione. Sul sito anzi segnalano misure eccezionali a motivo covid: quali sarebbero? Non pulire le stanze? Il personale alla reception è stato spesso scortese. Volevano prenotarmi un servizio privato per  l’aereoporto al doppio della tariffa standard con la scusa che un taxi non avrebbe mai portato tre persone (senza bagaglio!). Quando ho declinato sono stata trattata con scortesia e oltretutto al momento di prenotare un taxi mi hanno detto che il servizio (taxi!) era stato cancellato. Ma quando mai!  Questi solo alcuni disservizi. Il peggiore è stato però il blocco della mia carta di credito perché per 4 notti per una stanza che era già stata pagata prima del mio arrivo mi hanno prelevato un deposito di 1249 dollari ! (Avete letto bene) che ovviamente ha esaurito la mia carta di credito. Mi avevano detto (solo al check-in peraltro) che sarebbe stato un deposito di 80 dollari a notte che già mi era sembrato significativo. Sono rimasta a New York senza la carta di credito e mi sono sentita anche trattare davvero in maniera  scortese.  Ho aspettato a fare questa recensione perché ho scritto sia al sevizio clienti che all’hotel lamentando la situazione e chiedendo spiegazioni oltre che il ripristino della mia carta. Purtroppo ad ora nessuno  ha  risposto nonostante il carattere urgente della email (la mia carta è bloccata e la banca segnala che sono dall’hotel possono sbloccarla). Penso che un trattamento così sia al limite della denuncia. Viaggio molto per lavoro e per piacere e mai sono stata trattata in questo modo. Non si tratta solo di un errore (spero) ma di un comportamento inqualificabile. Da evitare assolutamente.

title: Good location at reasonable price.
text: The room was small, but we’ll designed. It is like two star hotels in European cities. The room is not for travelers that spend much time in their rooms. It had all the important things: good size very clean bathroom with good shower head.

title: AESC NY 2022
text:
Comfortable, clean, discrete, amazing terrace, just exactly what I news for a quick business trip.

Excellent service. Nice. Walking distance to everything. Safe.

Would recommend this hotel👌🏼

Gabriel

title: Great location
text: We only stayed a night but it was very nice and clean and even managed to get a parking spot out front! Front desk guy was great and very friendly- we had to have an extra bed rolled in- no problem- I know they have other things there but it was just close and easy for our one rainy night in NY!

title: Una vez y nunca más...
text:
Empecemos por lo bueno: 

 - Localización: Inmejorable, al lado de Grand Central Station, muy bien comunicado con toda la ciudad.
 - Camas: Muy cómodas.

No nos gustó: 
 - Cancelación espontánea: Nos cancelaron la reserva el mismo día que cogíamos el avión a Nueva York porque hicieron un cargo en la tarjeta (aunque habíamos indicado que pagaríamos a la llegada) y mi banco por seguridad bloqueó la tarjeta temporalmente. Sin avisar nos cancelaron la reserva y tuve que perder tiempo y estrés llamando para que reactivaran la reserva, el personal de recepción muy antipático y sin ganas de ayudar, tuve que llamar a Booking.com para que me solucionaran el problema. Yo tengo llamadas internacionales gratis por trabajo pero no quiero imaginarme alguien que tenga que pagar 

- Limpieza: Nos comunicaron que la hacen cada 4 días (???). Parece más un Airbnb que un hotel de 4 estrellas como indican. Pedimos que nos la hicieran y nos dijeron que sí pero al llegar a la noche estaba sin hacer, se habían olvidado. Toallas sin reemplazar hasta que se las pedimos dos veces.  

- Personal de recepción: Todos (y estuvimos 10 días) muy antipáticos, excepto un chico que fue muy simpático en todo momento con todos nosotros (si el hotel tiene algo bueno además de la localización es este recepcionista).

 - Desayuno: Hotel de 4 estrellas que no ofrece desayuno por un precio desorbitado (aunque en línea con los precios de Manhattan, claro está). Un 4 estrellas en España le daría 1000 vueltas a este hotel (o 2000). 

- Recepción: Muy estrecha y rara, pero esto es lo de menos.  Nos parece impensable que un hotel de 4 estrellas (y yo ya me había alojado varias veces en el Club Quarters de Londres que es infinitamente mejor que éste) no tenga servicio de limpieza diaria como norma general y si alguien por COVID no la quiere que indique que prefiere que no entren a su habitación. Pero no ofrecerla diariamente en un hotel de 4 estrellas... Lo que menos nos gustó fueron las caras del personal de recepción, en general antipáticos y sin ningún interés por sus huéspedes. No volveremos ni lo recomendaremos, deberían aprender del Club Quarters de Londres...

title: Quick NYC vacation
text:
We booked this hotel on a jet blue package in November 2021. I thought we booked a full suite but it was basically one room with a divider and seating area. We were on the 18th floor with a corner room and great views. The room was good enough for us. It was clean and well maintained. There was some noise from other rooms and the elevators but nothing serious. External soundproofing is ok, there was some traffic noise

We liked the filtered water fountains which were used a lot. We didn’t use the top floor lounge

The room had a microwave and small stove but no utensils or plates, probably due to covid. The staff were helpful and pleasant at all times and supplied extra coffee etc for the in room coffee machine. They would have also supplied extra towels and pillows if needed. There was no room service for our stay but none was needed, trash left outside our room was promptly collected

The hotel is in a great location close to Grand Central and easy access to all areas. Highly recommended

title: Ask for a Quiet Room
text: We stayed twice for two nights. The first the room was quiet and large enough to be comfy. The second time the room was even larger but the street noise was loud enough to keep us from sleeping well. Both times the rooms were clean and in good condition. As far as price goes - it seems no matter what you are shown by aggregators or travel web sites you will pay $300 per night.  For our purposes the place was perfectly located.

title: LAS FOTOS NO MUESTRAN LA REALIDAD DE ESTE HOTEL
text: Nos asignaron una habitación en el tercer piso para 3 personas. La habitación estrecha, oscura, los muebles viejos, la única silla que la ubican al lado de la cama doble, la cuerina o material sintético con el que está forrada, estaba bastante pelada, vieja. A pesar de que estaba ya para uso la habitación, el mesón y las sillas de la mini-mini cocina estaban sucio y sucias con boronas de comida. El sofá-cama para la tercera persona es sencillo y no doble, es una silla que se abre, estrecha, vieja. NO LO RECOMIENDO. Por el mismo precio, hay hoteles muchísimo mejores e igual de bien ubicados. No nos hospedamos finalmente y no nos devolvieron el dinero, el recepcionista muy amable pero no hay una persona que verdaderamente atienda una inconformidad y mas si resuelve uno no quedarse ahí. Las fotos no corresponden para nada con la realidad, pues se ven habitaciones y espacios limpios, blancos, frescos y son todo lo contrario, oscuros, beige y café. En el lobby sólo hay una banca para que se sienten 2 personas únicamente, a las personas que lleguen les toca esperar de pie, es un espacio muy reducido. Lo único bueno que tiene es el piso 27 (una cosa totalmente diferente al resto del hotel) en donde se ofrece servicio gratuito de café y de té únicamente,  un espacio amplio con una terraza espectacular. Los pasillos son estrechos, las habitaciones pegadas....HORRIBLE cuando se puede establecer comparación con otros hoteles. El precio es muy alto y lo único que se paga es ubicación para quien resuelve hospedarse ahí.

title: Great stay in the city
text: Close to Grand Central and easy to find.  Staff was helpful and happy. Rooms are small but effecient.  Bathroom was clean and a decent size. Easy check in and checkout by the CQ app.Overall, A great experience at a reasonable price.

title: Servicio terrible
text: Las cosas buenas son la amabilidad del personal y la hubicsvion. Punto final. La primera noche nos dieron una habitación en la planta 2 enfrente de las banderas. Y los ruidos que hacían no los dejaron dormir. Seguro que lo sabían. Después de quejarnos nos la cambiaron. Luego está esa política sobre la limpieza de habitaciones que dicen que no las limpian en tres días para evitar contactos. Lo curioso es que el lobby siempre está lleno de gente sin mascarilla. En nuestro caso después de 6 noches nadie limpio la habitación. Nadie hizo las camas o limpio las papeleras. Nunca me ha pasado esto en un hotel. Por supuesto ni n descuento ni ningún detalle por no darle un servicio que he pagado. Solo las disculpas de la persona de recepción. En fin. Lamentable.

title: Rooms not cleaned
text:
We stayed here for 5 nights and service really is non existent ! Rooms were not cleaned in the garb on Covid! Was told that they get cleaned once in four days! Not ok as rooms tend to get musty and stale in air etc  the Covid story is adopted as and when it
Suits them! Else you have absolutely no protocol being followed
Reception was somewhat distant !
Extremely disappointed with rooms upkeep.

However laundromat at the hotel was extremely helpful.

title: Brilliant hotel, great location
text: A brilliant hotel in a fantastic location!  Really easy access to all the main attractions.  The rooms are reasonably sized for New York, the showers are hot and very powerful.  The room has a microwave and coffee making facilities but no safe which was a bit disappointing.  The staff were really friendly and helpful, and the hotel itself was very clean, although in the 4 nights we were there the rooms were not serviced.  We wasn’t advised this at check-in but I had read online this was common in hotels due to Covid.  We just asked for fresh towels when we needed them and they quickly brought them up.  Other than no safe this hotel was perfect.  Would recommend and would stay again!

title: Unhygienic rooms and unhelpful staff
text: I stayed for 9 nights. The room was not serviced at all. I texted the desk and they said the rooms were serviced every four days. A lie. Unhelpful and badly trained staff.  This “hotel” is only slightly above an SRO facility

title: 10/10 Service
text:
We stayed here to celebrate my Birthday in New York. The hotel was lovely with reasonably sized rooms. Great location right by Grand Central station, so easy to get around!

The staff were super friendly and so helpful. Special thanks to Chris who was an angel! We had a problem with my bank processing the payment twice (long story but not the hotel’s fault) Chris went above and beyond to help us out with this problem! Shaun was also very helpful in giving us information we needed to solve this problem

Our room had a microwave, coffee machine, fridge and small seating area. It was very clean and comfortable, also. 

Will definitely be staying here on our next visit!

title: Super hôtel à nyc
text:
Super hôtel vraiment bien placé ! 
Petit plus ma chambre avait j’une vue sur l’empire state bulding ! 
Un personnel vraiment sympa et accueillant très à l’écoute et qui met tout en œuvre pour que votre séjour se passe au mieux ! 
Je retourne à New York en mai et je réserverai sûrement la bas !

title: Great Hotel
text: Stayed here for a night over Presidents’ Weekend. Great location. Friendly and helpful staff. A spacious common area on the top floor. Delicious coffee available and a great view of midtown. Everything was clean. Best of all, very affordable!

title: Double charge
text: They charged me double and I didn’t get my money back yet. I called several times the Client service and they told me many different things about it. I was there February 11 and it’s been 13 days and they haven’t reverse my money. I’m very upset so I hope to get my money back

title: Double check the room before settling in
text:
Location is very convenient where most places to go anywhere in NYC. Next to Grand Central Station and close by Bryant Park is a plus. Check in went smoothly well and quick. 

Some of the areas wasn't clean properly when entering the room 816. There was a weird smell coming from the refrigerator and found a container food gone bad, which made the room smell bad. Found a packet of new and some used razors underneath the bathroom sink and afraid to touch it. 

I wished they fully inspect and clean the room thoroughly. I had a hard time sleeping in the middle of the night, because I can still hear the cars honking and sirens going off. 

The window at room 816 isn't sound proof and constantly wakes me up while trying to sleep. I've slept in very busy parts and areas in the city and had slept peacefully, but not this hotel.

title: Great value, centrally located, comfy hotel!!!
text: Typically stay at Hyatt Grand Central b/c I like the central location and proximity to Equinox gym, but decided to give Club Qtrs a try given the great price. Was definitely not disappointed. Rooms are on the small side, but as a business travel who was attending a weekend solo, this room was more than adequate. There's a nice table w/outlets to do computer work and spread paper out if need be. Bathroom is very clean and well stocked with mid-tier bath products. Shower pressure was a tad low, but adequate. Bed topper was surprisingly lumpy, so that was disappointing, but not bad enough for this tired dad to complain as I slept well nevertheless. Friday night I could hear neighbors play loud music, but again, being a tired dad w/ear plugs, I quickly fell asleep. For the price, you won't be disappointed as this is a terrific value for a comfortable, functional hotel room, bed and shower centrally located.

title: Excelente ubicación de hotel e instalaciones
text: El hotel la verdad esta muy padre, me toco un cuarto con una vista espectacular a las calles y tenia todo lo que se necesitaba. También tenia una terraza que estaba perfecta para admirar de alto las calles de New York. Esta muy cerca a la estación de  tren. Lo único que no sabíamos mis acompañantes y yo que al igual les comparto es que piden un deposito de 500 dolares por si pasa algo (fue inesperado y tuvimos que pasar la tarjeta de crédito en donde se congelo el saldo).

title: Reliable, efficient, friendly place to stay
text: This hotel is my go-to when staying in NYC. Just steps from Grand Central and close to many of Midtown’s assets and activities. The top floor living room is great for relaxing, taking in the view of the Chrysler Building and many other fine buildings. Self-serve cappuccino machine 24/7. I’ve never had an issue that wasn’t dealt with efficiently by friendly staff. Will definitely be back!

title: Would not recommend, hotel has gone downhill from a few years ago.
text: Hotel room was not cleaned on a daily basis, I stayed here for 5 nights and was told it will only be cleaned once every 3 nights. Room was noisy, can hear the lifts all the time. Staff not friendly and nobody EVER answered the phone if you call the front desk or service. Always a voicemail to leave a message. Better to book Airbnb if they are not cleaning the room. I stayed here a few years ago when it just opened and I liked it but it has gone downhill so much. For the price they are charging per night, there are other better hotels to choose from. And the lobby, OMG, what a mess! And there are disinfecting stations everywhere but always empty, they never refill it.  I do not recommend, sorry.

title: Pleasant NYC Hotel
text: This was our second stay at Club Quarters.  It has an excellent location, close to many restaurants and New York destinations.  Staff are welcoming and helpful.  The hotel has a nice enclosed terrance open 24/7.  The rooms are clean and modern.

title: EXCELENTE UBICACIÓN - PÉSIMA ADMINISTRACIÓN
text:
Lo mejor de este hotel es la ubicación. El personal es muy amable. La habitación con tamaño normal y bien equipada, y en nuestro caso (habitación 26006) con vistas al Chrysler Building y muy silenciosa. Además de la cama pequeño sofá y mesa para comer. Ofrece servicio de agua gratuito. En la planta 27, servicio gratuito de café y té, bussines center y una terraza con vistas espectaculares.

Lo malo: No nos limpiaron ni cambiaron la habitación hasta el 5 día de la estancia y eso tras mucho insistir. Sin avisar (ni el hotel ni Booking) nos cargaron en la tarjeta 80$ por noche en concepto de depósito que estamos en trámite de recuperar. en la habitación no hay nevera ni caja de seguridad.

title: Great location and staff
text: This hotel was a great place to stay for a 5 day trip. Excellent location in midtown. Room and other hotel areas were clean and nothing to complain about at all. Rooftop lounge was nice, but the photos advertised food being available, but there is only a coffee maker. Not an issue though as it did not advertise free breakfast or anything like that so I knew not to expect anything like that. The staff was always nice and helpful, especially Rachel who always greeted with a smile and provided excellent service. Overall no complaints, definitely recommend!

title: One of the worst I’ve ever stayed
text: Where should I start. After a transatlantic flight I walk into my room which had like no hot water for the shower. Or at least I was getting something at lukewarm temperature and when I asked the front desk the told me to wait ten minutes with the tab open and do the same with the sink tab. Nothing improved so I had to take a lukewarm shower. The furniture and the carpet seemed like the came from a different millennia. I may be not exaggerating as they seemed more than 21 years old. Also the second day when I complained for the same hot water problem they told me that this is NY problem. The third day I changed rooms and I found out I was in a room where things at least worked. Also no one is cleaning your room unless you ask for it. But even when you do you would be surprised with the responses. I did so the fourth day, a Friday, and the lady told me that this is not feasible as they don’t clean room on weekends. I told her it is a Friday so then she added Friday on the weekend excuse. Thankfully the other lady next to her made a note of my room num we and they did eventually clean the place. The only good thing is the location which is very convenient Kent if you have business midtown.

title: Great stay in NY
text: We spend a great week in NY, our Stay at the  CW grand central was perfect, it was close to everything, with nice places to have breakfast around, the beds were more than comfortable and I love the idea of the bottled water to avoid the use of plastic.

title: Loved CQ and my stay!
text: I absolutely loved the space and the location of CQ. It was in the heart of all the tourist attractions and easy access to the subways. The staff is friendly and great to work with. Great hospitality and looking forward to coming back. Thank you Dionne and staff!

title: Location and Value
text: Spent a long weekend here with friends. The hotel is nothing fancy, with a small simple lobby and basic rooms. But the staff was excellent, checking in couldn't have been smoother and the room was spotless. On top of this, the price we paid was unbeatable.

title: OK for short stay in midtown
text: Has suffered from pandemic lack of use. More attention needs to be paid to room smells. Living room was a very nice experience. Close to Grand Central. Very few open restaurants in the vicinity. Midtown is in the dumps right now.

title: Great view and great location!
text: First stay in NYC, central location and great view from my room on the 26th floor! Free cold water on the floor and good common spaces. Although it was pricey, New York is too and this was a good place to be overall.

title: Hotel
text: It is a great hotel, room was comfy. I guess since Covid the lobby is small with no dining area. During my stay, it was comfortable but front desk staff were not nice, I felt like I was being rushed. You have to be cheerful and let your personal problems aside and be professional in any job. Side note. Hopefully the dining area will open again soon. Thanks for the stay!

title: Perfect location with extras!
text:
This hotel is perfectly located. value, I would have paid quite but more, but glad I didn't have to!
The rooms are spacious for NYC standards and include a table with electrical outlets, a corner sofa, a microwave, and a mini fridge! The bathroom is well porportioned and this hotel includes all the Memories, including washclothes and soap, shampoo, bathroom cups extra.
This hotel goes above and beyond to make their guests feel welcomed, beginning with the  friendly staff and night security\doorman. Not that security is needed a the neighborhood felt safe and residential, with many places to eat and drug store and even a bath and body works nearby. Also nearby is Grand Central terminal and Madiaon Avenue and 5th Avenue retail ships, along with Times Square and Broadway blocks away.
The best part of the hotel for me, besides the well appointed room, was the 27th floor terrace. My more routine became walk a few steps across the street to Dunkin Donuts for a bagle and then up to the 27th floor for a free macchiato or cappuccino to enjoy the city scape outside on the terrace. Quite a few evenings, after arriving late at night, we would crab a slice of .99 pizza and a $1.00 soda from a Ross the street and enjoy it on the terrace amongst the lights of the city sky line.
The staff responded quickly to my text messages regarding questions and a request for extra towels.
Overall I have no complaints and really enjoyed my stay!

title: Rooms smelled and were not as advertised
text: The hotel was nothing like advertised or the photos. The rooms smelled of mildew and other bad smells. There were burn marks in the room and broken items. When we demanded to be moved to another room (we were already paying for the biggest suite) the next room was exactly the same. The hallways also smelled and had blinking or broken lights. I was with my family and we had a second regular room for our nanny that was even worse. The smell was so bad we couldn’t even stay at the hotel. We checked out immediately and booked something else. A huge waste of time in convenience. I would not recommend staying for any reason.

title: Good location, reasonable value, disappointing room.
text:
Let's start with the positives.  Great location.  The hotel is right across from the Grand Central Station.  Friendly staff.  Water filter machine and plastic water bottle at every floor was a nice gesture. 27-floor terrace has a decent view.
Here are the minor issues during my stay.
Poor internet experience.  When it works, it works great.  Good download speed and no latency.  However, sometimes it would quit working for a few minutes.
Mattress and pillows are well used.  Did not have enjoyable goodnight rests.
AC was loud.  Makes sleep even more difficult with the AC running.
A cheap and flimsy shower curtain did an ok job keep the water inside the shower stall.  Bathroom floor was always wet after a shower.  It takes 3 ~ 5 minutes for hot water to come out the showerhead.  You can choose to take a cold shower or waste cold water waiting hot water.
If you can overlook these minor annoyances, Club Quarters Hotel, Grand Central is not a bad place to stay.  I would not return to this hotel in the near future.

title: Poorly run....more apartment than hotel
text: No housekeeping services during 4 night stay. Room was tattered and AC unit was extremely loud..not a central run unit.  Zero amenities...more like staying in an apartment that a hotel. Lobby is depressing.  For the price... you can do better in NYC

title: Overall Good Stay in NYC
text: Loved the location of this hotel. First impressions of the hotel were great, lobby was clean. When we checked in the front desk was very welcoming and helpful. Room was ready before check in which was plus! When getting to the room, looked clean. Small but was what I was expecting. Room needed a little TLC. Carpet had a ripped piece missing from floor. Walls need a little touch up paint. Room didn’t smell the best, AC was off so room was very hot and musty at first. Overall good stay, just a few tweaks and things could be perfect! Value wise, a little pricey for what you get.

title: Worst service and horrible experience
text:
After staying one night I asked to cancel my 3 following nights so I can book somewhere else. The lady over the phone accepted to cancel reservation with a 50$ fee which I accepted. 
There was no hot water, AC was extremely loud and non fonctional. She agreed to cancel with penalty and told me Martha would call me back the following morning which she never did. I tried several times to reach her out but only left messages after messages. 
Called hotel.com to explain situation they told me I would get respond in 72 hours as they can never get an answer from them. After 72 hours no news from either of them.
Called back hotel.com to repeat the story and was told again that they would reach out within 72 hours. 
Finally it was easier to contact Central Park via email and Meagan reassured me refund was made.
3 weeks later no refund is made. Hotel.com tells me to call the hotel baxk. Finally speak to Martha that just decided she has no notes about this and say I stayed for nights and refuse refund.
They can’t even look that the 3 other nights were probably booked to another name for that room. 
Hotel.com can see I stayed at Dylan hotel which was great. 
Grand Central doesn’t care about their customer. (Martha that never calls back or cannot even check her file properly) her way to respond to me is if I am a liar when she j
Never returns phone call. Deny you canceled
When you did.
I never experienced anything services like this. It’s been over a month that I repeat my story over 10 times.
Also please take note that there is no proper lobby and it’s mostly young drunk people. Don’t expect a quite stay and a nice hot shower.
Very frustrated costumer that was robbed by this hotel.
Stephanie

title: Ticking customers with secret early check in then charging fees
text:
The night before I was sent an email from Club Quarter about downloading the app to check in 24 hours before the reservation as this will prevent any delays in long lines at the front desk. I followed the instructions and after checking stated that I will receive an email when the room is ready and can pick up my keys. Because I am traveling from out of state and staying the night I have bags and was told that I would be able to leave my bags at the front desk until my check in/when the room is ready. As I did that this morning, after dropping my bags off I was waiting for my uber and received an email stating my room was ready and I can pick my key up. Since I was already there I figured I can grab the key before heading out. As I was picking up my room key I let the representative know that I received notification that the room is ready. She asked if I checked in on the app, I stated I did, then she let me know that apparently by checking in on the app last night, that is considered “early check in” and I may be charged a fee for that.

I did not want to do early check in as I had no need for it and nowhere did it state that I unknowingly was apparently proceeding with early check in by processing this through the app 24 hours in advance, like instructed. To me this does not make sense and I should not be secretly essentially tricked into something I did not want or sign up for. Especially when this was not stated anywhere, I was instructed to do it by Club Quarters and I received an email from Club Quarters that the room was ready. I would have saved my time and not done anything on the app has this been detailed. On top of that I have not even gone to the room.
I was instructed by the customer service rep I spoke to over the phone to reach out to the manager from her knowledge customers who knowingly want early check in and knowingly accept this fee are charged. This did not make sense to her either. I have since had fee removed as a “courtesy” however in my email from Marta she states that apparently when you book through a 3rd party app you are automatically early check in, which is the most ridiculous thing I have ever heard. It also is not consistent with what I was told by the front desk rep, ORRR the two customer service reps I spoke to on the phone. Everyone is stating something different. It also is NOT listed anywhere on your website or emails stating that this is the case. To me it seems like a very sneaky way to get extra money from customers

title: conveniently located, but the place needs work
text: The hotel is well-priced and wonderfully convenient, next to Grand Central and near family but this is the third visit during which stuff didn't work.  The wifi was out, the phones didn't work so I couldn't tell anyone the wifi was out.  Plus, room was shabby and in need of new furniture and paint.  One of the  bathroom lights was out. I guess we got what we paid for...

title: The price was right
text: For the price, unbeatable (but that was a pandemic price). I think I paid $75 a night and was given a large room, with a huge flat screen TV (which I didn’t use), and a fireplace (that was just decorative, but it was hot, so no problem), and a small bathroom (well appointed). The reception folks were welcoming and I was able to store my bag before check in in a secure room attended by a fellow in a bellhop uniform (whereas at The Jane, where I usually stay, one must store their bags in an unattended room out of sight from the staff and things must get stolen all the time, that’s my guess.) The lobby is nice enough. There is a small workout room in the basement (which I didn’t use, but you might), next to a couple of vending machines and an ice maker (there is no frig in the room, so ice was nice). Location is great if midtown is what you want, but understand that it’s a ghost town and even in non-pandemic days there isn’t much open at night in this part of the city. But it’s close enough to public transportation, and you can just call Uber and get to a hood that’s a little more lively. Actually, I picked this place because it’s an easy walk from Grand Central Station. I see now that the prices are double what I paid in May 2021, and so sadly I’ve booked elsewhere for my trip to the city this month (I’m cheap!). All and all, I had a good stay here.

title: Great value, comfortable stay
text: I stayed in Club Quarters for several weeks and the staff is fantastic. Liz, Rachel, Marta, and all the others did an excellent job of making me feel welcome and quickly addressed any issues. Rooms are clean and comfortable, and the price is reasonable. Will stay again.

title: Terrible service
text: I know there’s a pandemic, but we’re here 5 nights and we asked to have our room serviced at 11. It’s now 3:30. There are about 15 rooms on our floor. Two rooms were occupied.  The one next to us for one night. It was cleaned hours ago. We’re still waiting after asking now three times. We have stayed here half a dozen times. We will not stay again.

title: Great location
text: Great location near Grand Central Stations with tons of metro lines to move around the city. Staff is very friendly and helpful. I stayed at a standard queen room, good size room for 2, furniture is dated but comfortable, good size bathroom but shower a bit small. Overall a good place to stay.

title: Perfect Stay
text: We were looking for a mid priced hotel convenient to Grand Central Station. This hotel fit the bill. It's not a high end luxury hotel but it is clean, and comfortable. Best surprise was that all of the staff were friendly and helpful. We had interactions with four staff members and we were four for four! The hotel also has a lounge on the 27th floor with great views. We needed to store our luggage for the day after checkout which also was not an issue. I'd definitely return

title: Lovelly long stay!
text: We stood for 3 weeks. Our first room had a strong moisture smell, and we requested a change. They changed us to another room, and it was perfect! We had a great stay. Too bad they no longer have the wine and snacks in the living room at floor 27, but everything worked perfectly for us! Internet was a blast, beds were confortable, we had a refrigerator and a microwave. It was a GREAT stay.

title: queen room is more like a closet, not a real room
text: the room was tiny like a closet, not a real room; the bed wasn't queen, it was more like a full size; no cold water in the bathroom, just hot or scalding hot. Poor hotel not 4 stars, more like minus 3.

title: Easy check-in/out and great location
text: This hotel was super close to grand central and the check-in/out process was super easy, all on your phone!  Our only complaint was the AC did not appear to be working in our room, so it was pretty warm.  Otherwise nice clean room.

title: Could be a nice place
text: This location is still recovering.  I suspect there aren't enough staff yet, which explains why they didn't inspect my room when I first reported a damp carpet, and only came after the carpet was squishing with water due to a clogged A/C condensate drain line.  Also explains why they didn't answer two messages i left on different items.  Once they called back, however, i got a new room and they answered my questions very well.  The business lounge is still out, and you can't print out your ticket or pick up snacks.  There is no room service or linen changing service, although they were quick with sending up replacement towels.  It is a serviceable hotel, and when they get enough people on staff and re-open some of the amenities, it could be a very nice place to stay.

title: A Lot of Little Annoyances
text:
My satisfaction of Club Quarters Grand Central is a result of all the little annoyances that added up:

-One of the bedside lamps flickered incessantly.

-The mattress must have been an early version of memory foam, because it was so hot.  I've never slept on a bed that felt like there was a heating element in the mattress.  It took me a couple days to figure out the combination of sheets, and air conditioner setting to sleep without waking up sweltering.

-The TV's picture, and audio was never synced.  The sound was anywhere from a few seconds behind the picture, to more than 30 seconds behind.  More often than not, it was at least 30 seconds behind. 

-There was a gap of about an inch beneath the door into the hotel room which let the light from the hall into a dark room at night.  I had to lay a towel along the gap to keep the light out.

-Even after using the text feature advertised in the elevator, I never received more toilet paper.  The one, and only roll when I arrived was only half full, at best, and by the last couple days of my stay, I began rationing toilet paper so I wouldn't run out.

-This is the first hotel I've stayed in in years that didn't have an ironing board, and iron in the room.  I would like to have had them in the room.

-There was no pen, and paper to take notes on.  Guests like to make notes of addresses to restaurants, or directions to places, etc.  Fortunately, I had a pen in my bag, and found a scrap of paper to take notes on.

-A part of the plastic handle on the hand-held shower head kept falling off.  Very annoying, and uncomfortable to accidentally step on in the shower.

-The hose on the shower head was so stiff that when the shower head was in its cradle, the spray was either aimed at the shower curtain, or the wall.  No amount of repositioning of the hose allowed the spray to actually spray where it should.

-The noise from the elevators was quite annoying, especially at night.  The configuration of the floors seems to maker every room close to the elevators, so I'm sure everyone had to deal with the noise, too.  I happened to hear another guest complaining about the noise, as well.

-The channel options on the TV were rather limited.

-The water dispenser on my floor didn't seem to be working.

-On the third day of my stay, I overheard an employee telling another guest that ice, and vending machines were available on the 3rd floor, and that there was a deck on the 27th floor.  I was never told these things, and there was no literature in the room providing this kind of information.  I'd hunted for ice at one point, and since there was not ice bucket in my room, decided there must not have been any to be had.

title: EXCELENTE UBICACIÓN
text:
El hotel está súper bien ubicado a dos cuadras de la estación grand central que te permite moverte fácilmente y tomar también el servicio de bus que te lleva súper fácil a lugares cercanos como rockefeller Center, catedral de san patricio entre otros . La habitación muy cómoda, aseada y confortable.   

Muy amables y fácil el check in.  Deben tener en cuenta que hay que dejar un depósito con tc por daños de usd 250.

title: Great hotel in a central location
text:
We have stayed at a different CQ hotel and had a great experience so it was easy to choose to stay at another. We arrived before check in and we were allowed to check in to our room. A great start. The Grand Central location was perfect for quick access to the subway. The room met our needs. It was compact, but still had a table and bench where you can sit and eat or work on your laptop. They had water filling stations on each floor. The top floor has a rooftop view and that was great bonus.

Elizabeth at the front desk greeted us with high energy. She was very friendly and professional. She always offered help with anything we needed in the room. When we asked for anything for our room, it was delivered within 5 mins. At check out, she offered to hold our luggage which was great because we were flying out late evening.   Overall a great experience and would stay here again.

title: Excelente ubicación
text: Muy bien situado, estación del metro a 3 cuadras, Grand central station a una cuadra.  Muchísimas  opciones de comida en los alrededores.  Habitación grande para los estándares de NYC, muy cómoda.  Personal de recepción muy amable.  Terraza en el piso 27 con bonita vista y sillas y mesas para tomar algo.  Lo único malo que como todos los hoteles en estos momentos no hacen limpieza de la habitación.

title: Great Place for the Price
text: Great place overall, for the price. Hotel overall is not that spacious when it comes to the lobby area and hallways. The clubroom is amazing and a great place to hangout with a Manhattan lookout. If you don't require much space for your stay, this place is great! Business friendly, great service, very clean, all the basics are there!
