title: Excelente elección, una atención A1!
text: Optamos por este hotel gracias a una oferta en expedia, sin embargo al llegar me dieron toda la tranquilidad del caso ya que se encargaron de ver nuestro caso y solucionarlo, pudiendo hospedarnos sin problemas. teníamos café y agua siempre y cada que nos veían nos ofrecían botellas de agua lo cual es genial! el cuarto super espacioso, completo y moderno con una gran vista. Un agradecimiento especial a Elizabeth ya que en todo momento estuvo pendiente de mi ya que estoy embarazada y me dieron las facilidades del caso incluso el día que me sentí mal para hacer el check out, en verdad excelente atención, personas muy amables y empáticas! definitivamente volveré!

title: Great location, friendly staff
text: We chose this hotel due to its location to Grand Central Station. We paid a little more for a larger room with a kitchenette and it was great. Staff was outstanding, very friendly and responsive. We felt very safe in this neighborhood.

title: Club Quarters Hotel, Grand Central
text: The room was in perfect condition, clean and organized. The view was nice. Plenty space for 2. I did the check in on their app, was fast. We arrive around 1 am and the key was on my phone by Bluetooth. In general everything was great!

title: Great Guest Experience
text: I had a  very nice stay at CQ - special thanks to Elizabeth and Omar for making the stay feel nice from the beginning to its end. I am looking forward to staying at CQ on my next trip. btw, Fairly priced for the value.

title: Nice Hotel with Poor Service
text:
Great location. Small but very nice room.  Could have used a safe and a refrigerator .  But service lacked .

 I got there late and was in a rush to make my dinner plans and their computer system was down . I waited for nearly an hour before I had to give up.  I ended up changing in the bathroom , checking my carryon bag and carrying my bag with personal things and valuables to dinner across Manhattan .  Not only did they admit that this wasn’t a rare occurrence, they were completely unapologetic about it . The 1 person working the lobby, made me feel like he was annoyed that I was annoyed.  To top it off , when I asked for a late checkout they said it would be a $60 charge to stay to 2:00 and didn’t care that I didn’t get to check until 10:00 because of them.  They even said , their computer system didn’t have any indication  of the check-in problem .  Essentially implying I made it up and believing their cruddy computer that caused the problem.

title: Great staff, everything else was not so great.
text:
On my first day, I walked in to a woman and an employee arguing. Not a great first impression, but the staff were all extremely nice to me! 
Walking into my room, I was hit with a terrible smell that I never did get used to. The creaking/noise of the elevator was very audible in my room. All night. I tried to cancel it out by playing the tv, but then the tv kept cutting off randomly. Not to mention how long it took for the elevator to get to me. The bathroom was very clean, but the shower changed temperature every minute. The only positive things about my stay were the employees and the comfy bed.

title: Good value
text: The front desk people here are very friendly when you need anything. But the accommodations assume that you will not need a lot of assistance. The walls were thin so you can really hear when someone opens that door but it is New York so you can expect it to be a little loud. The hotel is pet friendly which is great for people with dogs. I know it can be difficult to find a pet friendly hotel. The downside is when someone brings their dog that doesn’t stop barking all day which was my experience unfortunately. You cannot get a better location since it’s so centrally located in the city. I was in a superior room and was impressed with the smart design of every aspect of the room. I don’t know if I would have wanted to stay in a smaller room though. Note that there are two types of superior rooms. One with a kitchenette and one with a sofa bed.

title: I See Why People Love This Place.
text:
I don't do reviews, but for this one I had to! 

I am a native New Yorker and every now and then, I like to get away from my home but still feel close by. This hotel has some of the best staff I have ever encountered. Elizabeth was one the persons who assisted me throughout the weekend. She was kind, sweet and most flexible. Elizabeth was full of much personality and she truly made the stay worth wild. She literally was remembering every persons name in the hotel during their stay, INCLUDING MINES! She was honest about my room and the options available to me because I had gotten there a tad bit early. I am a frequent traveler and I don't think I have ever met a hotel personnel like her EVER. My fiancé was running a little late and they made sure once he got there he was taken care of and he also was treated well. I definitely plan on escaping here again. The location is easy to find, the food in the area is great. I ordered food multiple times during my stay and the front desk was so kind about holding it and making sure it got to us clean and safe.  This place is perfect for traveling couples and families, friends, business trips, and just a simple getaway. Don't hesitate, it would truly be worth it!

title: Excellent experience!!
text: The location,  room and the view from our floor and terrace was amazing.  Really enjoyed the place. The most valuable part? Elizabeth B., She is so wonderful, employees like her make it 5 stars. Thanks so much!

title: Great value, excellent service, cleanliness
text: Helpful, friendly staff, very clean quarters, nice room design, comfortable bed, great location near Grand Central Station.  Staff accommodated request for quiet room.  Covid protocol very thorough, which was reassuring.

title: Quick and easy
text: Had a great stay in midtown — small rooms but some great views of the Chrysler Building. The hotel was busy by covid standards, but everything felt safe and the room was super clean. Elizabeth at the desk was fantastic!

title: Excellent Check-In Front Desk Hotel Service
text:
The staff are extremely friendly, insightful, and helpful.  Billy Burrage and his colleagues at the front desk got me checked in and all set within seconds.

Excellent customer service and definitely recommend this location!

title: Bingo
text:
Finally found a solution for my overnight stays in NYC for business, The location was perfect for me. I was very impressed by the adaption to Covid circumstances, the ability to use my phone for practically anything from using the elevator to opening my room to operating the TV. Front desk staff were extremely helpful, thoughtful, professional and friendly.
Though the room was a bit small and tight, it was comfortable. 
I will be back.

title: Very clean, comfortable and accommodating.
text:
My overall review; Thank's Again for ensuring comfort and safety.
My guest was not permitted entry; until my confirming expectancy of him.
Location ideal; across the street from my job.

I Like"That"!!!

title: Don’t go
text: This is by far the worst hotel in NYC we have stayed at. Don’t waste your time and money. Everything was dirty. Staff doesn’t seem to know what they’re doing. When checking in there was a guy complaining that the sticker for cleanliness at the door was broken and they refuse to give him another room. I would not stay here ever again.

title: Awesome hotel with the best customer service
text:
I cannot emphasize the value of customer service; especially during a pandemic. In a world where hotels are open but gyms and room service/ cleaning aren’t available, customer service is everything. Elizabeth and Sandi went above and beyond for my family during a recent trip to the city. While the Club Quarters is known for its extras like water filling stations, they’re now closed because of Covid. However, the ladies at the front desk never missed a beat,
making sure we were fully hydrated with bottled water. Although there isn’t daily maid service, you simply put your trash and dirty towels outside your door and txt for replenishment. The hotel was very clean, the front desk staff and bellman truly wonderful, and the icing on the cake is top floor Club Quarters “living room” where we were able to sit and enjoy a drink and the stellar views!

title: Great Time
text: I had a great experience. The Hotel was super clean which that was a major plus for me. I which there would of been a promo code discount for rates to be lower but regardless it was worth the money spend. The service was great.

title: good location
text: rooms look dated.  parking is 6 blocks away from the hotel.  not sure I would pay the rack rate to stay here.  the location is convenient and about 3 blocks from the grand central terminal.  several restaurants located across from the hotel.

title: Club Quarters Grand Central New York despite Covid
text: What stands out most about Grand Central and what will keep me coming back to and recommending this hotel is the staff, especially the team in the lobby.  From the Doormen who were always professional and friendly to the Lobby Staff who were exceptionally welcoming.  The service I received from the staff in the lobby was so refreshing in New York. Other places I've stayed I've received a somber and not so welcoming reception. No matter what time it was, sometimes at 3 in the morning, the staff was always friendly and went out of their way to take care of what ever I needed.  From just engaging in a friendly chat on my way in or out (who does that?)to providing dinner recommendations and advice on the best way to get to places like Central Park or the World Trade Center, they were always happy to accommodate.  One employee, Elizabeth, stands out as exceptional, although they all were, she had the opportunity to provide me perfect details on how to navigate the subway and provided me an excellent map and customized it.  I typically used Uber or a Taxi to get around so the subway, which was relatively empty during Covid, was a good experience and saved a lot of money.  I could not have asked for or excepted better service from a hotel in New York.  I'm looking forward to the lifting of the Covid restrictions and the rest of what Club Quarters Grand Central has to offer, I suspect I haven't even seen even half of it.  Thanks to the staff for the wonderful stay.

title: Amazing value, excellent accomodations
text: The entire staff was exceptional!!! The room was like having an apartment with an amazing view in the heart of NYC.  Spacious, clean and comfortable! The rooftop area was a great place to unwind and I slept like a baby.

title: Excellent solution for NYC with very caring staff
text:
I stayed here for 2 weeks Dec-Jan while my mom was in the hospital (she is home now.). I grew up in NYC and regularly come back and stay here due to location (easy access to Midtown and to subways) as well as due to the accommodations.  The rooms are a bit larger than most in NYC, they are relatively quiet by NYC standards, and best of all, many rooms  offer a  Keurig maker, a fridge and a microwave.  Having the small kitchen during the pandemic was incredibly helpful as restaurants don’t provide indoor eating.  There are take-out options nearby (though fewer in Midtown  due to the pandemic) and there is a decent grocery 2 blocks away on 45th.

Also of great value are the front desk staff.  Each was extremely friendly, helpful and genuinely caring.  An extra big shout out is due to Elizabeth who greeted me personally each day with warmth and care, kept me well stocked with coffee and towels, and even sang to me on my birthday.  You would not find this in a large hotel.

Only downside of the hotel is the rooms are warm and to get to a sleeping temperature (71?) triggers the AC which then cycles on and off a bit louder than one would wish.  Still not enough of an issue to avoid the hotel.

title: Wonderful
text: I will be back to this hotel very soon. I was absolutely so delighted. The staff was so nice and helpful. I really recommand this hotel. But I think, that the next time, I will stay in the quarter hotel that is located in time square, because I love this area (many shops and restaurant, much more than the quarter hotel located near lexington avenue).

title: Great stay
text: It was an emergency overnight stay for business due to the weather.  The process of finding Club Quarters, a room, the service, the staff, and fi ally the stay was a great experience. I would return in the future.

title: Wonderful and pleasant stay!
text: This was our first time staying in a hotel during the pandemic and obviously were very concerned about the cleanliness and the safety measures being observed by the facility. My wife and I spent a good deal researching many of the hotels in the city and their approach to COVID.  Happy to say that this place didn't disappoint and we felt comfortable.  From the moment that you walk in, there was a station to perform a self temperature scan.  There were sanitizing areas as well and it really showed that the hotel was taking the virus seriously.  Before entering your room, all the doors were sealed to indicate that no one else has entered the room.  We did read in one of the reviews that the rooms are generally vacant for at least 24hrs.  The only negative that we noticed during our stay was that we were joined by a maintenance engineer in the elevator during one of its stops when we thought that there was a one party/elevator policy.  Other than that, we genuinely enjoyed our stay and felt safe.

title: Amazing stay!
text: I was originally just going to stay her for a night but I ended up staying an extra night due to the room and service I received. When you walk in, they have plenty of hand sanitizer and a machine takes your temperature before you get to the front desk (there is also a security guard) My check in process was so smooth and the gentleman that checked me in the first night was so nice (forgot to get his name but this was 11/29) The room was very clean and the bed was comfortable. I even went up to the rooftop or what they call the living room, amazing views! When I came back the next night(11/30), Elizabeth (I’m almost sure this was her name, I lost the card she gave me when I asked her to please write it down for me) was so warm and inviting. I told her I loved my stay last night so much that I chose to stay another day. She gave me a very nice room with an awesome view. Thank you Elizabeth! This place makes you feel welcome and at home unlike the other hotels I’ve stayed at in New York City.

title: Elizabeth is amazing
text: Elizabeth is the most kindest receptionist you could ever seek for. Not only is she kind, but always tries to help and try her hardest to make your stay feel as enjoyable as possible. - Elzan & Zerina

title: Very convenient location with signature CQ hospitality
text: If you are looking for the convenience of walking distance to Grand Central Station and other Uptown hot spots this place is for you.  They are friendly, prompt, and beautifully nestled a block away from Grand Central.  The rooms are a little snug, with only a queen bed availability. The common area on the 27th floor was perfect for catching up on work conference calls.

title: Club Quarters trip
text: It was by far the most comfortable peaceful place in the city. I recommend anyone who has a chance to stay here do so as soon as possible. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful and the guests rooms were fresh and very well prepared

title: Excelente ubicacion y buena atencion
text:
Super encantada con todo el personal que alli labora! en Especial a Desire, Elizabeth, Sara y Sandy. son chicas relamente encantadoras muy serviciales super simpaticas! ojala todos los hoteles tuvieran esa mismo personal tan encantador como estas chicas! me voy muy contenta ellas hicieron que mi estadia fuera mas placentera.
Como observacion de las instalaciones del hotel como tal es que deben de cambiar los clochones ya que sesalen los resortes y el aire acondicionado no funciona al 100%.

title: First Time, Great Room, Beyond Great Staff
text: First time in a CQ hotel. The way they handled covid was top level. The service was fast and went above and beyond even with safety protocols in place. The rooms were clean and sealed prior to out stay.

title: New York Trip
text:
I am very grateful to have found  such a kind and helpful  staff  who made my stay in New York during this pandemic very pleasant. The hotel is located right in the heart of the city which made it easy to walk everywhere My room was very spacious and had all the comforts I could possibly need. 
A special thanks to Valerie, for recommending this hotel and to Elizabeth,  who  recommended the best restaurants in the vicinity and other possibile attractions.

title: Put your mind at ease at CQ’s new COVID-19 Improvements
text: Put your mind at ease with CQ’s new Covid19 prevention; contactless check in, guest temperature checks, contactless doors and hand sanitizers. They definitely go the extra-mile to ensure guest safety.

title: Nice stay , Love the staff and service
text: My daughter and I stayed here for 3 days , Prior to arrival I called 2 months ahead of time for my daughters birthday . And Let me tell you TREY from the Front desk went above and beyond for our stay. Trey I can't thank you for making us feel welcome . Such a Handsome articulate young man. I will be returning next year because of how kind the staff was too my daughter and i. No more Big branded hotels . Like the Touch of free wine.

title: Great value and location
text: Very clean, superb service, very nice rooms. Due to covid-19 no food services but the stuff compensates with great and attentive service to all needs, from takeout outside the hotel to supplying everything we asked for to the room.

title: Clean and Ready
text: Stayed several days at Club Quarters by Grand Central. The hotel was clean and was well prepared for guests.The really prepared the hotel for the post COVID traveler. Elizabeth at the front desk was very helpful. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

title: First time in New York!
text:
Room was excellent and clean and had all the necessary amenities for my trip!
Elizabet at reception and Tre were wonderful and definitely the highlight of my hotel stay. Elizabet was full of energy and enthusiasm and very supportive of me as I was there for a job interview. Tre was working at the 26th floor sky deck during the complimentary wine hour and was charming and articulate. We had a great conversation and he really helped me take the edge off after my stressful day!

title: My Hotel "Club Quarters Hotel, Grand Central"
text:
The Hotel is in a good location, convenience parking  Nice rooms small pool (which I didn't use)
The breakfast is an American style Which I am not crazy about. What disturbed me was the use of disposable dishes which create a big amount of trash. I was happy with the information provided by the Hotel of the possibilities in the area.

title: Never again
text: I got charged $39 for a fee when I paid my full price on here when I went to check out they asked me for exactly $39 but what for the room I got light was broken and shower didnt work right at all I paid $236 in total for my room then got charged 39 dollars when I left everything clean and never did any damage

title: Excellent value and convenience as well.
text: Club Quarters is across from Grand Central so conveniently located. The amenities are sufficient. Most of the staff and courteous. There is a problem with the elevators that is frustrating and may be why one staff member at the front desk is so discourteous.

title: Great Location, would be better with elevators
text: Love the location of this hotel, the price, and nightly reception, but when I stayed there in Feb, and elevators didn't work with regular room keys.  What this meant for me on the 14th floor is that I either had to get close to that floor (say the elevator stopped at Floor 10, I got off and walk the final 4), or I had to find a staff member to use their key to direct the elevator to the floor.  Until the elevators are working again, I recommend staying on either the top floors or street level floors.

title: Freundlich, sauber und super Lage! Wir kommen wieder!
text:
Das Hotel befindet sich nahe der Grand Central Station (5 min zu Fuß). Es gibt Dutzende Restaurants und Supermärkte in der nahen Umgebung. Hauptattraktionen wie das Chrysler Bulding, Empire State Building, Rockafeller Center und der Times Square sind fußläufig zu erreichen. Somit eignet sich die Unterkunft perfekt für New York Reisende die Sightseeing planen. Es gibt die Möglichkeit mit Bus und Subway in kürzester Zeit all die Orte zu erreichen, die zu Fuß zu weit entfernt sind. 

Wir reisten nach JFK. Hier nahmen wir bei der Hinreise das Yellow Cab. Hier gilt in NYC eine Pauschale von ca. 52$ wo dann nochmal Maur Gebühren, Trinkgeld und Steuern oben drauf kommen. So könnt ihr mit ca 70-75$ rechnen. 

Bei der Rückreise waren uns die Mitarbeiterinnen der Rezeption wie immer sehr gerne behilflich und riefen uns einen Fahrer für die Fahrt zum JFK. Der Preis hierfür betrug inklusive der Steuern und Maut 75$. Diese Variante war klasse. Viel komfortabler, sauberer, freundlicher und vor allem auch sicherer. Auf der Hinfahrt hatten wir einen Yellow Cab Fahrer der rüde war. Legte sich während der Fahrt aggressiv mit anderen Autofahren an. Er schlief permanent fast bei der Fahrt ein und gelangte ein paar mal fast in den Gegenverkehr!! 

Kommen wir zum Hotel: Wir hatten ein Superior Zimmer mit etwas mehr Platz. Die Größe des Zimmers war für 2 Personen ausreichend und für New Yorker Verhältnisse „groß“. 
Wir hatten einen relativ großen Kühlschrank, eine Mikrowelle und eine Kaffeemaschine auf dem Zimmer! 
Das Zimmer wurde täglich sehr gut gereinigt und war stets sauber! Das Bett etwas weich, aber komfortabel. Es gibt die Möglichkeit Netflix auf dem Fernseher zu nutzen! Das fanden wir klasse für einen gemütlichen verregneten Abend. 

Das Badezimmer war ausreichend groß. Aber leider war der Wasserdruck sehr stark und nicht regulierbar. Ansonsten auch hier nichts zu bemängeln! 

Einige bemängeln die Lautstärke auf den Zimmern. Leute, wer in Manhattan wohnt darf sich über Sirenen und eine gewisse Geräuschkulisse nicht wundern! Wir konnten trotzdem immer gut schlafen. 

Im 27. Stockwerk befindet sich eine kleine Minibar mit Softdrinks und Snacks, sowie frischem Obst und einem tollen Kaffee Vollautomat. Alles kostenlos!! Täglich um 17 Uhr findet zudem eine Wine Hour statt in der man umsonst Wein ausgeschenkt bekommt! Solch ein Service bieten die großen teilweise nur mit in exklusiven Bereichen und Executive Lounges an! Dazu bekommt man im 27. Stock als Gast nicht nur die genannten Annehmlichkeiten umsonst sondern auch einen tollen Ausblick!

Alle Mitarbeiter des Hauses, ob Servicekräfte, Reinigungskraft oder Rezeptionisten: Alle waren immer sehr sehr freundlich und hilfsbereit. 

Wir bedanken uns insbesondere bei Jillian, Sara und Sandy die immer gut gelaunt, freundlich und hilfsbereit bei allen Fragen waren. 

Tolle 8 Tage alles in allem! Beim nächsten New York Trip kommen wir sicher wieder!

title: Great value!!!
text: For the price, an incredible hotel! Clean, modern, everything works perfectly. Very new facilities, very good and modern bathroom, staff ias always willing to help, housekeeping was very good, a great stay overall.

title: Welcoming to NY
text:
Elizabeth and the rest of staff team carries the 5 stars score. They are always smiley, gentle.

The hotel is really well located + facilities of laundry in DIY system is so practical! Not to mention the yoga mat, one per room!

Only need to amend the air conditioning / heater to produce less noise

title: Great staff!
text: I had the pleasure of staying at this hotel this past weekend and I had a blast! The room was comfort and the location was great. Thank you to the amazing staff members during Sunday’s happy hour, Elizabeth and Marcos! They really went above and beyond to make sure our stay was perfect. Its team members like Elizabeth and Marcos that would make me return to Club Quarters! Also, Elizabeth’s dress was adorable!

title: Todo muy bien pensado!
text: Vinimos a nuestra luna de miel, el hotel está muy bien ubicado, su personal es muy amable y atento (sobre todo Elizabett) y a nosotras que nos encanta el vino y el café nos favoreció mucho que estos estuvieran gratis en las horas de snacks.

title: Sensible choice
text: Having stayed at Club Quarters hotels in different opportunities, I can say that it is a great chain of hotels, and Grand Central is no exception. The rooms are clean, comfortable and well thought. Location is great, walking distance to Grand Central (you can go anywhere from there via subway) and places like UN, 5th Ave, and others. They are not the most spacious if you have a lot of luggage, but this is easily manageable. The staff is very friendly and will go the extra mile to help with any needs. The coffee and snacks provided 24/7, and the 27th floor terrace and also great bonuses.

title: EXCELENTE
text:
Una gran hotel, me encantó. todo muy bien.   Definitivamente ahora será mi hotel al ir a NY.
El check-in y check out fue muy rápido.    Loscuartos tienen un tapete y servicio de videos para hacer ejercicio en la privacidad de tu cuarto.
Las botellas con agua en cada piso me encanto.
La terraza una gran idea de comodidad para el huesped.
Desafortunadamente no tiene cuartos con 2 camas dobles.

title: Clean, modern, comfortable with great "living room"
text: I made a quick trip up to New York and found this hotel on line. It was affordable and convenient so I booked it. But it was so much more than I anticipated. From now on it will be my go to hotel in NYC. The rooms, though small (which is fine in New York), were clean, comfortable, and modern. The staff -- Caesar, Sara, and Tre -- were wonderfully friendly. And, on the 27th floor, there is a terrific "living room" and balcony that provides a comfortable area to work and to take advantage of the fresh ground coffee and snacks. I look forward to my next visit.

title: Thank you
text: Much appreciate this hotel. Perfect in all respects. I'm shocked that I didn't know about this place earlier. Having lived in NYC for close to 20 years and having recently moved away (to Dallas) it's always nice to return, but the price-tag per location isn't always welcoming. This provided both and was hands-off and friendly. Great find and will come again.

title: Another GREAT stay at the Club Quarters Hotel, Grand Central
text:
Just got back from a great stay at the Club Quarters, Grand Central.  It was fun catching up with old friends (Jillian, Liz, & Greg) and making new ones (Crystal & Tre).  The staff is always so pleasant and friendly and willing to go out of their way to make your stay extra special.  Huge shout out to Jillian for going above & beyond!  Please know that it was definitely appreciated.

This hotel provides a lot of extra amenities that you just don’t find in most hotels, especially not ones in NYC.  The rooms are spacious (esp by NYC standards) & well appointed.  The Midtown Manhattan location is great.  The lounge on the 27th floor has a TV, computers, printers, and bathrooms.  There is also an outside patio area, with great views of NYC.  

The lounge is the place to be at the CQ.  For breakfast there is fresh fruit (red & green apples, oranges, & bananas) and designer granola bars, such as Luna, Kashi, and Lara.  After breakfast they offer fresh snacks such as Wasabi peas, M & M’s, Sesame sticks, etc., as well as packaged snack bags of popcorn, pita chips, etc., plus several different kinds of canned sodas.  

Then every day from 5-6 PM (also in the lounge) they have their free wine happy hour, where they offer glasses of red and white wines.  Coffee, tea, and water are available all day long.  Plus there are Keurig coffee makers in every room and mineral water dispensers (and bottles) on every floor too.  

I love staying at this hotel and highly recommend it to others all of the time.  Cheers!

title: Perfect Hotel
text:
This is 1 of the best hotel in NY. the price is very confortable and the position is pretty perfect . you are in the center of NY and you are very close to all the best place to visit.
Perfect Hotel..

title: EXCELENTE !!!!
text:
Opte por este hotel recomendado por una amiga... y supero mis expectativas.
Personal de recepcion : super amables,  la habitación , no es tan pequeña  , es bastante funcional , con horno microonda, heladera , cafetera  y lo mas importante ; Limpia!!! .
En el piso 27  hay frutas , café, gaseosas , snacks , computadoras, a tu disposición...y la vista es espectacular. 
Lo recomendaria y volveria !!

title: Great location in Midtown Manhattan
text: This hotel is at a great location in midtown Manhattan. Lots of places to eat around the hotel. Good family hotel. The observatory on the 27th floor gives very good view of Manhattan. Easily accessible through subway and Uber.

title: Valentines week
text:
Nice room. Comfy bed. Tea and coffee facilities in the room plus an upstairs communal lounge for free drinks, snacks and happy hour each evening too! 

Slow lifts - I didn’t worry but other guests were complaining each time we used them.

Didn’t have an iron or ironing board in the room. Didn’t ask if I could borrow one so have no idea if there was one available.

All in all a cute, friendly hotel in a good location. Would use again.

title: Security issues,  attempts to break into my iPad while in hotel safe.
text:
Poor hotel safe, iPad was attempted to be broken into while in hotel safe.
Numerous attempts to notify upper management at hotel and no response as to the problem and the apparent total breakdown of security.

title: Heat didn't work well
text:
For long periods of time during my stay, I'd set the thermostat to some reasonable temperature like 72F, and the heater would just go "click" every minute or so and wouldn't actually turn on the heat. This made the room very uncomfortable to stay in. The bathroom was even colder. 

I told the front desk about this, and while I was out they "fixed" it in some very impermanent way, and passive-aggressively turned the heat up to 80 for when I got back. As if to say "oh this isn't warm enough for you well HOW ABOUT THIS". The next morning it was 66 again.

Also the elevator is malicious and won't let you out at your floor.

title: Smells like urine and staff is very disorganized and slow
text: The room smells like urine and cigarettes.  It was only cleaned after I complained at the front desk.  After it was cleaned it continued to smell the same way.  It seemed like someone urinated in the floor

title: Elizabeth rocks
text: Shout out to Elizabeth at the front desk on excellence in customer service and EQ. She welcomed us in a warm and inviting manner and offered us great information on the property. When I asked about the size of the bed, she initiated a discussion to better understand our needs and didn't hesitate to look for ways to enhance our experience. This property is simply great and the location is very convenient.

title: Typical small NYC hotel but with great layout and appointments
text: This was my first time at this hotel but I will be back. I have stayed in many rooms this size but none had such an efficient layout and high quality furnishings. Great lighting for getting work done and great smart TV for entertainment.  Gym was nice and included a Peleton Bike.  Guest lounge had great snacks and coffee machine, with free wine in the evening.

title: Very friendly staff, nice room, amazing price
text: This is one of the best rates I've ever got in NYC. The room was really nice, quite spacious by NYC standards. They have water machines on all floors. Location is great. But what really stuck with me was how friendly all the staff were.

title: Club Quarter Grand Central
text: Rooms were good size for New York.  The lounge upstairs was great to socialize.  A college roommate came and there was plenty of room to sit, talk, drink free wine and snacks. The price for New York as very reasonable.

title: Great location
text: This was a perfect stay. The location was perfect. They were clean, staff was very friendly. I loved the roof top lounge. This was my 2nd stay with the CQ company 1st time at the Grand Central property. I will continue to stay with CQ in other states.

title: Great hotel excellent location
text: Staff were nice and the lounge was comfy with a nice view.. great location and the rooms were clean. Easy walk to grand central station and Times Square and many nice restaurants and shopping .. highly recommended

title: Felt like I was at camp
text: Started out by walking into a dreary dark and very plain lobby where I checked in.  Process was efficient but not welcoming.  Went up to my box of a room.  There is no closet. Just an armoire.  Room is efficiently laid out but it felt a bit claustrophobic. The pillows were rough and noisy.  Key didn’t work for the 27 floor so I could not access that floor.  The tv didn’t work at times either.  Finally, the gun is extremely small and basic.  To end things on a great note, the AC wasn’t working in the gum and it felt like a sauna.  No response from the hotel staff.  Will not stay here again and would not recommend.

title: Fantastic Last Minute Reservation
text: My boyfriend and I had a disastrous Airbnb experience so we decided to book a room at Club Quarters. Needless to say I was beyond impressed by the hotel and all of the staff. We were immediately greeted at the front desk by Elizabeth. She was phenomenal, she not only insured we were taken care of when we arrived she also checked on us regularly throughout our stay, absolutely FANTASTIC. I will definitely be recommending this hotel in the future.

title: Below Average Stay
text: The rooms were smaller than the average NYC boutique hotel. The telephone in the room was disconnected and when I called from my cell, they said they'd send someone right up. No one ever came up to fix it. The happy hour they offer is so below par. There's only about three 750 mL bottles of cheap wine and a few jars of bar snacks (trail mix, cinnamon raisin crisps). When those bottles run out, they don't replenish them. It's a really disappointing happy hour compared to other hotels' (servers, charcuterie plates, various olives/pickles, diff. breads, beer/diff. wines, etc.). The seating area is really outdated and kind of inconvenient for the size of the room. There was only one washcloth in the bathroom when we arrived, which was strange. They did bring up a few more when we called and requested them. Elizabeth, front desk rep, was really amazing and was super helpful. *I wouldn't depend on this* but I asked for a late check-out and they actually offered to waive the fee once I checked out. The front desk reps were really amazing. I don't really blame them for the negative features of this hotel. I'd just stay elsewhere.

title: GREAT CHECK IN STAFF
text:
The room was just as you'd expect at CQ. A bit small but well-appointed and clean. GREAT location and rooftop lounge.

Sara & Elizabeth & all the women whom we dealt with at the front desk were SUPERB - GREAT attitudes and wonderful customer Service!

title: Simple, well-designed comfort
text: This was my first stay at the Grand Central Club Quarters [on my final receipt, the hotel was listed as Hotel Boutique at Grand Central]. Relatively inexpensive, its daily Activities Fee was $21.72, fairly reasonable given the tendency of such new, unadvertised additions to NYC hotel fees to go up to $40/day. The hotel is new, and well-designed; my room was small but very comfortable, a bit like a cabin in a luxury ocean liner; the level of thoughtful detail is very high, right down to the placement of the light switches, electrical outlets, and wastepaper baskets. There are few traditional hotel services -- fine for those like me who don't want them. There's an excellent diner (we used to call them deli luncheonettes), the Comfort Diner, further east on 45th St, just beyond Third Ave. Coffee, fresh fruit, M&Ms, &c. are available free on the 27th floor of the hotel 24/7 -- the coffee and related hot drinks out of a complicated machine, and surprisingly good. (One of the many drinks options was "hot foam," which I never got around to trying, but wanted to). The front desk staff was particularly friendly and helpful. They were expert in helping me get the elevator buttons to work (the heat-sensitive buttons are failiing, and about to be replaced, but their insensitivity at present is a real nuisance). I shall return: recommended!

title: Love the staff, but some things to fix
text:
1. Great front desk staff - watched Sara and Elizabeth handle a number of issues and pretty rude clienta very skillfully
2. Shower needs volume adjust, not just temp
3. Elevator panel is a BIG loser ... we and many guests had problems getting it to work
4. Shower curtain ahould be weighted at the bottom so it doesn't blow into the shower when showering
All in all, though, CQ is a good value and we appreciate you!

title: Perfect location
text: This hotel is very comfortable for business travelers. Not only for its location but also it has a good meeting place at the 27th floor for business people and a relaxing place for the tourists as well.

title: DOPE HOTEL!
text: The hotel room was awesome. VERY clean and up to date. Pretty furniture, top of the line toilet and shower head in the bathroom. The location is great. The view from our room was awesome without an additional cost. Overall a 5-STAR experience. I absolutely recommend you stay here if you are reading this!

title: Everything you need for an NY visit
text:
First time in NY and was the perfect location hotel, we love walking and everything we did was walkable.

Special mention to Cenny who greeted us when we arrived and made sure our stay was the best it could’ve been.

Loved the hotel too, everything we needed, we’d definitely stay again too.

title: Affordable, comfortable and convenient
text: Very good Hotel, comfy beds and pillows. It is very well located just steps from Grand Central. The top floor was a good surprise! They always have coffee, tea, fruits and granola bars and in the evening, wine. All complementary. Very good staff, including Rafael who was great. The rooms are small, but have everything you need.

title: Great Hotel
text: We had a lovely stay at Christmas time. The Hotel is near some great places to sightsee a small walk away from Grand Central Station. The staff was lovely & so will to help out,would highly recommend this accommodation.

title: Amazing Hotel experience in NYC!!
text: I got a deal online to stay at the Club Quarters Hotel in NYC and I had a great experience. The location was in walking distance to everything in Midtown. I didn’t take a train or cab once. The hotel staff were very kind and helpful. I mean like everyone was helpful and smiled. Seeing people smile in NYC is a rare occurrence so that was refreshing. Also they had complimentary coffee, soda and snacks all day everyday. And there was complimentary wine at 5pm everyday. The room was very clean, and even though it was small it had all you needed. Fast WiFi, and an option to mirrorcast from your phone to the tv to watch Netflix or whatever. Honestly, I might exclusively only stay at this hotel from now on when I come to NYC, it was the greatest experience I’ve ever had.

title: Fantastic NY Gem!!
text: We absolutely LOVED this hotel! Staff is awesome, rooms are spacious and super comfy! Happy hour w free wine and snacks is a plus and great spot to unwind! If you’re looking for a place to stay which is conveniently located I highly recommend!

title: Excellent
text: Centrally located boutique hotel near great restaurants and bars. Staff is friendly and very courteous. The restaurant in the property is very good with a great selection in the bar. The bartender, Tim, is fantastic.

title: Good location in midtown
text:
We have stayed in other Club Quarters so we were familiar with this hotel. Our preference was to stay across from Rockerfeller Center but discovered the hotel changed to a Radisson and they didn't have rooms available during  our visit.

Club Quarters has a nice concept where they have complimentary bottled water refills on every floor. They have a lounge on the 27th floor and since we were here in Nov the outside patio wasn't open. It does have a nice view from the Club room-lots of light with tables and comfy chairs to relax in. We missed their complimentary happy hour from 5-6 pm during our three night stay so I can’t comment on that but they did have complimentary snacks (fruit, crackers, peanuts and M&N, soft drinks, coffee and tea) available in the Club room during normal hours which was very nice.

Our standard room didn’t have a mini fridge or microwave and I realize that the other times of our stay was for work purposes where my husband was in the city for much longer time. I should have reserved a superior room that has the mini fridge and microwave.

 The Davios restaurant on the lower level in the hotel serves  breakfast  only till 10 am. We had slept in due to the time difference and went down a few minutes after  they closed. There are other places close by so not a problem

The bathroom door was broken and didn't close so that was the only little negative I would note.

title: Nice little hotel in midtown, and great service
text: I had a very nice stay at the Club Quarter Hotel, Grand Central. I liked the central location in midtown Manhattan, the room and the proximity to Grand Central. I especially appreciate the front front desk rep, specifically Rafael,  who made a great effort to make my stay even more enjoyable by assisting me with finding the right room for my needs (the first room didn't work out for me because of the street noise on the Lex Ave. side). Thank you Rafael for making me feel at home at your hotel.

title: Tight fit
text:
I’m not a big city guy but I have travelled a good amount over the years. I wanted to spend a couple of nights in downtown Manhattan with my spouse to see a museum and the new Hudson Yards. I booked through Expedia as I often do. The $125 a night price on the Expedia site morphed into $165 with fees, taxes, etc. but being just a block from GST is a great location if you are arriving by train. Club Quarters is different, I’ll give them that. Definitely not a grand hotel feeling with a tiny lobby no real front desk and dim lighting. It’s a self-service almost dormitory vibe. There are amenities like a 27th floor terrace with snacks, coffee, computers and wine from 5pm to 6pm. There is an exercise place I did not visit. There is a closet on each floor with some items like steam irons available for guests but I could not get the coffee pods for the Keurig machine nor extra pillows I wanted and had to call the staff. They were accommodating.
The elevator buttons worked intermittently which was a pain sometimes riding up and down trying to get my floor button and the keycard to work. The basic room I had was quite small and I think set up for one person although our reservation was for two. The bathroom had two bath towels, one face towel and one wash cloth. The shower was great. Housekeeping is fine. There is little counter space in the bathroom. There was a microwave, a fridge and the coffee maker but no safe. Expedia listed a safe in their description but Club Quarter’s web site did not list one. A message sent to the hotel asking about this went unanswered. The HVAC was just a little noisy but the street noise on a Friday night on the 19th floor was unsettling and not conducive to a good night’s sleep. Saturday night was more tranquil.  I would not in the future accept a room across from the elevator the noise from which was also intrusive. We’re I young and traveling alone this hotel might be ok had I had a better room. I think for the price I could have found a place with less noise and more space.

title: Fantastico
text:
Fuimos en navidad y fue excelente, el servicio de recepción son súper amables y te ayudan en todo lo que necesites, limpieza también fantástico  y está muy bien ubicado cerca de Times Square y de la estación Gran Central.
Recomiendo este hotel, nos hizo la estancia muy agradable.

title: Do you want to feel like home in the middle of NYC?
text: Greeted by the lovely Elizabeth this little hotel was comfortable, very clean and had friendly staff the entire stay.  The rooms are perfect, clean and well designed. It was the perfect place to get good sleep during a week of work in the city.  My neighbors were all quiet and polite.  My new home away from home!

title: Fun Hotel and Great Happy Hour
text: We really had a great time during our few days at Club Quarters.  The rooms were a nice size (for New York) and their Happy Hour from 5 to 6 is really a good time with nice views of the city from the 27th floor.  A good mix of people were there during our stay so it was interesting to meet people from all over the world.  Next time we are in New York we will stay in Club Quarters again.

title: Empfehlenswert!
text:
Ich habe 3 Nächte in dem Hotel verbracht. Das Zimmer hatte für mich als Einzelperson die richtige Grösse, eine kleine Sitzgruppe war neben dem Queensizebett vorhanden. Bett sehr bequem. Das Bad war sauber und mit einer grossen Dusche ausgestattet. Über den TV kann man sich in Netflix etc. mit seinem eigenen Account einwählen (sehr praktisch). Wifi war schnell und 1GB gratis. Zudem Kühlschrank, Kaffeemaschine (incl. Kaffeekapseln) und Mikrowelle auf dem Zimmer.
Besonders erwähnenswert ist aber die super gemütliche Lounge in der 27. Etage. Hier gibt es rund um die Uhr Getränke (Cola, Limo, Wasser, Kaffee, Tee etc) sowie frisches Obst in riesigen Mengen und Snacks (Muesliriegel, Cookies, M&M, Erdnüsse etc) umsonst! Dazu der 360• Rundum-Blick). Dafür zahlt man an anderen Stellen in NY viel Geld! 
Zudem ist auf jeder Etage Trinkwasser im Flur über eine Art Zapfanlage zu bekommen, incl. Flaschen. 
Ich war schon einige Male in NewYork in verschiedenen Hotels, solch ein Angebot zu diesem Zimmerpreis hatte ich bisher noch nicht. 
Die Lage ist zudem Top, in wenigen Minuten ist man an der Grand Central Station.
Ich kann dieses Hotel definitv empfehlen!

title: Great times in nyc!
text: We really enjoyed our stay at the club quarters hotel for New Year’s Eve weekend. It’s conveniently located near Broadway and fifth Avenue and more. The lounge on the 27th floor is very nice. Great views. Elizabeth was super helpful. Thanks!!

title: Do not stay here!!!
text: Staff are rude and willing to assist with a simple request. We asked if they could lower the temperature in the lobby as we were struggling to breathe. I was told they don't control the temperature but when I started lowering the temperature of the temperature controller next to the reception desk, I was told off in a rude manner that I'm not allowed to touch the controller. The staff clearly aren't interested in the comfort of their guests, please don't reward this establishment with your business.

title: Happy Hour
text:
Estive com amigos no andar 27 pra um happy hour e foi uma experiência excelente. Tudo muito bem organizado, limpo, além de bem atendidos pelo Marcos Lioli, responsável pelo andar.
Snacks e bebidas para acompanhar as risadas e a bela vista do terraço.
Voltaremos!

title: One of the best hotel experiences!
text: Club Quarters was one of my best hotel stays ever. The location was awesome, the staff was very friendly and accommodating and the amenities like the 27th floor lounge with complimentary snacks and a 5pm free wine happy hour were awesome. We were also able to have them hold our bags before and after our check in/our time which made traveling so much more enjoyable. Rooms were also clean and very functional. Pleasantly surprised by this great value hotel!

title: Great Hotel in Midtown Manhattan
text:
Very efficient use of space, giving a lot while remaining modestly compact. Excellent cleaning staff. Great 27th floor common space with excellent views, snacks & seating. Mattress needs to be replaced (sank toward middle), TV had a discolored bar across top. Great staff, very helpful.
Overall, a great experience.

title: The best Hotel Staff EVER
text:
My first visit to New York was an outstanding experience because of the amazing Cenny, Tre, and Elizabeth (this hotel's staff. Not only were they friendly, professional, courteous, and quick to be helpful, they went out their way to make my family and I feel so much better about an awful experience with one of the restaurants that we visited, by leaving a beautiful card, candy, nuts, and wine in our room, while we were out. I am so very glad that they not only listened to us complain about the restaurant, but added to the enjoyment of our stay at their lovely hotel by showing that they cared. Free hot coffee, beverages  and snacks 24/7.

Veronica
Goodyear, Arizona &
Family from California

title: CQ review
text: The hotel is conveniently located near the venue where our conference takes place.  The filtered water stations are a BIG bonus.  The staff is very friendly, helpful and responsive.  We did have to ask for a second bath towel for our room, but this was provided quickly.  The location near Grand Central Station allows us quick access to food, shopping and the subway.

title: Girls Trip to NY
text: My Daughter, Mom, Sister and I enjoyed our stay here. The 1st night the room wasn’t what we booked and Cenny made sure our room was upgraded within hours. Cenny, Tre and Elizabeth gave great suggestions and directions for our 1st trip together here to NY and also had wine and snacks placed in our room. Great experience!!

title: Great Location
text: This is a very nice hotel in midtown Manhattan. The staff is very helpful and efficient. The room was nice and clean with a little table and sofa. Location is great within walking distance to most attractions.

title: Staying at Club Quarters Hotel Grand central
text:
I stayed there for business for a week. The location is super and nearby most of the relevant places.
The team there was exceptional and service oriented 
I would like top mentioned especially  Elisabeth Rafa greg who was super helpful and communicative

title: SIMPLESMENTE DEMAIS
text:
Ficamos 1 semana no hotel e só elogios à equipe sempre super atenciosa, bem humorada e disposta a ajudar, com serviço de quarto muito bom, ah com cafeteira no quarto também para tomar os deliciosos cafés de NY.

No 27º andar é servido bebidas e snacks o dia todo com cafés de vários tipos e refrigerantes a vontade.

- 17 as 22h serve vinho sem custo extra, é um excelente diferencial.
- Vista da cidade neste andar é maravilhosa.
- Perto de tudo
- Ao lado da Grand Central Station

Gostaria de agradecer aos funcionários MARCOS, SANDY E JORGE por tudo que fizeram e por toda atenção. São pessoas que merecem muito o reconhecimento. Simplesmente demais esse pessaal. Com certeza voltaremos a nos hospedar no Hotel e indicamos muito.

title: Pros and Cons
text: Close to Grand Central, stores and restaurants. Easy check-in/check-out. Nice bathroom and lighting. Lots of street noise, windows are not soundproof. Dated decor, changing out cheap, silk looking bedspread to a nice comforter would do wonders.

title: QC
text:
- Multimedia system doesn't work, no TV, no paid TV
- Shower is painful to take due to high water pressure, shower head wont hold in the holder because of it, shower room design makes floor wet all over disallowing post-shower use
- air conditioner is loud, impossible to sleep
- poor amenities (no slippers, bathrobes, drinking water, etc)

title: Hotel staff were great/rooms not so much
text: It just wasn't the right fit for me. I was not comfortable with the room set up and it had some issues. I wasn't going to complain that I could fit my fingers under the door, the gap was so huge I had to put a towel there. Heater was loud. Bathroom sink was dirty. Carpet dirty, stain on headboard, holes in sheets. It was just not a good pick for me. Staff were always great no complaints there. Friendly and helpful. I won't stay again.

title: Excelente!
text:
100% recomendable. Muy bien ubicado y una atención del personal de excelencia. Elizabeth no solo maneja fluidamente el español sino que fue atenta y muy amable a nuestras solicitudes. 
Nos facilitó mucho nuestra estadía y se tomó el tiempo necesario para ayudarnos con buenos tips para aprovechar el siempre escaso tiempo disponible para recorrer la ciudad más linda del mundo. Gracias Elizabeth!!!!

title: Good experince for the value
text: Nice hotel in a great location. Price was reasonable when compared to comparable to other midtown hotels. The lounge was cozy and the happy hour was nice. A short walk from Grand Central made it attractive for out of towners from Connecticut.

title: Best hotel experience by far!
text: EASY 10/10!!!!! Our recent stay at club quarters grand central was absolutely amazing! The room was so clean and cozy with a breath taking view. Awesome location in the city for a couples getaway, business trip, or family vacay. Tre, Jillian, Elizabeth, Greg and Cenny = best staff EVER! Thank you so so much for making our trip, and making it feel like home. We will most definitely be back. Highly recommend this hotel, don’t even waste your time searching. You won’t regret it, I promise!!!

title: Best Staff!!!
text: Elizabeth was so friendly and SO helpful!! She gave the best recommendations of all the hot spots around NYC. she also was eager to help us get transportation to the airport. Her charismatic personality really made our trip so enjoyable. Greg also was very fun and very helpful for everything to know here in the city. I’d come back for the staff alone!

title: Very Disappointing
text: From start to finish, our stay at this hotel was awful.  Several problems with the 3 rooms we booked to include one room that had a non functioning thermostat so no air or heat, one room that did not have the included chair bed and one room that required an extra rollout bed.   None of the rooms had adequate towels or blankets.  Most disappointing was the lack of care and concern by the hotel staff.  Despite making our needs known, maintenance was not called and our requests were not acknowledged and/or responded too.

title: Not Quite What I Expected.
text: Room was okay.  Was told there would be a fridge, but there was not one. However, one was delivered after I requested it.  Fitness Center was inadequate; Peloton bike was broken.  Was overcharged at checkout, so watch your bill.

title: Great staff, but small rooms
text: Hotel is in a great location.  Short walk to Grand Central Station, lots of restaurants and shopping.  The staff was efficient, friendly and professional.  Also, enjoyed the availability of snacks and work area in the common room.  Only downside is the size of the room...tiny.  It was clean and well maintained, but really small for two people.

title: Thanksgiving week
text:
Great value, location and amenities.
Good fitness room, great rooftop lounge, good wifi….
Staff friendly and helpful. Not sure how to improve on this one?
Definitely recommend for a NYC visit with Grand Central across the street!

title: An enjoyable four-night stay at Grand Central Club Quarters in NYC
text: Everything fine as advertised except “kitchenette.”  We expected a few dishes and cutlery, but there were none.  We had to search the neighborhood to buy a couple of cardboard cereal dishes and a couple of plastic spoons.  Other than that, the room was carefully and thoughtfully put together.

title: Great place. Rooms too small
text: Great, attentive staff, great location. Incredible lounge with free snacks, sodas, specialty coffees 24/7 and free wine for happy hour. Only complaint is that rooms are way too small even for NYC standards

title: Very Friendly staff
text:
Great staff in a friendly hotel near Grand Central. Rooms were compact but functional and very clean.
Nice lounge on the 27th floor. Check was fast and rooms were ready early. Awesome!
I changed it from 4 to 3 stars because I could not get out of this review.

title: Fix the elevator button issue!
text: Good hotel in a good spot, but you're playing Russian roulette with whether the elevator buttons will register your push and get you to your floor. Several times I tried to get to my 12th floor room only for the elevator to not register push, resulting in a trip all the way to the top and bottom a couple of times. This has been an issue during multiple stays at this hotel this year, and it's a known issue by the staff and others who have stayed here. You would think the hotel would invest in getting it fixed. It's become such a pain that I'm considering staying at other nearby hotels on future business trips. Just highly annoying.

title: Excellent hotel, and great price!
text: Love this hotel! Plenty to see and do around the area.  Rooms are clean, and staff are super friendly! The automatic latte/espresso machine on the 27th floor is a must visit every morning for a wake up drink, or any time throughout the day when you want something warm.  Even after dinner! They lay out snacks and fruit at all hours of the day and night too.  Have stayed here before, and would definitely stay here again! Love this hotel!!

title: Dean's visit to CQ Grand Central
text: CQ Grand Central is home from home, the crew are always friendly and efficient and the location and facilities are ideal.  I love the terrace lounge and the gym facilities.  The coffee machine and pods are a bonus which makes one feel at home.

title: The cutest boutique hotel in New York City
text: My family went up for the weekend to catch a show. First time staying here. The rooms were so comfy and clean. The staff is So friendly and fun. We loved the 5:00 wine and snack hour!’ All around a Great  place to stay

title: Still my top choice hotel in NYC
text: The friendly staff, great amenities, clean rooms and convenient location always keep me coming back whenever I’m in NYC. I’ve never had any issues when staying here, and I always have a really pleasant stay.

title: Gutes Hotel
text: Das Hotel liegt sehr zentral, saubere Zimmer mit Kaffeemaschine, es gibt kein Frühstück, aber einen Aufenthaltsraum im 23. Stockwerk mit kleinen Snacks und Getränken, freundliche und engagierte Mitarbeiter, sonst sehr anonym

title: Excelente hotel
text: Estuvimos con mi madre por espacio de 11 noches. Muy completo el servicio del hotel. Utilizamos a diario el agua filtrada, y el laundry room. También disfrutamos de la hermosa terraza y el happy hour diario! La ubicación es inmejorable. Nos movimos siempre hacia todos lados en subte sin problemas. El personal muy atento y diligente.

title: Great location, great service in NYC
text: Thanks to the staff at Club Quarters for all their help with our group booking. We had an excellent time. The rooms are good size really happy with the in room yoga mat. Thanks to Elisabeth who was really attentive to what a visitor to New York needs to know. Really helpful team. The wine on floor 27 is a must!

title: Great Experience!
text: Great experience, very professional staff. The hotel met all of my expectations. It was centrally located for what I needed to do. Even though 2 out of the 3 elevators were out the front desk told me before I registered and put me in a lower floor so I could use the stairs at least to go down. The price of the room was very reasonable.

title: Great Visit
text: If you’re looking for a convenient clean and well located hotel this is it. Nothing fancy. Very useful. The 27 th floor snack room is a nice touch. Grand central is an attraction on its own account.visit the oyster bar.

title: Happy hour or bust
text: We met Elizabeth during the happy hour (right after we checked in) and she was an AMAZING first impression. The location is excellent but her customer service will have us return before anything else (you can stay anywhere in NYC tbh) happy hours are fun, but she locked it down. She checked on us multiple times and really made us feel welcome despite the crowd. 10/10 would stay for Elizabeth again

title: Birthday weekend
text: People were friendly, room was clean and comfortable.  My one complaint, the TV did not work.  When we checked in and I mentioned my birthday, they sent a bottle of wine as a birthday gift.  I thought that was very thoughtful.  They had coffee 24/7 and happy hour from 5-6 everyday,  lots of snacks.  I enjoyed hanging out in the common room,  I will definitely stay there again.

title: Flying Visit to New York
text: A comfortable and convenient hotel! Good location as close to the office and central station which means you can get to wherever you need quickly and easily.  I have stayed there several times so I feel safe and relaxed.  Staff are always helpful!

title: My November stay
text: I am an avid fan of Club Quarters at Grand Central.  It's the best hotel for the price and the service is exceptional.  Highly recommend.  The rooms are spacious for NYC, and the hospitality in the morning and evening is so appreciated.

title: Great location
text: This hotel has a great location and is walking distance to a lot! Only drawback was that we were given a handicap room, the shower ending up soaking the whole bathroom turning it into a slip and slide. Also the water pressure was slightly unbearable,

title: New York Ckub Quarters Hotel Experience
text:
Upon arrival we were greeted with an inviting smile and warm welcome from Elizabeth!! That immediately set the tone of our stay. During our check-in Elizabeth took the time to expain all of the Club Quarters Hotels amenities and perks all the while making us laugh. She could tell that my sister and I were more reserved but encouraged us to participate in all the hotels amenities which made our stay pleasurable. She is a lovely and professional agent and made our stay enjoyable.

Johnny was extemely helpful and flexible with our questions and needs. He was very discrete, kind, respectful and punctual.  

My sister and I took a chance on this hotel and we are glad we did!. We travel a lot but our stay in New York was limited but the service here was unlimited. Thank you for your hospitality. We will definitly come back and will also check out the other locations on our tracels for Club Quarters Hotel.

title: Nice Hotel, bit expensive
text:
Positive: GREAT location, friendly staff, decent rooms, 24h coffee and fruits, wine o´clock, nice rooftop.
Negative: elevators were not working properly and the "resort/facilities fee" is very expensive.

title: Great Location
text: I loved the central location of this hotel. So easy to get around the city. The hotel has a nice club on the top floor with great views and free wine starting at 5pm. Plus snacks and coffee. Rooms were on the small side but that’s NYC. Room was clean and bed was comfortable.

title: Nice location near Grand Central
text: Small, but efficiently appointed room. View of Chrysler Building. Only one ice machine on 3rd floor. Good AC.  My requested wake up call did not occur. The elevator card reader did not work so access to “Club Level” was not possible.  Free wine @ 5, skyline views, morning coffee...Nope.

title: Excellent Value, Location and Staff
text: First off, the $33 nightly parking fee can not be beat anyplace else in NYC! The Happy Hour is a pleasant surprise, as is the purified water station on each floor. This is not a luxury hotel, nor does it pretend to be. It is perfect for a long term stay, whether for business travelers or others seeking an apartment like setting. The room was clean and the bathroom was more than fine. Room was no different in size than much more expensive hotels I have stayed in the past. I was on the 9th floor on the Lexington Ave. side and the noise level was minimal. Proximity to subway, Grand Central - all greatly convenient. Hotel staff helpful, efficient and friendly- they held my bags the next day until I was ready to get my car. Davios, a great chop house, is a nice addition to have attached to the hotel. I will definitely stay again!

title: Failed Experiment. Never again.
text: I was staying in Manhattan for an extended trip and wanted a place with a kitchen and a refrigerator.  Club Quarters looked like it ticked all the boxes. Sadly the reality as a little different. While the room itself was perfectly adequate, the kitchen area was minuscule, there were no utensils to use, the WiFi was set so that you had to sign in every single time you looked at your device, and most annoying of all the lift call buttons did not work. Everyone visiting had a hard time getting the buttons to work.  The staff were aware but in the 12 days I stayed nothing was done to fix the problem.  I really wanted to like Club Quarters but it was unnecessarily disappointing.

title: Great facility, great location, great value
text: First, you can't beat the location one block away from Grand Central.  Secondly, the rooms are modern and thoughtfully appointed, albeit on the small side. Thirdly, service is impeccable from the young and enthusiastic staff. The lounge on the top floor with a view of midtown, free beverages and snacks is a great bonus. Highly recommended for business travelers and couples, not so much for families due to small room size.

title: Perfekt für einen Städtetrip
text: Super Lage direkt an der Grand Central Station mit vielen kleinen Restaurants und Imbissgelegenheiten im Umkreis. Die Wein-Happy-Hour und den ganzen Tag Softdrinks, Snacks, Kaffee, Tee und die Wasserspender sind perfekt wenn man zwischendrin mal Pause vom Trubel der Großstadt möchte. Unser Zimmer war sehr ruhig im 15 Stock gelegen, sauber und das Internet funktionierte sehr gut. Ich würde dieses Hotel sofort wieder buchen!

title: Good place to stay for businees in NYC
text: The Club Quarters seem to be built for business travel.  the rooms at this one are small (as are most in Manhattan) but well-designed and functional.  There's a comfortable chair with built ins next to it with plenty of plugs/USBs for all my devices.  The closet and drawers are sufficient for a longer stay.  There is a nice happy hour on the top floor.  The one quirk is the elevator was a bit difficult to operate - one had to hold down the button for a long time (~10 seconds) or that floor wouldn't stay lit.  Once you knew the trick, it was fine, but lots of people were on the elevator after having missed their floor.

title: Great value and lots of personal attention!
text:
Great value, great location, and unexpected perks such as happy hour, snacks, espresso machine and truly terrific service.  Within walking distance to the iconic Grand Central, Central Park and to Broadway shows too. 
 This hotel is a keeper!

title: Great Hotel- CQ Hotel
text: Hotel is very convenient to Central Park, Time Square and Grand Central Station. Rooms are adequate and clean. Look forward to next stay.  Only issue I had was the location of coffee maker and how it had to be “rigged” to hook to electrical outlet. But truly appreciated having coffee maker in room. Liked the yoga mat as well.

title: Very nice stay
text: Reading all the reviews about the size of hotel rooms in midtown Manhattan, I was positively surprised. The room was very clean and of decent size. The staff was very friendly and attending. The living room on the 27th floor with free coffee and snacks was a bonus.

title: Buono
text: Hotel vicinissimo alla Grand Central Station, da dove è possibile prendere tantissime linee della metro per girare la città. Le camere sono standard, ma ben curate e pulite. Terrazza bellissima dalla quale ammirare un panorama mozzafiato!

title: Great location…and…and…
text: That fact that this hotel is in a great location is a given, especially as the overnight rate gives that one away. Beyond that, you’re instantly reminded that there’s a ‘happy hour’ every day on the top floor, which btw, draws quite the crowd. Beyond that, the hotel is very average, with a rough and ready lobby area, which gets crowded easily. The room itself was ok, but didn’t have a safe-keeping facility in the room, which is a major omission. You can lodge your precious items in a communal room on one of the lower floors, which was a time consuming affair. The hotel doesn’t have a restaurant/bar either, which is odd too. Beyond the great location, there’s little else to get excited about with this hotel.

title: Buena relacion calidad precio
text: El acceso al hotel estupendo, la zona muy tranquila, la zona de café y fruta fue de gran ayuda para el desayuno y los momentos de descanso. La cama es comodísima, y el silencio en la habitación, nos dieron una a la Lexington Av y las vistas eran estupendas

title: Factura
text:
A ultima hora nos cobraron 200 doláres de más.
La factura no refleja la verdad de lo cargado.
Booking nos dio un precio fijo con todo incluido y no lo cumplieron.
Una pena porque el personal nos trató muy bien

title: Excelente experiência
text:
Ficamos uma semana no hotel e só consigo tecer elogios à equipe sempre atenciosa, bem humorada e disposta a ajudar, ao quarto que tem o tamanho ideal (com cozinha), com serviço de quarto discreto e eficiente.

No 27º andar é servido bebidas e snacks o dia todo, entre 17 e 19h um funcionário do hotel serve vinho, é um excelente diferencial. A vista da cidade neste andar é maravilhosa.

Gostaria de agradecer à funcionária Elizabeth pelos excelentes serviços prestados. Com certeza voltaremos a nos hospedar no Hotel.

title: Great location and amazing staff
text: The staff was amazing, they brought us a complementary bottle of wine. Beautiful terrace on the 27th floor with complementary happy hour every evening. Bed was comfortable and room was clean. The shower water pressure wasn’t the best but nothing that would keep me from staying there again. Excellent location.

title: Great place to stay
text: Club Quarters Grand Central is my go to place. Compact but very comfortable. Well appointed and well located. Love the roof top lounge and the wine happy hour. Late night snacks and breakfast snack are terrific.

title: Awful
text: The elevators do not work don’t  stay here  also the shower sprays everywhere when you turn it on. There is no bar or restaurant here either. Staff was annoying and unhelpful. When i complained about the elevators they said there is nothing they can do and they charged me for late checkout instead of throwing that in for the broken elevators

title: Great place to stay, and the staff made sure of it
text: Cenny, Tre, and Elizabeth were charming, professional, and very interested in making sure we enjoyed our stay in NYC! The facility was safe, clean, and near everything we needed. The views from the club house were spectacular, and it was great to sit out on the balcony and take in the city lights.

title: Nice Stay!
text:
Kudos to Tre, Jillian, Cenny and Pete for making our stay in NY so memorable.  Truly appreciated the early check-in process to accommodate us after a red eye flight.  

The Happy Hour drinks and snacks gave us a great respite to relax from our busy days.   

Thank you!

title: Excellent location
text:
We stayed at the CQ Grand Central 9th -16th October. The location (literally across the road from Grand Central) was brilliant for our sight seeing needs.
The greeting when we arrived was friendly and professional meaning the booking in process was quick and simple. Had I booked directly through CQ it would have been even easier with their app.
The room was on the 26th floor so traffic noise was minimised, it was also handy for popping up to the club room.
The fruit and snacks were very welcome. We didn't go up for the "happy hour" but know it was well attended by the other guests and provides an excellent chance to use the roof terrace.
The room was certainly adequate for our needs (two adults) but if you're the sort that likes to really spread out you may be disappointed. The bathroom was compact by many US hotel standards but this is NYC.... what do you expect?
All of the staff we met from the foyer to our housekeeper were extremely polite and friendly. 
I would have no hesitation in booking this hotel again if we were returning to New York.

title: Tiny rooms but everything that we needed
text: Loved the location and the room was compact but had everything that we needed for a good price ( booked through Booking.com ). Good coffee and snacks on the 27th floor and nice touch with the reusable water bottles and filler stations.

title: Excellent hotel
text: We loved this hotel, very clean and good sized room we had a double bed and a single pull out sofa and still had loads of room, the beds were really comfy and we all slept great, all the staff I encountered were so nice and helpful, it’s just round the corner across from the market entrance to the grand central station, so good we are booked to go back.

title: Amazing location, incredible staff!
text: Stayed here last weekend with my girlfriend and we loved it! Amazing price for the location. Clean room. But the best part was the staff. Elizabeth was so helpful and kind and we enjoyed every interaction with other staff members as well. Can't wait to come back!

title: Excellent stay
text: Hotel is very close by Grand Central.They were friendly at the check in, the room was clean and big. They had free water, tea and coffee. Very happy with my stay. Will definitely come back and stay here next time.

title: Amazing Location and great value.
text: We had an really great experience with this hotel. The staff was extremely friendly and the location can’t be any better. We wanted the New York experience without the craziness of the city. We were walking distance from Times Square and had unlimited food options.

title: Сложно оставить корректный отзыв
text: Вроде все нормально, но каждый раз когда вы ждёте лифт на первом этаже , будете вынуждены рассматривать ковёр в каких то пятнах , то ли жвачки от него оторвали, то ли еще что то. Но сразу отношение портится ... убрали бы вообще этот ковёр. Какая то неухоженность бросается в глаза . Сотрудники хорошие. Окна не открываются . За 400 долларов в сутки можно найти наверное что то получше

title: Great place in the heart of Manhattan
text: This was my second time at Club Quarters, and on both occasions, the service has been terrific, the room small but beautifully appointed and immaculate. And how could you improve on the location? My wife and I were able to walk to most of the places we needed to be, and we had the sense of being in the very heart of one of the world's great cities — a city even more intense than London, which we visited the month before.

title: Great Place - Central to EVERYTHING
text: Great staff experience - everyone was friendly and super helpful.  The rooms were clean, comfortable, and very quiet!  The hotel itself - with Happy Hour, an incredible coffee/espresso machine, and the terrace overlooking the city completed the outstanding experience.  Now, if I could just get one of the espresso machines at work...!!

title: Excelente estadía
text: Es un excelente hotel, muy bien ubicado, cerca de todo. Es muy limpio, ofrecen un servicio de snacks y bebidas en el piso 27 que te saca de cualquier apuro, en la recepción son muy amables, especialmente Cenny y Tre, que nos han ayudado en todo lo que necesitamos. Es para recomendar.

title: It is ok
text: The room was small but the bathroom renovated. The view was not very exciting - just towards an office building and down to some airconditioning installations. The rooftop with drinks all day we enjoyed but the lobby very narrow!

title: Small and basic for the price
text: Look around.  There is lots of choice in the area that presents as better options.  Room are small.  Beds are average.  There is no foyer to meet in.  it is a basic accomodation set up.  Staff are polite and helpful.

title: Amended Review for this Hotel
text: I had initially written a glowing review of this hotel.  However, I just saw a charge on my credit card for this hotel that shouldn't be there.  I purchased this through priceline and all costs (room, taxes, etc.) were supposed to be included.  I called and they apparently charge a "resort fee" - even though this definitely is NOT anything close to a resort!  It's a decent midtown hotel - that's it.  I explained that priceline never mentioned anything about a resort fee, nor did their front desk staff when I checked in.  I asked them to waive this under the circumstances and they refused.  Nothing I can do now, but I wanted to warn other travelers about this bait and switch tactic.  I won't be staying here again as a result.

title: Fall Vacation in Manhattan
text:
Very good location, excellent conditions.
Hotel is clean, we appreciate that they have filtered water for free at every floor.
Happy Hour at 5pm every day!!!
We plan to return to this location whenever we are going to visit Manhattan.

title: Good, not exceptional
text: Nothing special.  Rooms were a bit on the small side with small bathrooms as well.  Lounge was crowded.  Hotel staff was more interested in getting you to sign up for the app than in helping you check out quickly.

title: Perfect location and great hotel overall!
text: Love the hotel's proximity to Grand Central Station.  The staff was very attentive to our needs.  They had a great free wine happy hour and snacks every day which was nice.  The rooftop terrace was wonderful for relaxing with the beautiful view.  Would definitely stay at again!

title: Excellent and charming hotel
text: Schoon, prettige hotel, met gunstige ligging. Ruime kamers, op bovenste verdieping gastvrije ruimte met vrije drankjes en snacks. Goede service: toen onze gewenste kamer met keuken niet beschikbaar bleek, heeft Elizabeth ons geupgraded naar een suite.

title: Great midtown Manhattan hotel with a few perks
text: I really enjoyed my stay here. The free drinks and snacks on the 27th floor made all the difference, which is something you don't get at other hotels. The location is probably the best in the area, as you are steps from the Chrysler Building as well as the subway.

title: A little disappointing
text: Not as good as other Club Quarters I have stayed at. Staff was immature and unprofessional.  Elevators made noises that made us feel uncomfortable.  Fire Alarm went of four times on a Saturday morning.  Even the announcements that they were false alarms were not professional.  Concierge was useless.  We got out as soon as we could.

title: Great stay!
text: Thanks for having us!  Love the room and location!  The rooftop lounge is a great addition.  Checkout via app is the quickest way to do it rather than wait online in the lobby.  Highly recommend you join their club membership.

title: Excellent Customer Service!!
text:
We travel often & it’s rare to find really good customer service.
Well, the staff @ Club Quarters Boutique Hotel were the BEST!!! Especially 
Elizabeth & Sandy-they were outstanding, 
We enjoyed our stay & will return!!

title: 4 days in Manhattan
text: We had a studio with bedroom, living and kitchen, Bedroom was spacious, view was amazing, the staff very friendly. We have to teens that slept on the extended couch very comfortable. We appreciated the "Happy Hour " and also the fact that snacks were available free 24 h.

title: Love this hotel
