Also when I was checking in and out there was no mention of the resort fee at all. It was simply charged on my credit card. I'm curious whether everyone who booked this hotel through the third party is aware of this nonsense. If there was no issue regarding the resort fee I have given 5 star on this hotel. But everyone please be aware of this misleading resort fee charge.

title: A fantastic stay with some innovative hotel features
text:
A fantastic hotel with lots more going for it than you might know at first. 

The reception is small but I arrived at a good time and check in was instant. When full with people checking in and going up in the elevator it can look a little chaotic, but do not go on first impressions. 

The rooms are fine but there is more than meets the eye. Food can be ordered direct to the room from dozens of places or from the downstairs Italian place. The 27th floor room and balcony has free snacks, fruit and drinks all day (tea and coffee then wine from five).  The internet is always free both in room and up on floor 27 with computers to use there.

Meetings can be held there or just to relax. Your phone can become a mobile door key with their app which also acts as a guide when in New York. There is free chilled, purified water on each floor in refillable bottles. Rooms have yoga mats. There is a fitness floor. The TV has all kinds of functions beyond watching programmes such as streaming to it.  There is a cupboard on the landing near the rooms with more room items to self-refill if needed. These are clever touches that really added to my stay.  

The rooms for central NY are a decent size with helpful bathroom items, iron and board, seating/office area and bed, various lighting options and USB charing. 

I only had three very minor issues. First, a slightly loose electrical fitting (room 2109 near the door) and secondly, a crack in the sink. The other minor issue was the loud noise of the air conditioning but that was because it was highly effective. After a while it can just be turned off. 

But these were minor issues and did not impact on my stay at all. Looking out directly at the Empire State building in front of me kind of balanced it out.  The shower was good, towels are plentiful. The bed and bedding were fine. I like their commitment to minimising washes, you can choose when they change the bed and towels.

I'll be back. The place is great, the staff are friendly and chat when they see you. It's a feel good place. The staff cannot be more helpful and importantly, they seem happy and proud to work there.  We had some laughs and the free wine@5 kept flowing.

Explore floor 27, order some food, get free coffees and cold water all day, try the linked restaurant directly from the hotel. Have free snacks, free fruit, relax in the club room and the balcony.  This is a different experience, more like being in an apartment block than a hotel. But then apartments don't have free coffee either!

I've given a five star review. I'm not saying this is a perfect place, the lobby is small, there are tiny quibbles I mentioned. But you know what, I didn't care a jot. The experience here was great, the staff were helpful and the various features are a step beyond other places. 

I think of this more like managed apartments than a hotel, if you have everything you need such as socket adaptors and so on, you'll have a great experience. This is a different experience to an old style hotel.
 
The Thai food I ordered directly from my laptop is on my way to the room, last night it was great crispy chicken from another place.  You manage your own staff here. Somehow any minor quibbles go away when you can order food, get free refills and relax looking out at central New York.

title: Ottimo, ma attenti al "gratis"...
text:
Hotel ben posizionato e con tutti i comfort necessari. Su ognuno dei 27 piani troverete un distributore automatico di acqua potabile gratuita. All'ultimo piano inoltre ci sarà una terrazza panoramica dove potrete gustare snack, frutta fresca, bevande calde/tisane, sempre gratuitamente. 
Attenzione però: per tutti questi servizi "gratis" verranno addebitati 20 dollari extra al giorno sul conto della vostra camera. Questa cosa non è ben specificata al momento del check in. Mettetelo in conto.
Sicuramente questi 20$ al dì valgono il servizio ricevuto.
Ottimo hotel!

title: Good value, great staff, excellent location : actually slept well in NYC
text:
This is my second time at CQ - Grand Central. Because I had such an amazing nights sleep there the first time, I also stayed at CQ Wall st and that delivered as well.

It’s very unfussy but they get the important things right - really friendly, efficient staff with a good positive attitude. Rooms are clean and have what you need if you are mainly spending all your time outside your hotel room. Nice comfortable bed and tea/coffee etc

What I like about it most is that despite its location the rooms I’ve had have been really quiet. I haven’t been woken by other guests or - amazing for NY - street noise.

They also provide free water stations on every floor and the happy hour with free wine is a really nice idea if you’re at a loose end or working and can get out the room. 

Will be back! Ticks the boxes that matter.

title: Misuse of credit card
text: Be warned! This hotel will misuse your credit card! Have charged my credit card 2000 $ plus without documentation and my signature. Very upsetting since the rooms were prepaid by my travel agency. Make sure that you don't let the hotel make a print of your credit card and get receipt of all your purchases!

title: Great location & great value
text: This CQ hit all the marks. Really large room (no fridge or microwave though) that was kept very clean. Easy check in/out process; love the refill water stations (though they are a touch slow to fill); clean gym with all the equipment you'd need. Terrific stay. The location is amazing, close to any train you'd need.

title: Wouldn’t stay anywhere else.
text: Stayed a number of times but never realized the hotel has a 27th story deck with a great view.  20 minute walk to almost all Broadway venues. You can enjoy Manhattan but are never far from your bed. What’s not to like?

title: Excellent Low Key Hotel
text: I would definitely stay here again!  I was on a 5 day vacation with my two adult daughters.  We had two rooms.  They shared one which was a bit tight but they managed just fine.  Highlights: The staff, most 3 of 5 we saw, we're very friendly and helpful.  The 27th Floor - lovely lounge area with "free" snacks and coffee etc.  3 Elevators that worked well - although the swiping of the card reader to chose your floor was tricky.  You had to swipe several times before the button would "take".  Wifi was good, room was clean and in good condition.  Shower pressure good.  Lots of room in bathroom for toiletries.  Very compact but very well laid out.  My only real compliant is the noise from the AC unit - VERY LOUD.  You know when it drowns out NYC traffic it has to really be something!  But overall a very pleasant experience.

title: Escolha perfeita
text: Hotel muito bem localizado, numa área mais tranquila, mas perto do agito. O atendimento é nota 10, quarto de tamanho bom, com armário e cama confortável, limpeza impecável. Em todos os andares disponibilizam água com garrafinhas personalizadas.  No 27 andar tem à disposição dos hóspedes máquina de café, água, refrigerante, frutas, barras de cereal e no final da tarde, oferecem vinhos e snacks. No 3 andar tem a sala da academia e a sala onde funciona a lavanderia com duas máquinas disponíveis aos hóspedes, sem custo adicional. Recomendo esse hotel e voltaria com certeza!!

title: Very nice, great stay, few hiccups
text: I was in the city for a work training and this hotel put my exactly 2 blocks from my training building. The location of the hotel is wonderful, as you are close to restaurants, Bryant Park, Grand Central, Times Square, etc. My room was clean and well kept - no complaints there! I did have some trouble with my room key not working in the elevator, so I brought it to the staff and they easily solved the issue within minutes. I also had trouble one evening getting into my room with my key. After going down to the desk twice, they figured that the battery on my door had died and told me that somebody would come to fix it the next day. They worked very quickly to get me into my room and were apologetic, which I appreciated. Finally, the deadbolt on my door did not work. I'm sure had I said something to the staff they would have done something about it, but I didn't bother. Overall, the staff was friendly and helpful, the room and hotel in general is very clean, and the location is ideal (if you want or need to be in Midtown).

title: Perfect choice
text:
Perfect hotel close to Grand Central Station. Superior service and good value.
Free wine from 5:00 to 6:00 PM with very nice hosts.
Free coffee and soft drinks the whole day.
Terasse at 27th floor is amazing to take pictures of Chrysler Building and others.
We will come back!

title: Tiny room with no place for a 28” suitcase.
text: Midtown location. The entrance from the street (I hesitate to call it a lobby) was tiny as was the room. I paid for a room that was pictured with a small table and bench seating, but there was no table and only one chair. The room did not even have a luggage rack, nor was there space for one. For the two days my wife and I were there, we had to deal with having our suitcase on the floor. However, the room seemed reasonably tidy and the location worked for us as it was a block from Grand Central. Not sure if I’d return.

title: Parfait
text: Excellent service. Personnel souriant et courtois. Chambre confortable et très propre. Accès à la terrasse au 27e étage où nous avons pu apporter notre bouteille de vin et relaxer. Plusieurs détails qui font la différence comme les grignotines et les fruits qui sont offerts ainsi que des bouteilles d’eau à remplir. Le verre de vin offert entre 5 et 6 sur la terrasse : très sympathique. Nous avons pu laisser nos valises à l’arrivée avant l’heure du « check-in » pour commencer notre visite sans inquiétude et les laisser après le « check-out » pour profiter des dernières heures avant l’arrivée de la navette pour l’aéroport. Super.

title: Lovely hotel *5 star service from Elizabeth
text: We are staying here for a week. Great location. Jonny put us up on the 25th floor away from the noise. Excellent!! Elizabeth is an absolute asset to club quarters she was attentive, knowledgeable and so helpful. Would recommend this hotel. Comfy beds and helpful staff

title: First time in NY hotel!
text: It was our first time staying in a New York hotel and was bit nervous about what to expect. Our stay was more than comfortable! The room was small, but definitely not as small as I had expected. The bed was very comfortable and shower pressure was great! Great location. The staff was extremely friendly! We will be staying here every time we visit our daughter!

title: Très bien
text: Hôtel très bien situé (à 10mns à pied de Time Square) chambre spacieuse et propre, préférez une chambre en hauteur car nous étions au 10eme étage qui donnait sur une cour avec une soufflerie bruyante ! Superbe vue au 27eme étage avec apéritif offert de 17h à 18h où le personnel est très aimable. Par contre accueil froid à la réception.

title: Club Quarters Grand Central review
text:
Fantastic hotel!    The first requirements I have when booking a hotel is location, cleanliness and security.  QCGC aced all of these and more!
From the moment we arrived (noon) we were greeted by professional, friendly staff who did everything in their control to accommodate any request.   Our room was not ready so they checked our luggage (at no charge) and invited us to the 27th floor.  Our return flight was a late evening flight again we checked our luggage and headed out to enjoy our last day in NYC.  Upon arrival to retrieve our luggage we again where invited to the 27th floor to relax. Thanks to Greg that was a perfect way to end our trip.
The location is perfect midtown east a few minutes walk to lots of attractions. The hotel is extremely clean. The elevator requires your room key to access the floors.  
The rooms are what is to be expected in NYC as far a size but well laid out.  The bed was comfortable, linens and towels were great shower was hot.  Did not use safety deposit on the 2nd floor but they were available,  The water stations on each floor a nice added touch.
There is a gym and laundry facility as well and all  free.  
The 27th floor is a great place to chill after a full day of tours and the snacks and beverages are yet another added bonus.
The real perk here is the staff.  Front desk, housekeeping and maintenance staff always had a smile and were friendly and welcoming.  The team constantly stated how friendly we Canadians are (even if the Raptors were kicking butt) but they  rank right up there. 
This is my hotel for my next trip to NYC hands down.  Thank you to all the staff!!

title: Nice place close to Grand Central Station
text:
This is a very convenient hotel near Grand Central Station.  The rooms are clean and the staff reasonable and helpful.  The breakfast drinks, snacks and happy hour is a nice addition.
There are several restaurants close by and transport at Grand Central is wonderful.  I would stay there again.

title: Pleasantly Surprised
text: Picked CQ as an alternative to our usual stay (Grand Hyatt, 5mins away), based on positive reviews. Knew was going to be smaller so wasn’t quite sure what to expect. Surprised initially at the reception and the room (reminded me a bit of Premier Inn back home). Once in and settled though, checked out the club living room and that was it. Completely won over. Staff are a credit and deserve all their plaudits. Had a room on 20th floor to get away from street level noise as far as possible in NYC. Resort fee is reasonable in comparison to other hotels. The whole club room thing with wine and snacks is a winner and well worth a visit if you want to chill and re charge. Safety deposit boxes are in a strong room on second floor, which are a twin key arrangement (you and staff member), which seemed a bit inconvenient as apposed to room safes, but soon planned around this. We had a standard room rather than club room, which I believe were smaller, so would avoid if possible as a leisure traveller. Caught a few residents looking to change rooms at times in reception, which the staff seemed to be trying to accommodate. Reminded me of Premier Inn a touch back home at first. Can’t really add much more than the other positive reviews of this CQ hotel, with the staff being a credit to it (unfair to single anyone out, but I’m still not your type Chris 😉). Really pleased we chose this over our usual. Would recommend and would definitely return, assuming the high standard of staffing is retained.

title: I’ve felt cheated, it wasn’t the Hotel Boutique at Grand Central, it was Club Quarters after all!
text: First of all, when I booked this hotel the name was Hotel Boutique at Grand Central, didn’t mention it was Club Quarters. And as you can see, I’ve received an email from Club Quarters to rate the hotel. I’ve felt completely cheated because I had read bad reviews about Club Quarters and didn’t want to stay there, so it was a big surprise when I got to the address and there was only a sign saying it was Club Quarters, it was past 10pm and I had to enter and ask the recepcionist if the hotel was Hotel Boutique at Grand Central. About the hotel: I had asked for fridge and microwave, there wasn’t any at the room. The room is very tiny, you can’t even open 2 bags and walk through the room. The bed is queen size (little), I was told they don’t have king size beds. When I got to my room, the USB charger didn’t work, so I’ve called front desk asking if they had an adapter because I’m from Brazil and the outlet is different, they told me they didn’t have and I had to buy one (it was past 11pm). The bathroom is walk in shower but it’s fabric curtain, I don’t like it, and it didn’t show that on the pictures. I had booked for 3 nights but after all the problems we’ve decided to change hotels, so I asked for a refund for the last night, we stayed only 2 nights and I explained all the problems I had and that I thought it was a different hotel but indeed it was Club Quarters, even though, they charged me anyway for the 3 nights. It looks like they’ve been receiving bad reviews under the name of Club Quarters, so they’ve decided to use another name (Hotel Boutique at Grand Central) to improve their rating and mislead the customers. When I left, I asked them to hold my luggage for a couple of hours, when I returned to retrieve my luggage, it took a long time to find out where they were because the recepcionist didn’t even know that the hotel has another room upstairs to storage luggage. They say they receive packages for free, but I would advice that it doesn’t feel trustable, they doesn’t look organized and the reception area is very little. Only good point was the wine at afternoon and bottle of water for free.

title: Club Quarters New York customer service
text: Elizabeth went over and beyond the call of duty to make my day as comfortable as can be. Her radiant smile projected such positivity daily it made setting off into the New York streets with a more vibrant energy. She’s so warm and personable. She’s so charming to converse with. Highly recommended stay

title: טיול בניו יורק
text:
The hotel is located in Midtown Manhattan, very close to the Grand Central Station and close to the city's tourist attractions.  A high level boutique hotel.  Express check-in.  Very spacious and clean rooms.  The great advantage of the hotel is undoubtedly the rooftop floor with views of New York City.  In addition to the rooftop floor, guests are treated with treats such as healthy snacks and good coffee.  Every day at 5 pm, until 6 PM, the hour of wine, Chris welcomes the guests with a big smile and generously pours wine, and on the roof floor there is a computer station and internet for use by the hotel guests. 

 Each floor has a stand for filling water bottles.  The hotel meets the needs of travelers in New York.  We were very pleased and definitely recommend the hotel.  And hope to be there again.  Thanks to all the hotel staff.

title: Excellent stay and great staff for our stay!
text: I came to the Club Quarters hotel for a Board of Directors meeting for 10 days. On the first day coming our whole group knew it was a great, the staff was immediately welcoming and accommodating to our large group, and worked to ensure that we had a great experience. The have a guest services manager named Chris who welcomed all of us by name, lead trivia games in their terrace and lounge, gave great recommendations for food and activities in the city, and continued to check in and do everything that was needed. Overall, a great place to stay. I definitely would come back. The picture is a view from the lounge on the top floor!

title: Great place to stay
text: Loved the hotel. Dropped our son off for an summer internship and my husband and I stayed to explore NY for a day. The location was perfect for access to what we needed. The staff was extremely friendly. Loved the rooftop terrace and snacks and wine at 5. Room and bathroom were very clean and big enough for us, we just needed a place to sleep. Bed was fairly comfortable. Only negative was loud ac unit but that seems to be just the way it is with hotel ac units, it wasn't enough of an issue to warrant mentioning it to the staff. Would definitely recommend and would certainly stay again.

title: CQ Experience
text: Such a great hotel! It was clean, very nice, and the staff was super friendly. Elizabeth is amazing and was so sweet our entire trip! The rooftop lounge and outside area is also such a great place to hang out and enjoy the view. Would definitely recommend this place to anyone.

title: Exceptional Hospitality
text:
Free wine 5pm-6pm every day. I arrived / checked in around 6:05pm and asked about the wine. Receptionist explained that they were closing up the wine but said to come back down in 15 minutes because he was having a bottle brought down for me.
This is my second stay here (over a week total) and I've had two different rooms. Both rooms had everything I needed, were clean, and felt very comfortable.

title: Great place to stay
text:
We really enjoyed our stay here, it was a great location for getting around to see all of the main sights. Rooms were on the smaller side but were clean and had everything we needed. All of the staff that we dealt with were really friendly and helpful. Also, having the living area with coffee machine and rooftop was a great space to sit after a day of sightseeing. 

One thing we didn’t like was that the room windows opened completely with no safety catch at all to restrict this, we were staying on the 24th floor so found this uneasy. We just kept the window closed, however we would expect this to be locked/restricted in some way.

title: bon emplacement mais bruyant
text: L'hotel est vraiment très bien placé  . Mais très bruyant .  Les bruits de la ville sont present tout le temps , difficile pour dormir . Les chambres auraient besoin d'un coup de jeunes et d'une meilleur insonorisation.  Le personnel est agréable mais rien de plus .

title: Nice hotel and in a good location
text: We enjoy the room size and top floor amenities room with coffee and wine. The coffee machine should be moved since it is in a corner and located in such a way that lines form as people try to do their coffee.

title: Great location, small roomsm, staff (mostly) friendly
text:
The location is great and the facilities - the terrace on 27th floor with snacks and coffee, laundry room - were excellent.
However, two things bothered me: 
1. The night shift guy that I interacted with ast the first night was rude, cold and not at all inclined to please or help. coming in tired after a long ride it wasn't a nice feeling talking to him.
2. I booked a wheelchair accessible room and got a tiny room, almost impossible to maneuver and get around. I went down and asked whether there are other, bigger rooms (specifically asked about the 2nd floor) and the rude guy from above told me they are not ADA accessible. I went to sleep with a bad feeling and in the morning asked the clerk about bigger rooms and sure enough - there were two rooms on 2nd floor which were bigger and more suitable. I was transferred to that room and they didn't charge extra.
All in all it's a good and clean hotel, but if you are a wheelchair user you need a a superior room (2nd floor). Also, the superior room was not perfectly accessible: the sink has a big peace of metal underneath that does not enable full access. The folding shower chair is located on the wrong wall so for someone who needs to sit on it it will be difficult to reach the shower handle and the water.

title: Get up and go
text: Hotel is central. Nicely appointed rooms with everything you need. Not a bad size for NY hotelroom. We enjoyed the free cuppaccino on the top floor of the hotel. The free water on every floor also came in handy.Snackbars and fruit in the morning was a nice to get.

title: Hotel well situated with very good standards
text: We really appreciated our 3 night stay in Club Quarters. Staff are helpful and very positive minded. We felt comfortable the minute we got in. Do not miss the view from the 27th floor with a glass of "happy hour" wine.

title: booksbbb
text: What a fabulous d this was.From Rey at front desk to Chris who seemed to  e everywhere.Fabulous roof deck.Rooms big enough and spotless.The vibe was a well run hotel with many returnees.Ihope to be one of these.

title: Amazing experience!
text: Wow what a great hotel this is! The central location, cleanliness, amenities and rooftop terrace already make this a really good hotel. However, on top of all that is the sensational service. Especially Tré, he truly did everything he could to make our stay even better. We are truly appreciative! Thanks CQ and thank you Tré!!

title: Centrally located
text: This is a good option for mid-town -- modern and updated. Not a lot of personality in the lobby. As a security feature, you need your room card to use the elevator. The rooms are not huge but for the price it's fine. There is a free wine mixer every night. There is another Club Quarters on the same street, two blocks away (Times Square), and apparently people frequently show up at the wrong one. So be sure to double-check the address!

title: Great and affordable midtown hotel
text: Very helpful and efficient staff, the rooftop happy hour was very welcoming, and a great way to interact with international and fellow travelers. The staff, particularly Chris, really went the extra mile. Rooms were great, I always felt safe

title: One issue
text: Enjoyed a 4 day stay in NYC... Our Club Quarters room, while compact, was very clean. Loved the bottled water dispensers and the snacks.. the only issue, and on a hot weekend s major issue, was the air conditioner only worked for a few minutes, and would shut down and just recirculate the hot air. Reported the issue after first night, wasn’t addressed. Had to prop door open to get relief..

title: Club Quarters Hotel, Grand Central wonderful place to stay
text: This is a great place to stay. Elizabeth in the rooftop lobby was a sweetheart. She recommended a place for dinner, chatted with us for awhile and even took a photo for us. The room was much larger than the other hotel we stayed at a few nights before and the yoga mat was a cool addition.

title: memorial day relaxation
text: This was my second time i stayed at the club quarters grand central.  I arrived early in the morning even though the check in was 3:00.  David Scott check if my room is available, there is a room in a high floor and early check in was $50.  I don't mind paying $50 as long as I get the room, especially a high floor room.  Also David recommend a good place for breakfast close by, it's called the comfort diner.

title: Friendly staff, great stay!
text: Had an excellent stay here. Chris (the hotel influencer) was so welcoming and engaging. He genuinely cares about you and your wellbeing. He knows everyone and they know him! They also serve complimentary wine and snacks. Highly recommend this hotel!

title: Gutes Hotel in bester Lage
text:
Das Hotel liegt um die Ecke von der Grand Central Station, von dort kommt man überall bequem mit der Metro hin.

In unmittelbarer Nähe des Hotels findet man alles was man braucht, hier gibt neben diversen asiatische Restaurants auch ein paar Diners und diverser kleinere Läden in denen man Lebensmittel kaufen kann und was man sonst so braucht.
Auch eine Apotheke (CVS) und natürlich ein Starbucks ist um die Ecke.

Das Hotel an sich ist gut, der Check in ging problemlos und schnell, das Personal ist überaus freundlich.
Das Zimmer war sehr klein und erinnerte fast schon an Hong Kong, dafür aber sauber und es war alles da was man von einen Hotel erwartet, lediglich die Minibar hätte gefüllt sein können, dies war nämlich leer.

Das Bett war sehr angenehm und wir haben sehr gut darin geschlafen wenn es auch manchmal nachts etwas laut. Zimmer mit Blick auf die Lexington Avenue, die Sirenen von Polizei und Feuerwehr sind allgegenwärtig und da helfen einfach verglaste Fenster nicht wirklich.

Was mich gestört hat das man nirgendwo vernünftig und in Ruhe rauchen konnte, zumindest im 27 Stock auf der Terrasse hätte man wenigstens einen Aschenbecher aufstellen können, allgemein sehr Raucher unfreundlich, deswegen einen Punkt Abzug.

Auch im 27. Stock gibt es um 17:00 kostenlos Getränke wie diverse Weine und man kann die Aussicht genießen.

Also kurzum, gutes Hotel und ich empfehle es weiter.

title: Messy check in
text: Modern decor and convenient location by Grand Central unfortunately did not quite make up for the messy check in.  With no lobby to speak of , when there were issues with guest checking in or checking out, the bottleneck at the single service counter turned into a long wait.  Then they could not find my reservation.  When they apparently did, they kept saying I was already checked in, which should have set off alarm bells.  They sent me to a room that had been occupied, with bed slept in and with other guests' luggage.  When I came back down to the lobby, their look was that of a deer in the headlight, and took them a while to figure out what had happened.  What a mess.  If you get a room here, you need to be careful about someone else having access to your valuables in your room.

title: excellent value for money Great team
text:
In the last two years I am staying at the hotel every month for one week (business trips). The hotel is a great value for money: clean, comfortable with lovely 27th floor launch, Gym and free laundry room. The main asset of the hotel, however, is its great team. Front desk, cleaning and maintenance all are very friendly, welcoming, efficient and professional – making you feel like home.
I am delighted to specifically mention (and sorry for the ones I have not) Sandy, Ray and the front desk team that would do their utmost to make you feel welcome. Wilkins, Antonio and Yocasta and other team members that made the hotel looks at its best. And Elizabeth that is the heart of the hotel, best customer service one can have, always happy to assist, gladly responsive to any request making you feel like the most welcome gust (hope the hotel will know how the keep and develop this most valuable  talents going forward).

title: Hotel boutique
text: Understaffed, and non attentive to customer requests. TV and air conditioning was not working. No one would answer the phone. I called for an hour straight just to get pillows for my children. Never again!

title: Great staff and location
text: The staff at the hotel were very helpful and gave great suggestions about the surrounding area. I had terrific interactions with all of the staff but especially Wilkin, Kevin and Elizabeth. The hotel is clean and in a great location. The rooms are not huge but then you have the lounge that you can go to at any time, plus it has a nice balcony.

title: great stay!
text:
Spent three nights here on a trip with my mom.  We shared a queen room, which was pretty small but efficiently used the available space.  Great shower, A/C worked great, and free wine happy hour with Chris from 5-6 on the terrace!  The water stations were also a nice amenity.  Easy access to Grand Central.  If you visit, be sure to hit up Spa45 across the street for a 1 hr reflexology massage!  

Can’t see any reason why’d id stay elsewhere on my next visit.  We booked through HotelTonight and the rate was very reasonable.

title: Great
text:
Great location, staff friendly and helpful, Chicago had slightly bigger room, and bigger coffee serves, otherwise no problem.
Not far from Times Square,  even closer to Grand Central Terminal and easy bus trip from Penn Station, or MTA.

title: How the other half lives...
text:
I recently travelled to New York and stayed at this hotel for work and then pleasure. When I holiday I usually select reasonably priced locations with breakfast. However since I didn't want to waste a day changing hotels, I stayed on. This is a detailed review as I feel it is quite expensive for a tourist who spends the day out and only needs breakfast, a shower and a bed for the night.

The carpeted room is a good size (for a single person), furnished with a large bed (queen I think - a bit too soft for my liking and the pillows were a bit lumpy), a chaise longue with a reading light, upholstered chair, matching headboard, pedestals, a table, flat screen TV, a full length mirror, wall mounted coat rack and a wardrobe. There is also a radio with a USB port to charge your phone which was a relief as I did not purchase a US plug. The duvet cover is made from a slippery material, so if you use the blanket from the wardrobe underneath, the duvet slips off. I found the air conditioning unit a bit strange, it would heat up the room and when it overshot the temperature, it would cool the room. The light switches are conveniently located at the door and below a pleasant reading lamp attached to the headboard.

The cleaning staff keep the room so immaculate, I almost forgot to wear my shower shoes! You can leave a card on the bed so that you can help conserve water by not having your beddings changed. I bring this up for the reason  below.

The bathroom is also a good size for a single person, large mirror and a wall mounted magnifying cosmetic mirror. The shower itself is stupid, you have to turn to cold water to turn the tap off, so when you're lathered up, cold water shoots out and you waste water as you adjust to find your comfortable temperature again. So I kept the tap running for my shower instead of constantly fiddling with it. There is a hair dryer provided.

There is a capsule coffee machine and coffee and tea in the room but no kettle to boil water for tea. You have to go up to the 27th floor for hot water. This bugged me as I drink 2 glasses of warm water after brushing my teeth. There is chilled water with water bottles available on every floor.

There is a gym and washing machines available for guests to use on one of the floors but I didn't use (I'm not doing washing while there's places to go!).

The living room on the 27th floor
is relaxing and you can enjoy your morning coffee while admiring the Chrysler building. It has a flat screen TV, four PCs and free internet (WiFi is free and available throughout the hotel). Breakfast beverages are available all day but there's no breakfast. In the morning energy bars and fruit are available but the station is unmanned. For two straight days, I arrived only to leave for the elevator waiting area to ring reception to send someone up to empty the grounds out of the complicated coffee machine as the other guests couldn't be bothered. In fact, another guest felt it was more productive to beat the machine than call reception.

Later in the day, the station is manned by fabulous hosts. Wasabi peas, salted peanuts sunflower seeds, pretzels, chips and my new best friend, a huge bottle of m and m's are available as well as a glass of wine at five.

The staff at the hotel from the receptionists Ashley, a thin, short young man and a tall gentleman (I didn't get their names, sorry!), to the handyman and living room hosts, Elizabeth and Chris, are utterly delightful and want to be at your service.

Ordinarily as a tourist, I would rate this type of hotel three stars because there's no breakfast and not having my own kettle was inconvenient but a cellphone charger in the room, free WiFi with excellent reception (which I needed thanks to MTN's crazy roaming charges), four PCs, a printer and exceptional staff tack on one more star.

I think, in terms of value for money, this hotel is best suited to people who are looking to escape the hustle and bustle and value their privacy.

title: Best NYC Hotel experience I've ever had
text: Excellent service from the front desk.  Hotel *PROVIDES* amenities free-of-charge (filtered water, personal laundry, etc.) without looking to nickel and dime their patrons.  Perfect for the individual business traveler.

title: NY trip
text: Excellent location right by Grand Central. Close to Times Square and theaters. Room was good sized. Liked lounge on 27th floor for coffee and fruit in the morning. Wine in the afternoon was a good amenity if you're back by 5:00.

title: Continued Satisfaction
text: As stated before, this hotel is a gem!  The staff is always attentive to your needs and any requests presented to them.  The room, clean and always comfortable.  A total joy to stay here whenever I'm in town for business.  Centrally located for my needs but also for easy maneuvering in midtown.  This time I worked with Trey and he was amazing!  Very informative and extremely welcoming.  A huge thanks!

title: Très sympathique, personnel serviable et souriant! Excellente situation
text:
Séjour de 6 nuits en compagnie d'un couple d'amis dans cet hôtel très bien situé.Déjà à notre arrivée accueil très sympathique .Nos chambres au 21ème étage étaient très confortables,calmes et très propres. Vue sur le Chrysler Building à retenir....
Au 27ème étage une superbe terrasse accessible jour et nuit et une salle  de convivialité  avec un excellent café et barres de céréales le matin.
De 17 h 00 à 18 h 00 : apéro et ambiance très conviviale : Chris est un véritable boute-en-train.
Situation idéale : à deux pas de Grand Central Station, métro (mais c'est tellement agréable de marcher dans cette grande ville...).
Je séjourne très souvent à New York et ai déjà fréquenté plusieurs hôtels très agréables mais Club Quarter Hotel dégage en plus une ambiance très chaleureuse 
communiquée par tout le personnel. 
Un tout grand merci à Elizabeth qui a pris tout le temps nécessaire pour nous dépanner à la  station "computer"  et à Hodit pour son sourire et son soucis de nous rendre notre séjour agréable.
Je pense déjà à mon prochain séjour !

title: Stay anywhere else but here
text: Horrible experience.  Never had a good nights rest.  First room was dirty and had a terrible smell, second room wasn’t much better.  Only positive comment was the lounge and the free wine every night which still didn’t compensate for the terrible room

title: Great place to stay in midtown
text: Fantastic location beside Grand Central, easy walking distance to #6 subway line. Small lobby area, but friendly staff. Rooms are small, but very well laid out, clean, and nicely decorated. Rooftop lounge is very nice spot in the morning and late afternoon. Overall, great experience and solid value!

title: Great hotel
text: Great location, staff, facilities, everything! All were very helpfull. Room was also great, clean and comfty. They kept our luggage in storage with no cost and they also receive Amazon packages for free.

title: Great location / happy hour
text: Great location, well-fitted rooms with coffee, fridge, etc. The 27th Floor is always stocked up with goodies too, which is a huge bonus. Happy Hour with Chris has to be the highlight of staying at this hotel. Great fun having drinks, unwinding, meeting new people.

title: First rate service
text: Staff were extremely  efficient, helpful& friendly, especially Elizabeth and Wilkim. Room very comfortable, and roof lounge is great.  We have really enjoyed our stay, and would recommend you without hesitation.

title: Business Trip to NYC
text: This is a very clean hotel, w/nice rooms and great amenities. The rooms are small, but in NYC I wouldn't expect anything else! It was less than a 5 minute walk from our offices in Midtown, Grand Central Station and tons of food/entertainment, I will stay here again for sure!

title: Great Time at the Club Quarters Grand Central
text:
Just had another GREAT stay at the Club Quarters Grand Central!  I have used this hotel many times before, and the staff is always so friendly and helpful.  Don't worry about room sizes, you are in NEW YORK CITY folks.  Get out and explore!  Then head up to the 27th floor lounge, where they have FREE help yourself snacks, fresh fruit, soda, and coffee available all day long.  In the morning they offer coffee, fresh fruit, and granola bars.  

Also in the lounge, every day between 5 and 6 PM, they have a FREE Happy Hour (unheard of in NYC), offering several different wines, bagged snacks, and cookies.  Grab a glass of wine (or soda or coffee), and walk out onto the open air terrace, to take in some great views of the City.  A special shout out goes to Chris who does a really AWESOME job of hosting the Happy Hour and putting on games of trivia.  He really engages the guests, and makes everyone feel welcome, relaxed, and at home.  He is truly one of a kind!  If you see him, tell him Mike says Hi!  Antonio and Liz do a fantastic job assisting Chris with the Happy Hour.  

Rey, Jillian, and Sandy at the front desk are always so friendly and pleasant that you almost feel like they are welcoming you into their own homes.  

Lastly, a very special shout out goes to Ashley.  She was so friendly and sincere that although she was not there very long, it felt like I knew her for years.  Good Luck Ashley, you will truly be missed!

title: Fabuleux
text:
Nous avons longtemps hésité avant de choisir un hôtel à New York. Il y a beaucoup de choix mais on voulait une chambre qui ne soit pas minuscule et bien insonorisée.... C'est le cas dans cet hotel! Les chambres sont spacieuses, et on est au calme. L'emplacement est idéal avec le métro à 2 mn à pied, Times square à 10 mn. 
Le personnel est adorable souriant, et très serviable.
Il y a toujours des fruits et des en cas (barres de céréales le matin, chips, friandises ...) mis à disposition au 27 ème étage, sans parler de l'apéro de 17h00 à 18h00 animé ....

A choisir sans hésitation

title: "Excelente hotel"
text:
Excelente servicio! En primer lugar, mencionar la atención del personal, fueron muy amables durante la estadía, sobre todo destacar la empatía de Rey, quien nos orientó bastante al hablar español. En segundo lugar, inmejorable ubicación. Está ubicado muy cerca de los principales atractivos turísticos, caminando a sólo 20 minutos y el sector es muy seguro y está rodeado de comercio y restaurantes.
Las habitaciones son muy cómodas y limpias. Además, destacar el servicio gratuito de snacks y agua embotellada.
Sin duda hicieron de nuestras vacaciones una experiencia inolvidable.

title: Great stay in NYC at CQGC
text: Recent week stay in NYC.  Limited NYC experience (one previous visit) but liked the Club Quarters Grand Central, especially for the location.  Easy walk to theatre district, great access to Grand Central Station and subway lines.  Very friendly staff and full of suggestions on must see plays and how to access tickets for less expense.  Very nice 27th floor common area for quests and great 5:00pm wine social.

title: Leuk hotel voor een citytrip New York
text: Dit hotel hebben wij uitgekozen vanwege de goede locatie. Op loopafstand van Grand Central Station, Bryant Park, Times Square, 5th avenue, Rockefeller Centre, Empire State etc. De kamers zijn niet bijzonder, heel basic maar schoon. Dat was voor ons het belangrijkst aangezien je er tijdens een citytrip toch niet echt bent. Het enige wat lastig was, was dat er 's nachts vrij veel lawaai was, waardoor we vrij lastig in slaap kwamen. Niet alleen de geluiden van buiten zoals sirenes etc. maar ook in het hotel was het gehorig. Wij hadden er geen ontbijt bij maar wat leuk is, is de lounge op de 27e verdieping. Je kan hier terecht voor een kop koffie en een kleine snack, de hele dag door.

title: Proprio in centro a Manhattan
text: Hotel molto confortevole con personale gentile e disponibile. Bello l'ultimo piano con servizio caffe 24h e snacks dalle 10 alle 20 con wine time alle 17. Posizione ottima per il cuore di Manhattan le cui attrazioni principali distano solo 15 minuti a piedi.

title: Clean and efficient
text: Have stayed here twice in last few months.  Although small, Club Quarters provides everything you need for a very reasonable price.  Clean environment, friendly/helpful staff responsive to any special requests, etc.  Although rooms are small, they have everything one needs and beds are comfortable.  I haven't yet had time to visit the 27th floor for the happy hour -- perhaps during the next trip.  Very much recommended.

title: Çok güzel
text: Hotelin konumu çok iyi. Odaklar temiz ve konforlu. Çok hızlı chekout. Fakat check-in çok yavaş. Çok donanımlı mutfak ve ardiye. Chicago seyahatlerimde tekrar tercih edeceğim hotel. Herşey için teşekkürler.

title: Все понравилось!
text:
Замечательный отель, останавливаюсь здесь 2-й раз. Отличное расположение и шикарный вид на Манхэттен с 27 этажа, где расположена лаунж зона. Вам не надо искать видовые террасы или рестораны, просто поднимайтесь наверх и наслаждайтесь))
Кстати, в этом же лаундже с 17 до 18 часов, каждый день проходит бесплатный wine-time. И если раньше, там просто стоял официант и скучно разливал напитки, то сейчас появился супермен Khris, который превращает wine-time в мини вечеринку). Khris,  если ты это читаешь, то знай - ты лучший)))
В общем, почти идеальный отель по соотношению цена-качество. Почти - потому что в номерах нет халатов, тапочек и сейфа. Но зато есть гладильная доска, утюг и коврик для йоги) И кофемашина)

title: El piso 27
text:
La habitación es sencilla y práctica, y de calidad. No es más de lo que se ve en la foto. Pero la experiencia es excelente. En el piso 27, tenes bebidas todo el día, café recién hecho, galletitas y gaseosas. Además a las 17 hs se genera un encanto espectacular con entretenimiento que sería más bien un encuentro para compartir. 
Es un living, una oficina , un lugar de negocios y calidez de hogar al mismo tiempo. Es encantador y difícil de describir, pero volveré al Club

title: Great Stay!
text: Was in NYC on business, and this hotel was perfect.  It is convenient to our office, a great value, and the staff is SUPER friendly.  The rooms are clean and comfortable, and there is also a great happy hour.  Shout out to Chris for making it fun!

title: Reasonably priced and convenient
text: Coming from upstate NY the Club Quarters is a quick walk from Grand Central. Usually a room is under $200 per night and a rarity for NYC. Nice free amenities such as bottled water available on each floor, 24 hour coffee and the 5 pm wine hour daily.

title: Met all expectations
text: Pleasant place and make you feel at home. Reservations were efficient and timely  A better breakfast will help. Staff at hotel were friendly and willing to help The location was ideal for me, and club lounge was a great place to chill

title: Great Stay
text: Although I was in New York for 3 days, I enjoyed my stay at the Club Quarters Hotel. I found staff to be efficient, polite and helpful. The location is great and was very happy with my room, which was super clean. The lounge on 27th Floor is also very useful for meetings etc. Will definitely stay next time am in NY.

title: Acerto na escolha
text: Hotel simpaticíssimo e moderno. Fica em um ótimo ponto de Mannhatan, bem perto da Grand Central Station. A partir das 17h, no saguão e no terraço do 27ª andar, sãos servidas taças de vinho tinto e branco. "Digrátis"!! Há compotadores para uso, também gratuito, dos hóspedes. Valeu a pena ficar neste hotel.

title: Excellent Stay
text: I had never tried a Club Quarters Hotel before, and I came away with a very favorable impression.  The room design is well-suited to a business traveler:  clean, pleasant, with a place to work.  But I was in New York on business -- not to see the sights or to lounge around in the room. Paying only for what I needed for a business trip in an environment that felt very new (not at all beat up) was right on target.  I would stay there again in a heartbeat the next time I am in New York.

title: Very courteous and customer friendly.
text:
Quality of room and food very good 
Recommended for all.
Friends,family as well as individuals all should enjoy their stay here.
Your employee particularly CHRIS was very very gentle and forthcoming to all the guests

title: Bed bugs!! Do not stay there!
text:
Do not stay at this location. 
I spent two nights and ended up with over 100 bed bug bites. Bright the critters home with me! Contacted management and was told that an inspection came back negative and that they were not able to do anything.

title: On the money for the money
text: Great location, very helpful and friendly staff, rooms are adequate - not too big and not too small. Very clean, efficient and met my needs as a business traveler. The rooftop lounge was a definite plus with coffee, tea and snacks in the a.m. and a lively happy hour with free wine from 5-6pm. No room service - but you're in NY - and can have anything delivered to the lobby or go explore! Only item that didn't go so smooth was the keyless entry on the phone - it's hit or miss at best - so just get the key card and avoid the aggravation.

title: Good option if your are looking a great place to stay!
text: The hotel in general it awesome, great services, snacks included if you are hungry in the morning, internet was great, and the bed was great! the bathroom was a big enough and modern, the only concern is if you want to have another child in the bedroom rhe sofa is very small an has to be take in consideration.... I higly recommend the hotel and probably will book there again..

title: Nice hotel
text: Exelente ubicación, buena atención, habitación cómoda, cama confortable, No cuenta con frigo bar,  deben mejorar la presión en la ducha. No hay desayuno pero cuenta con cafe, fruta y snacks. Copa de vino en la hapy hour

title: everything was perfect
text:
minibar would be appriciated, service and reception ok. 
From the hotel it is easily to walk uptown and downtown.
The grand Central is 2 minutes away.
The italian restaurant of the hotel can be recommanded
Assistance was Always avalible.
Will come back to your hotel next time

title: Great Location for Mid-Town
text: My room, 1202 corner room, was very clean and comfortable. The small kitchen unit had a nice coffee machine, fridge, microwave and utensils.  Bed was very comfortable.  Used the laundry machines and they were excellent.  Did not really use the 27th floor for refreshments but great views of surrounding area.  My only complaint was, but nothing that the hotel could do about is, that the renovation works at Bath & Body Works was extremely noisy during the night.  The huge truck stationed on Lexington was grinding all the building materials and it made a hell of a racket.  Two nights in a row until 3:30 am!  Not a lot of sleep on those nights.  Beside this, all the staff were very friendly and accommodating and I will definitely return.

title: Nice hotel in Manhattan
text: Comfy bed, spacious bathroom, great location...friendly staff ... loved the free coffee and wine.. but actually it’s not really free cuz you pay a resort fee.  Fast quick elevators.  Loacation I liked .... near grand central although most of the cafes at night were close... if you like eating in nice cafes go to Columbus ave around 60th street up.

title: Fabulous
text:
Good location is the main point of the hotel, personel, accommodation on very high level. Free snack's bar - wine, fruits, chips between 5 pm - 6 pm was a great surprise.
I strongly recommend for everyone who want to visit the New York City.

title: 立地よしコスパよしなシンプルホテル
text:
グランドセントラル駅からすぐの立地がとてもいいホテル。
ホテルも綺麗で使いやすい感じです。

シャワー、お部屋はきちんと清掃されていて、綺麗な状態でした。
部屋はそこまで広くありませんでした。
2人で利用する分には問題なし。
各階のロビーに水の冷水機がありました。
便利です。

部屋に冷蔵庫はありませんでした。少し不便に感じました。日本のホテルには冷蔵庫が基本あるため。

title: Great stay
text: Very good location in NYC, great point for my meetings , all key buildings in reach, and very friendly atmosphere, staff very friendly, 27th floor is a good concept, happy to come back on my next relevant buissness trip

title: Great Staff
text: Wonderful location and generous staff.  They made sure my daughter and I had everything we needed for a fun NYC weekend of sightseeing and theater.  And we had a great view of the city skyline from the rooftop lounge..

title: Great hotel!
text: We loved this hotel. It was well positioned for transport around Manhattan and to and from the airport. The room was very clean and of adequate size for two people for our 6 night stay. ALL staff were great, very helpful and happy. We particularly enjoyed the wine at 5pm hour, as we met and talked with lovely people from around the world. Chris, Elizabeth, Julio and Kevin were outstanding.  Chris was a marvellous host and involved everyone in the room!  We will definitely return and would recommend this hotel to our friends.

title: Great hotel in fantastic location
text: Fantastic location and great hotel, with helpful staff and speedy check in/ check out. Rooms are not overly big (but that is New York), but have exactly what you need for a trip to New York: a comfy clean bed, nice clean bathroom, a nice seating area and all the plugs and hooks in the right places. Grand Central Station is only a two minute walk away (more or less across the street) and even Rockefeller and Times Square are in easy walking distance. Also, 5 o'clock is happy hour on the 27th floor with some free wine and nibbles, with a view on the Chrysler building. Don't miss it.

title: Clean, convenient and comfortable
text: I love Club Quarters! The rooms are modern and clean; the bed is comfy and the tech accommodations are great. The front desk staff was helpful in arranging a car to the airport for me. I love the free happy hour and the constant access to coffee and tea in the lovely space on the top floor, which has nice common space and views. Would be nice to have some hard boiled eggs up there in the morning. The fruit and granola bars are nice but tough for those of us watching our carbs. ;) Also: location! All of my meetings were in Midtown and you just can’t beat the centrality of this hotel. Cheers to Club Quarters!

title: Great Hotel Great Location Great People
text: Stay here. Not inexpensive, but worth it. Very nice people, wonderful location, and a more than comfortable room. New York small, but not tiny. I thoroughly enjoyed my interactions with everyone there, and if you are silly enough to bring in a car (like I was), they have a great rate at a local garage.

title: Love the staff and amenities
text: We've stayed here many times.  The staff is so friendly and so are the guests. People even talk to each other in the elevators.  The guests are very international.  Rooms are small but efficiently arranged to utilize the limited space.  We love the upstairs 'living room' with a great view and snacks all day.  Great to relax between business and sight seeing. And Chris is a wonderful 'host' and staff member.

title: Consistently Superb!
text: New building, meticulously maintained. Extremely personable staff always helpful. Had a shower head start leaking and they had it fixed within a half hour. The 27th floor lounge is always open. Free snack, fresh fruit and great fresh-brewed coffee.

title: Good hotel, fairly central
text: This hotel is part of a chain and there are others a bit more central. That's not to say that this hotel is out of the way but it is worth bearing in mind if you have restricted movement. The hotel is clean and the rooms are a reasonable size. Plenty of hot water in the bathroom and the brilliant water cooler on the landing with re-usable bottles you can fill as many times as you want.

title: Excellent hotel and service!
text: It was amazing to stay here! Chris, Kevin, Sacha and Ashley make us feel like a family. The facilities are clean, modern and with a variety of amenities. At 27th floor they serve as a complimentary gift wine, snacks and soda! I recommend this hotel 100%.

title: Great location and value for money.
text: Great location: 5-10mins walk to Times Square and 5mins walk to Grand Central. Our room was nice, a decent size, very quiet even though it was right on Lexington Avenue, and was cleaned daily with fresh bedding and towels. Staff were very friendly and welcoming and more than happy to provide information on places to see, eat and drink. The rooftop living room on the 27th floor is a nice touch with seating, tables and most notably, a great view of NYC! Unfortunately the terrace still had it's winter cover on when we visited (April) but but we were told it's open-air in the summer. We got take out and Magnolia bakery cheesecake and ate dinner up there a couple of nights - much better views than in any local restaurant! The hotel provides complimentary soft drinks and snacks til 8pm - after that time the only option is a vending machine. Tea and coffee is available 24/7. Complimentary wine is available daily 5-6pm with hosts Chris and Paul who were very welcoming and created a good atmosphere.

title: Really Good
text:
The people that work in the hotel made the experience really good.
The location is perfect to move around subway in Grand Central.
Excellent amenities, impecable cleaning, very nice people on the reception except for Johnny, bad attitude.

title: Mkt bra hotell
text: Bra service, bra wifi. Ordnar så man slipper köpa vatten, genom att ha vattenkranar med flaskor på varje våning. Fantastisk 27 våning med gratis snacks. Gratis vin serverades mellan kl 17-18.  Elizabet gav oss exellent service och hjälpte oss mycket med vad vi än behövde

title: Business Trip
text: Up in NYC for a business trip. Hotel was nice and Terrence at the front desk lent me a tie for a meeting (I forgot to pack mine).  I will stay at this hotel again next time I am in the area. Abracadabra

title: Perfect for New York
text: The hotel is clean and ideally situated to get around New York easily. Staff are very friendly and attentive. There is free coffee and tea available 24 hrs. Free snacks available through the day and free wine between 17.00 and 18.00. Chris who did the wine@5 is brilliant and so helpful. New York is so busy and manic but we loved it. If I were to return I wouldn’t hesitate in coming back to this hotel. I’ve already recommended it to some friends. My only criticism is my daughter/granddaughters room didn’t have any drawers and only a small wardrobe so they had suitcases on the floor with their clothes in but our room had drawers in the wardrobe so we were fine. I also received the check out bill which were taxes that are stated on booking.com when I booked. Didn’t realise how much theses were going to be. $108 per room so this added another £170/180 to our room rate. Just be mindful of this when booking through hotel websites. It still may be the case if you book detect with the hotel. Also prices you see in most shops are minus the tax so beware. If you don’t do anything else while your there go to Stardust diner in Times Square. You’ll have to queue but it will be worth it. Check it out online!

title: Wonderful
text: Two employees get honourable mentioned here, Chris and Johnny were both wonderful and made our week long stay that much better.  If I knew all the employee names I would mention them all. From the front desk to housekeeping, all help their guest have a wonderful experience. The restaurant Davios is below ground and associated with the hotel. We had lunch and dinner there. We experienced exceptional service and the food was absolutely delicious.  The chef was very accommodating to my special dietary needs and restricted portion. We absolutely love this hotel and restaurant! You can not go wrong staying and eating at this place!

title: Leuk centraal gelegen hotel
text:
Zeer goed hotel. Leuke kamer met uitzicht/
Pluspunten: vlot onthaal, keukentje, heel de dag fruit; snoepjes en koffie, wifi)eadio.
Goede ligging om NY te bezoeken. Vele eetgelegenheden (markets, ...) in de onmiddellijke buurt. Central station vlakbij om eventuele uitstappen in hinterland te doen.
Prijs - kwaliteit zeer goed voor NY.

title: Outstanding Cstomer Service
text:
We just returned from an overnight stay at CQ Grand Central. We arrived before check-in time so we needed to leave our luggage with the hotel staff before venturing out.

Unfortunately we had a little mishap with a bottle of wine that broke in one of our bags. Sandy (who we left our luggage with) immediately claimed it as her fault and went above and beyond trying to remedy the situation.  She came up to our room and proceeded to look over the damage, taking pictures of everything that was affected. She offered to take all of the items with her to clean. They were returned in excellent condition within a few hours. Our room smelled a bit from this spill, so Sandy immediately got us another one. A little later on in the afternoon Chris, (the Guest Relations Manager, who is hysterical and delightful, by the way) came to our room with a bottle of wine and a nut and fruit snack. When we checked out they offered us a free night’s stay in any of their hotels. 

 I have never received such caring attention from hotel personnel before, and we travel a lot! We would have never known how excellent and confident the staff was here if something like this hadn’t happened. 

Thanks again to the hotel staff, and especially Sandy, for all of the help and attention we received!

title: Solid choice for midtown
text: I stayed at the Midtown east Club Quarters for two nights on business this week. The staff was friendly, the room clean and well laid out, and overall it was a good stay. The rooms are very small but well equipped, and the windows good enough to keep out most NY traffic noise (other than sirens).  I particularly appreciated the thoughtfully laid out bathroom that managed to provide adequate surfaces to place things, very good lighting, and a well placed mirror. Sadly, it had no ventilation (I finally figured out that the fan was broken, too late to have it fixed for my stay), which meant that the bathroom smelled strongly of bleach from the hotel's cleaning products my entire stay. The second night I discovered how thin the walls were when a small child moved into the room next door. I couldn't hear its parents, but its toddler voice just poured through (of course, toddler voices have that ability). My only other beef is with the dismal coffee set up in the hotel "living room." There was one automatic espresso/coffee machine, which meant a very long line in the morning and then it was just bad. I discovered why when I saw a staff member refilling the milk reservoir with skim milk - blech!!! Luckily there was a Starbucks and other coffee choices within two blocks, but I do think an approach to coffee such as multiple carafes with different types of milk is a reasonable norm to follow in this day and age.

title: Fantastic base for a trip to New York
text:
We had two rooms booked for our family of 5. 
A club double room and a superior room with kitchenette. The rooms were clean and comfortable, as said by others they are not big, but we found them to be fine. 
The superior room was ideal for 3, with a separated room from master bedroom with sofa bed and kitchenette with  a fridge, microwave and coffee machine. It was a corner room with great views. 
The free supply of coffee, soft drinks and snacks all day is an added bonus, as is the wine happy hour! Nice chilled water and refillable water bottles was appreciated too. 
No safe in the room but there is a safe facility in the hotel which is accessed with staff support.
The location is 5 minute walk from Grand central station, I was a little concerned before arrival that this was too far from central areas and wondered whether we should of booked nearer Times Square, but I honestly thought this gave the best location for us. It was only a 10-15 min walk to 5th Avenue and times square. We bought a subway metro pass for 7 days for $33, and used this to go from one end of Manhattan to another, it was our Best Buy of the trip!
The dining hall within Grand Central was ideal for breakfast pastries and bagels.
The hotel also has free use of pc’s and printers.
I know someone has to be on the lower floors and this is no fault of the hotel... but they are noisy!
Our daughters did manage to get moved to a higher floor as they found the noise from the air con units too much to bear! We were on the front on a lower floor so didn’t have this problem but did struggle to sleep with the constant noise from traffic, sirens and roadworks at 3am for 3 of our 5 nights here, ear plugs came in very useful!

The staff were all friendly and helpful, and we would return.

title: Staff are wonderful!
text: Chris, Ann and Elizabeth were supper helpful and fun.  Hotel was very clean.                                                                                                                                                                     Price was average for the area.  This was a great location for visiting many of the local popular sights in New York City.  Very nice.

title: Good base for exploring manhattan
text:
Simple clean room. But main thing for us was price and location and this ticked the boxes. 

5 mins walk from grand central station and approx 15 mins walk to Times Square so great location if want to be in the mixer 

Had a small queen room which are small as you expect in new york but if just looking for somewhere to sleep which is clean, secure and on a budget it tickets the boxes

Only negatives - no security boxes in rooms (are available on request on another floor in hotel) and was overcharged on my credit card (so check your bill before leaving) - was refunded afterwards when I emailed booking.com

Overall though a pleasant stay in a good location as a tourist. Would use again as couldn’t argue at price at New York standards

title: Grea Hotel
text: Great staff, nice sized room for NYC, great location, free snacks! I would definitely book a room at this hotel again. Grand Central is a couple of blocks away, easy to hop on the Subway. Lots of bars and restaurants to walk to.

title: Amazing place!
text: The hotel was incredible and super helpful with everything we’ve asked. The rooftop view is the best! Shout out to Greg Grimes at the front desk for an incredible work and such a sweet and welcoming reception. He’s one of a kind! Thank you so much :)

title: Great concept
text:
(+) Small room, but with nice furniture 
(+) Good bathroom, large shower (I prefer not having to shower in a bath tub)
(+) Silent Street
(+) Great lounge area, free drinks all day
(+++++) phenomenal happy hour concept with Chris in lounge area
(+) efficient checkin and out

title: Great stay
text:
Not fancy but clean, convenient, and a few great perks! Happy hour daily, laundry for guests and friendly all around.
Easy location to go anywhere. I walked and walked everything was available.
Thanks Club Quarters

title: First stay here and would recommend
text:
My first trip to NYC and not too sure what to expect from a city centre hotel, but have to say that I think that this hotel was very reasonable for what you get. Our greeting upon arrival was warm and friendly (as was all contact we had with the staff throughout our stay). The rooms are quite small (as are most NYC hotels), but it was well equipped with coffee machine, hairdryer, iron and ironing board. The room was clean and well presented, the bathroom the same. I felt that the room itself could have worked a bit bitter with more useful storage and a better layout - for example there was a small table with seating around which we never made use of and nowhere to store our empty suitcases. Both of these things could be easily resolved and would have made our stay a little more comfy. I guess it’s ok if you are only staying a couple of nights, but for any longer can become a little frustrating. The air conditioning was effective, the bed very comfy and for a city centre hotel I was surprised at how quiet it was and how well we slept! We didn’t hear any noise whatsoever from any of our neighbours. The gym is a great addition, and although we came with all great intentions, “holiday mode” took over and we did not use it, but the equipment there was great. The wine happy hour between 5-6pm daily was also a lovely touch. A nice place to go for a drink or two before heading out for the evening. Also great to have a little snack area for guests to help themselves to - small touches but great to have. The hotel is in a great location too, far enough away from lots of noise and people but only a short walk to Grand Central, Times Square etc so found it really easy to get around the city from there. 

Overall I would definitely recommend this hotel, and wouldn’t hesitate to stay here again next time we’re back in New York.

title: Efficient and Friendly
text: First stay at Club Quarters and impressed by efficiency and friendliness as well as environmental consciousness. Nice to find recyclable bottles and free filtered water! - Crazy how so many hotels charge for bottled water!

title: The perfect hotel
text: I am answering because now we are staying at CQ Philadelphia which dissapointed us a lot: dirty, nothing at  the living, etc. The glasses of the windows dirty, the mat dirty, the maid did not wash the two plates. At CQ Grand Central NY everything was great

title: Wonderful stay
text: Chris and Jillian were so welcoming to our family and we felt right at home.  The entire staff was wonderful during our stay.  The happy hour hosted by Chris and Anna was tons of fun.  The view from our room up and down Lexington was awesome. The rooms were nice and roomy for NYC and clean.

title: Always Amazing Staff
text: This is our third time staying at this hotel.  The location is fantastic - just a short walk to Grand Central Station.  In fact we walked all over Manhattan from here.  They have a 'Happy Hour' from 1700-1800, where free wine can be enjoyed, along with crisps and pretzels.  A supply of wasabi peas and M&Ms, plus tea and coffee, can be accessed at any time during the day for free.  The rooms are spacious, however some rooms have both a microwave and bar fridge, but other rooms have neither.  What really makes this hotel special is its staff.  Chris, Jillian and Ashley are amazingly helpful with tips on where to eat locally (and there are a large number of restaurants in the vicinity, along with supermarkets if you feel like eating in your room), and also made sure their service was personalised, and fun with every guest.

title: good business location
text: good greetings at checkin and service throughout. everything worked. nice wine reception.would have been nice to open terrace on a 75 degree day...but i understand...the next day was 50 and threatening rain

title: NY, NY
text: I stayed her force short business trip. The location was fantastic and the cost was lower than other hotels in the area. The room was clean and had plenty of electrical outlets, etc. The "loung" room on the top floor was nice and a great place to have informal meetings.

title: Great place
text: Nice place, friendly people, well located if you are looking for a place to stay (and work) in Manhattan. They have some issues with the elevators, but its sympathy and help are enough to overcome any problem you could face there. Definitly recommended!

title: Clean, well appointed room for business travel.  Great location.
text: Great location - 1 block from Grand Central Station.  Layout of the room perfect for business travel - table with room to spread out paperwork and use laptop plenty of adjustable overhead lighting.  For a small room, nicely laid out with no wasted space.

title: Perfect Placement - and snax!
text: Basic room with everything I needed, inexpensive, and perfectly located, just steps to the middle of NYC and all the sights.  Just the place to stay when you aren't just staying in the room.    27th floor snack were fun.  Thanks!

title: Great for small family... for NYC
text: A good place to stay if you've got little ones.  We had a great time and enjoyed the kitchenette.  Chris was uber welcoming and the top floor was a great place to relax with our little one.  Much appreciated.

title: Pleasantly Surprised
text: With the affordable price I had realistic expectations. However I was pleasantly surprised with the hotel. The room was clean and comfortable, the amenities were great and the location can't be beat. I think my favorite part of my experience was how friendly the staff were. I travel for work so I stay at a lot of hotels and this hotel was by far the most friendly and I not just talking about how they interact with guests but with each other. They were so kind and courteous with each other it made you feel comfortable and welcome. I will definitely be staying at this hotel again.

title: Great hotel near Grand Central
text: I found this hotel via hotels.com and felt I got a great deal at $200/night during spring break week. Great location, staff was friendly, room was comfortable. I had a glorious view of Manhattan from my 24th floor room. 27th floor commons area is wonderful with a great view of the Chrysler Building. I checked in early in the morning, and the staff was immediately welcoming. Location lets you easily access all of Manhattan from Grand Central. I had a problem with my TV not turning on one morning and it was immediately rectified.

title: Great location for exploring New York
text:
Room was reasonable size for a city and was quiet, clean and the bed was very comfortable.The hotel does not have a bar or restaurant but there are many good ones within easy walking distance.It does have an hour (5-6) with free wine on 27th floor and all day snacks ,coffee and cold water are available.
We found this to be a great location for visiting the New York sites.Recommend staying here.
Staff very friendly and helpful.

title: Annual weekend to nyc
text: Club quarters grand central is across from grand central. It is a perfect location if you plan to take metro north into the city. Just drop off you bags and walk to the theater. If you have a later train back home, you can wait on the 27th floor..drinks, snacks, comfortable chairs and a view of the city are free!

title: Great little affordable gem!
text: This was a great location, awesome staff, and amazing lounge area with views. The rooms were small, but we never spend much time there when we're traveling. This was probably my favorite place I've stayed in NYC.

title: Customer service satisfaction
text: Given the very busy schedule of UN staff and the frequency of hopping in and out to attend meetings one needs a location like Club Quarters where the staff are friendly, helpful and professional. After a busy day you need to be accosted with staff who are ready to give a helping hand and willing to go the extra mile in helping book a taxi or help you get your stuff together. The hotel rooms are also very cozy.

title: Convenient, easy, friendly.
text: Everything about Club Quarters makes sense for the business traveler:  The water bottles on each floor are great.  The rooms are fully equipped (except for a mini fridge) and well-designed for work.  The staff was very friendly and quick and ready to help with things like bag storage.

title: Great place to stay in NY
text: Everything about this place was great - staff, room, upstairs lounge with coffee and snacks, fast lifts, location 3 blocks from the UN. The staff moved me from a darker apartment to a lighter corner one, as i had to work in the room. There is a great Amish market up 45th street to buy provisions. The restaraunt Davios is pricey but good.

title: Great Hotel. Unreliable front-desk.
text:
Great location, the best hotel I've stayed in Manhattan, good for long stays (I was there 11 nights). The perks and focus on "human" details were awesome for me (free laundry room, gym, snacks, free wine, coffee, chromecast, high-speed internet)

The down side is the staff skills for something as simple as add an additional night to your stay. Bottom line, they can't do anything at the front desk. Told me all was taken care of, but double charged me, I had to come twice and what they had in their system was just a note in the comments field saying that I had another reservation, never were able to link my reservation in the system and now I'm dealing with getting my money back. 

Not the best experience after you leave, but the hotel is very nice. I've also had long stays at the Roosevelt and the Hyatt Grand Central, for me this one is not as fancy but much better, just have to really make sure the staff is well trained and can solve basic customer requests, otherwise it crushes overall satisfaction.

title: city break
text:
great hotel all staff friendly pleasant ant helpful . room clean comfortable and great kitchen area
location couldnt be better 5 minutes from airport bus stop. and main sights.lastly happy hour and lounge  relaxng after walking the city

title: Second Visit, Still Satisfied
text: The staff at Club Quarters is always so accommodating, and the facilities are beautiful (you've gotta see the rooftop!). Chris, the Wine @ 5 trivia guru is so wonderful. My only critiques are that the elevators were a little buggy with the keys, and once I asked for a rollaway bed, and it took longer than expected to receive it.

title: Fabulous Central Boutique Hotel
text: What a fabulous place. As soon as you arrive you seem to be in a giant happy bubble. Staff were very helpful and so friendly. Great location near Lexington Ave and Central station, very walkable and flat. Broadway around the corner. Lots of places to eat for all budgets. Rooms spotless and decorated beautifully, lovely light bathroom with all amenities. All so perfect. Do not forget to go to the 27th floor at 5pm for a free happy hour its great to meet other people from all over the world, or go up there anytime for coffee etc. Also a lovely Italian restaurant in the lower ground floor, delicious. We had the most PERFECT time Thankyou

title: great choise
text: great for location, cleaning and service; walking distance from theatre district, central park and really close to grand central metro stations. Beautiful rooftop terrace; definitely very good value for money

title: Great property
text: This was a great location in a really good location - for us it was easy to get everywhere on foot but being near Grand Central would be great for public transport too. The staff were all very friendly and welcoming. The snacks and coffee were great and the top floor was a nice place to relax after a long day sightseeing.

title: Wonderful Boutique Hotel
text: Very friendly and helpful staff and I loved the daily cocktail hour.  The room was comfortable and easily accommodated the three of us (two adults and one child.)  Would definitely stay here again and recommend to others.

title: Excellent New York Stay
text:
`Very nice hotel - friendly staff, clean, tidy, great location and nice to have a freebie coffee/biscuits facility on the 27th floor.

And because Trip Advisor requires 200 words per submission I need to write a few more words which you can ignore, ignore,ignore...

title: Noisy on 45th
text:
Fair room size by NYC standards.  Armoire instead of a closet and dresser.  Clean and HVAC worked.
Shower warm but marginal water pressure.  Biggest issue was the street noise at the 10th floor.  My sleep over three nights was continually interrupted.

title: My second visit to Club Quarters Grand Central
text: This is the second time I stay in CQ Grand Central. I like this hotel being in the middle of everything. Super clean rooms and friendly staff as usual. I believe next time I'll be in NY for a business I'll head right away for CQ Grand Central.

title: Amazing hotel
text:
I booked this hotel for a special birthday for my husband, and wow what a gem! David checked us in and was a complete superstar, what a genuinely lovely gentleman! He was warm and welcoming as well as being super friendly. David thank you for making us feel welcome in the big city! He even gave us some hints and tips while staying in NYC, thank you very much. 

I have travelled to New York before, and I would recommend this hotel to everyone who visits. The location is fabulous, just minutes from Grand Central Station and just up from the Chrysler Building.
