Living room au niveau 27 ou il est possible de prendre un café ou the tous les matins ainsi qu’un fruit et barre de céréales ainsi que le verre de vin de 5 à 6h le soir. Dommage qu’il n’est pas possibilité d’avoir un vrai petit déjeuner dans l’hôtel, même en supplément, cela serait appréciable.

title: Alojamiento perfecto
text: Me encantó la habitación. Reservé una habitación doble pequeña, pero no era tan pequeña como pensaba, estaba muy bien. Para 1 persona sola es más que suficiente. Limpieza perfecta. Cama súper cómoda. Vistas a Lexington Avenue. Buena insonorización, ya que no oía ruidos en las otras habitaciones y, a pesar de estar en una planta 3, el ruido de la calle no me molestaba. En la planta 27 hay un salón para descansar, con café gratis las 24 horas y snacks. Por las tardes ofrecen vino. La misma planta tiene dos terrazas muy agradables para comer o descansar. La ubicación del hotel es perfecta, a un par de minutos a pie de Grand Central Station y en el centro de Manhattan. Muy práctico para visitar la ciudad. El personal es muy simpático y agradable y solucionan tus dudas y problemas al instante. Solo hubo un par de cosas que no me agradaron, pero son poco importantes. Por una parte, no hay minibar en la habitación (aunque hay agua filtrada gratuita en cada planta, cafetera con café en las habitaciones y refrescos y café en la planta 27). Por otro lado, tuve problemas constantemente con el mando de la tv (vinieron inmediatamente a repararlo, pero al poco rato volvía a fallar). Tampoco me gustó que el aire acondicionado hace mucho ruido. Pero el hotel en general me gustó mucho y estoy segura de que repetiré.

title: Really friendly reception staff
text: Couldn’t fault the hotel itself, location is central and the price was reasonable compared to other hotels. There is a viewing floor which is great at night to look at the New York skyline. The reception staff were super friendly and an asset to the hotel. The only annoyance was that we had to put down a card when we checked in but told the money $150 refundable deposit would just be a hold on the card and not come out unless there was damage but the money did end up coming out and put back on  after a week or so. From the reviews this has happened to others so they probably need to stop telling people it is just a hold when it actually does come off.

title: My stay in Club Quarters Hotel at Grad Central
text: Hotel is located in nice area, close to my office. It is pretty good hotel, but rooms are too small.During a check in procedure, they took my personal card for the reservation, and somebody charged it, instead to charge our business card. The invoice has been issued with a business credit card number, but my personal credit card has been charged, so I had to call them in order to fix it... It was unprofessional and unacceptable.

title: Clean, modern room for a decent price
text: We needed to stay in the Grand Central area for a morning appointment. Based on the reviews, I choose Club Quarters Hotel. It was a good hotel. There was someone to greet us in the lobby, the room was modern and clean, it was quiet so that we slept well, and they offer a roof top lounge with drinks and small snacks, etc.

title: A decent hotel in NY
text:
Let's face it. Hotels in NY are expensive. It took me a few weeks to finally decide on one and we choose the Club Quarters Hotel at Grand Central. 
Location: We liked how this hotel is so close to the Grand Central station and hence it was easy to get around to most parts of NY. There's also many eateries nearby and the Grand Central station itself has bakeries and a food court. We could also walk to nearby attractions like Bryant Park and the NY Public Library. SAKS fifth ave and Rockefella Center would be about a 10-15 min walk away. 
Rooms: We travelled as a family of 4 and we were given the biggest room which was the one bedroom suite with kitchenette. It comes with a sofa bed, a small dining table with 2 chairs and a tiny kitchenette with a sink and a microwave. There is no stove in this type of room configuration. It was quite a tight squeeze for us but it was manageable. The bed was comfortable and housekeeping did a good job too. My only gripe was that the room on the 7th floor was noisy. Not only did the sirens from the police cars and fire trucks kept me away at night but the heater in the room as well. It was noisy and loud and it made me feel like I was staying in some crummy hotel. 
Other than that, service was good and the staff were all very polite and helpful. If you don't wish to splurge on expensive accommodation in NY, this would be a good choice.

title: Nice!)
text: It was really nice choice of the hotel for vacation! Recommend my friends to stay at this hotel!Close to all amenities.Very helpful team.Your rooftop is amazing idea: view, snacks, work place. And Chris)

title: Muy buena ubicación y servicio
text: La ubicación es muy buena, cerca del metro (algo menos de 3 cuadras), cerca de 5ta avenida y de time square. El proceso de check in y check out es muy ágil y los servicios del piso 27, para tomar  una cafe, un te , una bebida o una copa de vino  en un espacio amplio y confortable, permiten un corte en la jornada sin estar en la habitación. También es muy bueno para quienes necesiten ir por trabajo.

title: Great staff
text: Staff was super friendly, very convenient location, gym was good for a small hotel, picked a smaller room which was fine for business, fast check in and check out, running out of things to say to hit 200 characters...

title: Great NYC Experience
text: As others have said, the staff was amazing.  The rooms are smaller, but that is NY.  In a loud busy city I got a great night sleep every night.  I wish I had more specifics, but everything was just really nice.  The room was clean, the bed comfortable, good water pressure.  It was convenient to transportation and short walks to the sites I wanted to see.  I would absolutely stay here again if I’m in NYC.  There are also great food options around.  Lastly, they have the top floor as a club floor and it is a nice touch.

title: Recommended
text: Staff makes you feel very welcome. The are efficient and helpful with anything you need. The location is excellant. Rooms are clean and well kept. The only problem was the layout of the room was crowded for the small space. I liked the snacks on the 27th floor and appreciated the water stations on every floor.

title: Convenient and comfortable overnight in NY,NY
text: The Club Quarters Hotel was located near Grand Central on E 45th St. The room was small but comfortable and very clean. Very nice for quick overnight stay. The employees very nice and helpful. My only suggestion would be to have some sort of night light. When we left bathroom light on, it lit the bedroom because of translucent window in the door. Had to turn light off and than had trouble finding our way around in the dark Otherwise, very nice

title: very relaxing stay at Club Quarters Grand Central
text: While the rooms are small they are very well laid out. Nice size bathroom with marble shower but no tub. Very good water pressure and adjustable jets. Bed was comfortable but mattress may have been approaching is useful life. Getting off the bed you could feel the coils. Unlimited water bottles and variety of free snack is a really nice set of perks. very nice size wall mounted TV but remote a bit difficult to use on apps. Nice plush towels and really good toiletries. Microwave and mini fridge in room. Super helpful and friendly staff. I needed assistance crossing the street to get Tylenol and the guy at the front desk guided me across and held an umbrella for me, since it was raining.

title: Fantastic location, good rooms and excellent staff.
text: Arrived with a red-eye from LA. A pleasant surprise was that there was a comfortable and quiet room waiting for me. The rooms are compact but nice and the location is really good for exploring Manhattan.

title: FinancialDiva
text:
ELIZABETH is amazing. Greeted us the first day. Want to take her back to Oklahoma!
Been here 5 days...she is the only one we, my husband and I, know by name and she knows us and everyone else from the around the world by name. 
She should have her own hotel, spa, etc.
Victoria Woods, Owner ChappelWood Financial Services. 
405 348-0909
Victoria@ChappelWood.com

title: Great hotel in a great location!
text:
I stayed here for five nights with my husband.  We originally booked this hotel when it was Hotel Boutique (or prior to Club Quarters taking Hotel Boutique over) so there was some confusion when the taxi dropped us off as noone had informed us but it was a great stay.

Staff - all very friendly and helpful - they always checked that you were ok and wished you a great day/night, we had great recommendations for cars/taxis which saved us money! 

Room - this was spacious for a New York room and given we were only on the 10th floor it was very quiet and we slept really well. We were also located quite near the lifts but were not disturbed at all by them or any guests. 

Hotel - location is great and right in the middle of Manhattan making most tourist attractions within easy walking distance, it is also located close to Grand Central so getting the subway is easy. So many food options surround the hotel too. The hotel adds great value for money with the free wine and drinks every day along with free soft drinks and snacks all day, use of computers and printers and a lounge/balcony area with views of the Chrysler Building. For a small gym room it had a good mix of equipment meaning you could get a good workout in and quite a few people could fit in all at once.

Overall, we had a really great stay and would recommend this hotel for anyone coming to New York.

title: Great Hotel in Perfect Location
text: I have stayed in several NYC hotels and had a great experience here. It is now my #1 place to stay. The hotel is only a couple of blocks from Grand Central Station and an easy walk to Rockefeller Center. The room was very clean and roomier than most in the city.

title: Overall a good place just could use some tweaks
text: I stayed here over the last five days and overall had a good experience: comfortable, big bed and firm but comfortable pillows; sockets right by the bedside; an adequate room size; a wardrobe; toiletries; very good soundproofing from the urban jungle outside. A large flatscreen with a decent enough range of channels. Plus a happening happy hour from 5-6pm every day with free wine (a solid, dry white wine from the North Fork included) and snacks (SO yummy granola) and fruit (apples, oranges, pears). But then there are the cons: the lack of a room minifridge is SO ANNOYING. You can leave food with the reception to put in the staff fridge but it’s really trying to have to ask for it each day or night. There’s plenty of room in the room for such a minifridge. The WiFi is also not great: it cuts out here and there and at times made it hard to work in the room. Finally the staff made made me grit my teeth sometimes. I guess they’re trying to be hip and cool but it came across as unprofessional at times: with their jaunty behavior, playing hacky sack in the lobby and the braying guy giving out wine. Maybe I’m just too fuddy-duddy. Finally, the key card system is finicky in the lift and often doesn’t connect you to the floor you want.

title: Very pleased with my stay!
text: Nice property, in a great location. Came on a family trip and it was perfect. The staff was nice and helpful. Rooms are nice sized. Included: smart tv, gym, community washer & dryer, and lounge area on top floor. Highly recommend.

title: Another Great Stay!
text:
This was our 3rd time staying at this location and it was a great stay!  Our room was a club-sized room, which is a little smaller than the standard room, but fine for our needs.
It was overlooking Lexington and on the 3rd floor, but we were so tired the street noise really wasn't an issue. It was neat, clean, and in good shape. I would like to compliment the staff as a whole.  Check in was super fast and easy, everyone was pleasant and very friendly.  The staff appears to love their jobs in the way they interacted with guests.  Chris was hilarious!  On our last 2 stays, the lounge didn't have happy hour, but now it does, which is a nice addition.  Chris mingled with guests and was a superb host. Thank you!
I would make some suggestions regarding housekeeping.  It would be great if at least a couple of additional towels were stocked automatically.  We had 2 bath towels, we were 2 guests, and when I asked for 2 extra they were quickly delivered. I left a note the next morning to please leave us an extra and housekeeping did. 
On our last night, the tv would not turn off. A tech came up and looked at it, touched something, and the tv went off.  In a few minutes, the tv came on again on it's own, and we called back.  The tech came up, pulled out the wires and just totally unplugged it so we could get to sleep. We did make sure upon check out that the staff knew that the cables were out because there was an issue.  
We had a late flight so we hung out in the lounge area until it was time to leave.  We enjoyed conversation with Chris again, and some of the other staff members who were preparing things for a gingerbread making party upstairs.  
Thanks for another great stay!  We are looking forward to next year's trip.

title: Well situated but bed needs upgrade
text: The rate is very competitive for NYC so expectations were not to high. Was pleasantly surprise that it’s a full service hotel that gathers well for short overnight stays in NYC. However was extremely disappointed in quality of bed.

title: Happy, hospitable hotel
text: Great hotel for the price and position.  Check-in was easy.  Great common room on the 27th floor. Happy hour and snacks very much appreciated. Ashley at the front desk was extremely  helpful with a business matter for me. The Happy Hour Host is great. All the staff are pleasant.  Rooms are just fine, mine had a refrigerator and microwave. Free wifi,  The position of the hotel is fantastically central. Will stay here again. Highly recommend.

title: Place for Overnight Stay on Business Trip
text: Overall, this was an enjoying place to stay the night while on a business trip to a company nearby on 3rd Avenue. A little bit on the expensive side for the amenities offered, but good enough compared to the other hotels.

title: NYC Trip
text: Club Quarters has been my go to hotel in NYC for years. It doesn't have bells and whistles but the staff is excellent and accommodating, the rooms are clean, the amenities are great and the location is perfect. It was our first time staying at Grand Central, we usually stay closer to Rockefeller Center but we will definitely book this location next time! Cheers to the staff and the hotel

title: CQ Grand Central
text: Good location but few amenities. There is no real breakfast location - it is an Italian restaurant in the basement with a limited menu and no congenial place to meet or even eat. The rooms ae clean,, but Spartan. This is a place to sleep...period.

title: Bathroom in terrible condition
text: Shower head not working, the tap was broker, it was a nightmare to take a shower, the water was spraying to the ceiling, it was either cold water or strong stream of hot water.When I told the manager, the was like "OK, you are leaving anyway"

title: Great Midtown Location
text: Address is perfect base for walking to everything one needs to do in Midtown and steps from Grand Central with subway lines to where ever else you need to go. Speedy check-in and check-out.Friendly Staff was very accommodating to roommate who arrived hours earlier than me although reservation was in my name. Kitchen area and bathroom in our studio were modern and clean. I did not cook but appreciate having fully-equipped kitchen and option.

title: Ottima scelta
text: Hotel in ottima posizione vicino a Stazione Grand Central. Da qui si raggiungono a piedi diverse attrazioni e la fermata della metro e’ vicinissima. La hall è praticamente inesistente, ma il personale che si occupa del check in è giovane e gentile. Le camere sono abbastanza spaziose. Belli gli affacci (noi eravamo al sedicesimo piano). Buona la pulizia quotidiana. Il 27esimo piano è impagabile: è una living room con poltroncine e tavolini, oltre che postazioni con MAC a disposisizione e  stampante, macchina per caffè ( americano ma anche ottimo espresso), cappuccino, ecc. barrette per la colazione, frutta, vino e stuzzichini salati dalle 17 in poi. Un bell’albero di Natale completava il tutto. Check out veloce e senza alcuna sorpresa. Il giorno della partenza ci hanno tenuto in deposito i bagagli fino alla sera. Insomma, un’ottima scelta!

title: OK, but noisy for the price
text: The room itself was fine; large for a NYC hotel. But the street noise was horrible. I was given a room on the second floor, so was awoken each morning at 4 a.m. for trash pickup. I could also hear train-track noises, presumably from Grand Central.
